  • Create and manage training programs for system and tools ensuring team members know how to leverage the solutions to meet their objectives and streamline their work.
  • Develop and maintain strong internal relationships, nurturing an enablement environment where team members look to you for solutions to streamline their work and improve overall program performance.
  • Advocate for solution and process adoption across the group, partner with leaders and team members to infuse solutions into their work and make improvements in marketing data and measurement.

Key Requirements

  • You have a degree in Marketing, Business Administration or related field
  • You have prior experience in a similar role
  • You have good knowledge and hands on with SEO, data analytics, social media marketing, email marketing, CRM, marketing automation and digital marketing analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Tableau
  • Excellent analytical and project management skills
  • You have excellent written & verbal communication skills.
  • You are a creative thinker and problem solver.
  • You thrive in matrix environments and are adept at building relationships with different stakeholders.

display_title: Risk Advisory - Tips-Offs Anonymous - German Speaking Contact Centre Agent
job_description:
Company Description


Deloitte is a leading global provider of audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, tax and related services. Our global network of member firms and related entities in more than 150 countries and territories (collectively, the “Deloitte organization”) serves four out of five Fortune Global 500® companies. Learn how Deloitte’s approximately 312,000 people make an impact that matters at www.deloitte.com.

About the Division

The value that Deloitte Risk Advisory Africa creates for organisations is synonymous with operational excellence. By understanding decision-makers’ roles to maximise analytics value, Deloitte Data Analytics turns everyday information into useful and actionable insights.

Deloitte Forensic professionals are a diverse group with a wide and varied range of proficiencies, comprising forensic accountants, legal and law enforcement specialists, and business intelligence experts, all utilising state-of-the-art forensic technology.


Job Description


Main purpose of Job

Under minimal supervision, to provide inbound and outbound telephonic services to internal and external clients subject to the requirement/s of the client SLA, TOA controls and processes and specific project/s you, as the agent, may be allocated to.

Key Performance Areas:

1. Strategic Impact

  • Completes a variety of standard tasks that impact delivery of the broader team in relation to the overall strategy of the service area
  • Positive impact on broader team

2. External/ Internal Client Impact

  • Performs a variety of inter-related tasks that impact on the efficient delivery of the team to the client (internal / external)
  • Produces timeous and accurate work in support of the broader team’s delivery
  • Raises issues promptly that may impact broader delivery
  • Work is accurate and on time

3. Operational Effectiveness

  • Maintains close focus on timelines and accuracy ensuring quality of delivery of the role
  • Mitigates the risks that are inherent in the role through good attention to detail and compliance with client SLA, together with TOA and firm controls, policies and procedures
  • Provides wrap-up reports to superior
  • Adapts tasks, varying in nature, to the requirements of the team / business ensuring timelines are still achieved
  • Quality outputs that meet deadlines
  • Accuracy negates risk of output
  • Quality reporting
  • Business requirements are achieved

4. Development/ Growth of Team (Detail applicable to role)

  • Actively works to address identified development areas
  • Visible attention to own development

5. Budgets/ Profitability

  • Effectively uses time, equipment and resources
  • Accuracy of financial records

6. Specialiased Competencies

  • Provides inbound telephonic services to client’s subject to the requirements of the TOA procedures, systems, and client SLA’s.
  • Adherence to all relevant legislation, e.g. PDA/POPI and TOA controls and processes implemented to protect confidentiality of information provided by whistle-blower and to minimise risk to TOA and its clients
  • Ensure that all information obtained from caller has been accurately and timeously compiled in a wrap up report, in line with reporting requirements and TOA processes
  • Matters escalated and guidance sought where necessary
  • Effective and accurate provision of feedback to callers as required
  • Accurate timeous and professional support with ad-hoc TOA projects as required and directed
  • Accuracy and quality of translations received within SLA and in accordance with TOA processes and associated requirements


Qualifications


Minimum Qualification

Matric

Desired Qualification

3 Year Diploma, preferably Forensic and or Call Centre based qualification

Minimum Experience

2 - 3 years working experience in a customer services orientated position is a prerequisite for this position. An excellent command, i.e. 100 % fluency Dutch, English and German is a necessity

Desired Experience

2 - 3 years working experience, preferably in a contact centre would be an advantage

All official ethnic languages of South Africa are offered. Fluency in any other SA official ethnic language or foreign language would be preferred and would be an advantage


Additional Information


At Deloitte, we want everyone to feel they can be themselves and to thrive at work—in every country, in everything we do, every day. We aim to create a workplace where everyone is treated fairly and with respect, including reasonable accommodation for persons with disabilities. We seek to create and leverage our diverse workforce to build an inclusive environment across the African continent.

SC Johnson has an opportunity as Global Sales Graduate

Location: Maxwell Office Park 37 Magwa Crescent Midrand Waterfall 2090 South Africa

Are you a student or graduate looking for a professional challenge and would like to start a career with a well-known global player in the consumer goods industry?

Then get in the fast action and join us at SC Johnson!

ROLE SUMMARY

The purpose of an internship is to provide real-world experience that enables the intern to put everything he/she learned into action. An internship can help the candidate gain skills that can be applied to future jobs. Intern will have the chance to learn valuable work skills and gain useful work experience in diverse areas such as sales, marketing, finance, account management, and supply chain through the assigned tasks to him/ her.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • In this position you will have hands on experience working within our sales team. You will have exposure to the following key areas; Business Analytics, Executing Promotional Strategy, Retailer NPD process and General Account Management.

  • Supporting Promotional Strategy both internally and externally from forecasting to retailer promotional forms.

  • Working closely with Marketing and Category Management to recommend new ranges to the retailer and submit the retailer forms in the New Line process.

  • Gathering, interpreting and sharing insights on promotional activity and NPD listed within the accounts.

  • Collating and preparing data, presentations, materials needed for meetings with Buyers and Top-2-Top meetings.

  • Working alongside customer marketing in the organisation and preparation of brand days.

  • Supporting the account manager within the internal planning process with forecasting, financial promotional planning and financial accrual process.

PROFILE

Your commitment and desire to develop will make a difference!

Educational qualifications:

  • Degree in Marketing/Sales related field

Skills:

  • Adaptability

  • Values others, and cultures

  • Self-starter and acts with integrity

  • Strong Computer skills (Microsoft Office)

  • English Proficiency

WHAT WE OFFER

We offer an excellent opportunity for career development and progression, a highly collaborative work environment, and an autonomous and flexible working culture where you will be able to add value and be recognized and rewarded!

You need to be eligible to work in the country of application.

ABOUT SC JOHNSON

SC Johnson is a fifth-generation family company built on a spirit of adventure and winning the right way. We have been leading with purpose for over 130 years, building top brands such as Raid®, Glade®, Kiwi®, OFF!®, Windex®, Ziploc® and more, in virtually every country. Through these household names, we are making a positive difference to the world around us. But we only succeed with the combined vitality and strength of our 13,000 people who we truly value and support in their pursuit of individual and shared goals.

Together, we are creating a better future – for the planet, for future generations and for every SCJ team member. Come join us and make an impact through iconic global brands. GO FURTHER WITH OUR FAMILY™

#LI-DNI

As a Change Manager, you'll be responsible for ensuring all projects follow the correct change control process. You'll ensure that changes to the project are communicated and carried out in accordance with these policies. You will need to be comfortable working on multiple projects at once, as well as deal with sensitive or complex issues such as conflict resolution.


Requirements


  • Responsible to drive faster adoption, higher ultimate utilization of changes, and proficiency with the changes that impact employees who must use the changes across the MAH business
  • Responsible to coach senior leaders and executives and help them fulfil the required changes across the business
  • Responsible to support and coach managers and supervisors to help their teams transition through the changes that occurs across the MAH business. Demonstrates expertise in change management practices with a strong focus on program, project and system governance
  • Responsible for managing, monitoring and supervising changes to business processes and systems, technology, job roles, and structures within the business
  • Manage and facilitate key engagements with all impacted staff members ensuring that adequately prepared to adopt and embrace change
  • Plan and ensure that all change projects are implemented on time, with quality and within budget
  • Leverage structured methodology and lead change management activities, processes and tools to create a strategy to support adoption of the changes required by a project or initiative
  • Prepare, plan, design and management of all key communication strategies and initiatives
  • Conduct the change impact analysis, assess change readiness, and identify key stakeholders
  • Support training efforts by providing and facilitating the design and delivery of training plans and programs
  • Support organizational design and restructuring of roles and responsibilities that’s driven through the business changes
  • Plan, evaluate and ensure user readiness driven through business changes
  • Conducts international and competitor research to understand and to identify adoption of business trends
  • Consult with staff members to identify and manage anticipated resistance
  • Ensure non-core team employees and end-user perspectives are incorporated into the design of the system and process changes
  • Ensure that System usage and adoption targets are achieved
  • Support integration of change management activities into project management plans and activities
  • Foster and demonstrate a workplace inclusive of creating opportunity, serving others, building trust, innovation, and exceeding expectations
  • Escalate unresolved issues that hinder program Transformation
  • Develop and manage relationships with various stakeholders and communication channels in the organization
  • Manage relationships with subject matter experts to make sure content is accurate
  • Accountable for delivering content assets that are accurate, timely, high-quality and to the group and business unit style across MAH
  • Ensure that change management strategy aligns with overall company goals and vision
  • Advise and engage management on the set targets and associated business rules Provides guidance on successful change control processes, initiates and facilitates enhancements to existing processes as needed
  • Maintains records of changes initiated by the organization, organizes the change log for inclusion in updates to the change control procedures manual, and is responsible for updating the manual as necessary
  • Conducts a pre-requisite review of change request documentation, identifies and justifies expected change within environment
  • Monitors compliance of change requests with corporate policies and standards


Qualifications


  • Bachelors degree in Business Administration or related field required
  • Bachelor’s degree in Human resources, business administration, Communications or Project Management related qualification and/or equivalent work experience preferred
  • Organisational or IT change management qualification preferred
  • A relevant Post Graduate qualification would be advantageous
  • 5 years’ relevant work experience related to project management, change management, ERP implementations, communications, and/or large-scale organizational change efforts
  • Thorough knowledge of, and experience in, change management principles and methodology
  • Proficiency in business management, statistics, analytics, Project and Change Management skills are imperative
  • Experience in large scale transformational projects/Initiatives
  • Relationship Management
  • Risk Management

Jun 21, 2023 | BI Analyst, Data Analytics, Information Technology (IT)

Job Role

  • Consult and provide Technical solutions to meet Group requirements, improve System performance and address chronic issues.
  • Guided by Architecture and other Technical Leads, you be responsible for establishing new Technology components and reusable solution patterns that can be leveraged by business-facing development teams in their day-to-day solutions.
  • Must be an IT specialist with advanced analytical and technical skills, who is able to communicate Technical information to technical teams and be competent in communicating challenges and solutions to project and operational leadership.

Responsibilities

  • Work with the architects (i.e., Application, Infrastructure, Security, and other architects) to ensure a sustainable platform that meets the business needs of the future.
  • Establish a consumption tool centre of excellence.
  • Form relationships and orchestrate delivery with key technical stakeholders across our business including architects.
  • Engage with technology vendors and external technical experts when conceptualising, designing, or implementing technical solutions.
  • Ability to create efficient best practices and establish suitable processes to ensure effective environment and solution management.
  • Provide technical leadership for the consumption tool teams.
  • Put in place best practices and processes to ensure platform stability and performance.
  • Work with the consumption tool teams on monitoring and other requirements.
  • Ensure security is implemented according to Group’s security standards through regular reviews.
  • Make business stakeholders aware of the comparative analysis across the consumption tools.
  • Evaluate consumption tool releases and new product features.
  • Interact with development teams and provide guidance, best practices and industry standards to enable good report and dashboard development.
  • Design, document, and communicate technical solutions that deliver on business requirements.
  • Constant refinement to standardize and implement new functionality based on experience and lessons learnt.
  • Troubleshoot technical issues such as database non-performance, integration failures and code failures.

Requirements

Qualifications

  • Grade 12
  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, Engineering, or another quantitative field / National Diploma in an Information Technology related discipline preferred.

Experience

  • 8+ years related experience
  • Development experience in BI with a solid background in SQL, Application, and Information architecture.
  • Solid Agile development experience.
  • Performance Tuning Experience
  • Proven track record in working with Architects, BI developers and end users.
  • General working experience in Financial Institutions is recommended.
Knowledge
  • Understanding of Standards, Best Practices, procedures, and Key Metrics to enhance operational and Platform Stability.
  • Familiarity with the use cases, business purposes and quality of the data.
  • Understanding of SDLC, Code management / Standards / Re use, Release Management, Project Management, and API integration.
  • Understanding of Multitenancy
  • Proficient in SQL and MDX (Critical)
  • Exposure to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) will be an advantage
  • Exposure to SAP HANA, MS SQL and DB2
  • Knowledge of other consumption tools (i.e., Business Objects, Qlikview, QlikSense, Power BI and Domo) will be an advantage.
  • Application and Analytics background with a solid background in SQL is required.

CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.

What does that mean for you? You’ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You’ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You’ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our
Hybrid Work Model
.
Job Description
CHEP is currently seeking a skilled Efficiency Analyst - Service Management to join the team! The successful incumbent provides planning, direction, analysis, management, implementation, and administration of IT Service Management (enterprise-wide) in collaboration with key technology partners and suppliers, both internal & outsourced. Drives a culture of positive change within the Service Management function – having a clear and direct focus on Service Performance, Quality and Governance.
Quality Leadership
  • Ownership for the creation, management and optimisation of the quality framework for IT Service Management and the management of IT vendors
  • Drives process optimization and quality IT service delivery through automated processes, tools and data analysis.
  • Liaises with Managed Service partners and IT Tower leads to drive efficiencies and reduce costs using best ITIL practices within the IT resources (people, processes and technology)
  • Supports Service and Tower Leads, other Infrastructure Leaders and their teams with improving the performance, quality and efficiency of their assigned services
Quality Leadership
  • Ownership for the creation, management and optimisation of the quality framework for IT Service Management and the management of IT vendors
  • Drives process optimization and quality IT service delivery through automated processes, tools and data analysis.
  • Liaises with Managed Service partners and IT Tower leads to drive efficiencies and reduce costs using best ITIL practices within the IT resources (people, processes and technology)
  • Supports Service and Tower Leads, other Infrastructure Leaders and their teams with improving the performance, quality and efficiency of their assigned services
Service Performance Leadership
  • Assists in the function for management of service performance and driving improved resource efficiency and overall optimisation
  • Manages standards for service documentation, which includes, but is not limited to, policies, processes and procedures
  • Sets the standard for changes to and deletions of existing services and the introduction of new services
  • Develop measures and benchmarks suppliers’ performance
Governance Leadership
  • Assists in the governance of the contracts, services and overall relationship with the vendors – with ownership of the reporting, performance and oversight measures for each agreement
  • Drives the governance framework evolution and works across the organisation to drive improvements
  • Oversees that IT Service Delivery services are provided in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Outsourcing Agreements, and are tightly integrated with services provided internally as well as those provided by other Third-Party providers
  • Ensures that implementations and on-going services are delivered on time, and meet enterprise requirements by maintaining tight controls over project schedules, risks, scope of work and budget
  • Engages in end-to-end dispute resolution and pursues SLA credits
Operational Management
  • Provides oversight for the IT Service Management tools (ITSM) including Configuration Management Data Base (CMDB) to reduce impacts related to incidents, problems, and changes; improving service availability and capacity management
  • Help to resolve escalated issues in accordance with dispute escalation procedures
  • Drafts policies, streamlines processes and ensures that knowledgebase is up-to-date
  • Supports IT projects and initiatives within the remit of this position
Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree - Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field
  • IT Service Delivery experience demonstrating a combination of directly managing technical teams, plus relevant technical background including deep expertise in at least two domains (e.g. hosting, storage, networks, desk-side support, service desk).
  • Thorough understanding of ITIL Service Management
  • Solid experience in data analytics and reporting
  • ITIL 4 qualification
  • Previous or current technical certifications
  • Experience in Six Sigma, LEAN, etc. process efficiency and quality methodologies
  • 5+ years IT experience, with at least 2-3 years technical experience
Skills / Knowledge:
  • Intermediate level user and technical support skills related to Microsoft Office Suite
  • Advanced Budget and Financial Management
  • Advanced Written and Oral Communications
  • Customer Service mindset
Preferred Education
Bachelors - Computer Engineering
Preferred Level of Work Experience
3 - 5 years

Are you passionate about sustainability and the retail industry? Our esteemed client, a leader in the retail industry, is seeking a talented and motivated UX Manager to head up and build out their new data and analytics division. This is a unique opportunity to be part of a company that prides itself on sustainability and curating purposeful products, with a vision to be the most responsible retailer in the world.

As the UX Manager, you will play a strategic role in our client’s data and analytics use case solution team, providing valuable input to drive business goals. You will lead UX initiatives, identifying opportunities for improvement and providing guidance and direction to our UX and UI designers on solutions, wireframing, and prototyping. In addition, you will be responsible for managing the design system and building effective relationships with suppliers and 3rd party partnerships.

To be successful in this role, you should have a relevant degree and 8-10 years of experience in UX management. You should be passionate about how data and analytics can impact and improve businesses, and have a keen eye for detail in creating exceptional user experiences.

Join our client’s innovative team and be part of their mission to create a more sustainable future while pushing the boundaries of data and analytics in the retail industry. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a company that is making a difference. Apply now and be part of our client’s exciting journey towards being the most responsible retailer in the world!

Do you enjoy supporting the development of young talent? Are you a good relationship builder? Do you want to be on the frontlines of a global movement that will transform youth leadership development? Would you like to work with a diverse team of innovative and dedicated doers? Would you say communication is one of your superpowers? Are you keen on discovering new levels of personal and professional excellence?

Well, this might just be the job for you!

ABOUT US

In 2035, Africa will have the largest workforce in the world and will need to catalyse transformation by empowering its largest untapped resource - its people. Fuelled by this, the African Leadership Group is an ecosystem of institutions with a shared vision to harness Africa's abundant human capital and transform the continent and the world by selecting, developing, and connecting 2 million young leaders to opportunities by 2030. ALG was founded over 15 years ago by Fred Swaniker, a serial entrepreneur recognised by Time Magazine as one of the 100 most influential people of 2019. ALX and The Room are two brands of the African Leadership Group.

ALX is our training arm, focused on developing skills for the fourth industrial revolution (software engineering, devops, data science, etc.) to ensure that Africa is able to compete effectively as the world undergoes a digital transformation. To cement this, through our legal entity African Leadership International (ALI), we have signed an agreement to acquire Silicon Valley based Holberton Inc. – a project-based, college alternative educating the next generation of software engineers. This will give us ownership of the advanced technology program that will enable us to provide global organizations access to significant untapped pools of talent that can bridge the growing global shortage of technology talent. For more on this, please read this article here.

The Room our talent placement arm, is a community that our young talent join to access global work opportunities. To learn more about us, please read this article about why we launched The Room & this article about the impact of our development programs on African youth. View this pitch deck to see how we present ourselves to employers.

ABOUT THE JOBURG RECRUITMENT TEAM

The Joburg Recruitment Team is responsible for the promotion of the ALX programs to potential students responding to the various programs in real time. We are the on the ground human touchpoint in the application process and therefore play a crucial part in reaffirming the tone and strengthening relationships that will constitute a sticky community moving forward. The mandate of the team is to gather and offer insights to identify which of the programs would best suit a potential candidate based on their interests. We set out to engage and develop partnerships with the purpose of maximising conversion of leads to candidates as securing strategic partnerships within specific markets drives our ability to access talent pools. In pursuit of our mission, we encourage creativity, experimentation and collaboration. We embrace risks and treat failure as an opportunity to learn and improve. We seek those that have a beginners' mindset, are lifelong learners, thrive in uncertain circumstances and uncharted territory, and have a deep passion for youth engagement.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are selecting and training high performing young people across various programs. Our flagship program is our Software Engineering training in partnership with Holberton School. In addition to this, we train and develop talent in other verticals, such as Salesforce administration, Data analytics, Data Sciences and AWS Cloud practitioners.

As a Student Recruitment Intern, your primary task is to support our prospects to become applicants. You will do so by, advising and guiding them through the application process. You will need to have a deep understanding of our programs in order to sufficiently identify and recommend the programs that each candidate is best suited for, think not just conversions but right fit and high quality!

As a Student Recruitment Intern, your role will include:

  • Event support: conducting general event coordination and liaison tasks to ensure success such as adequately tracking registration numbers and invoice handling for processing and payment to vendors.
  • Application support: provide guidance and support proactively correspond with application starters and provide real time support to aid them in completion of the process. The data garnered from these communications will go towards informing marketing and program selection efforts.

Your KPIs will be:

  • Time to source qualified candidates
  • % of qualified candidates converted to applicants

REQUIREMENTS:.

  • A bachelor's degree or post secondary certificate in any field.
  • Google suite proficiency
  • Relationship-driven. Highly skilled communicator with strong customer service focus and desire to do what's best for our customers at all times
  • Attention to detail, to ensure you deliver the best customer experience and promptly follow up on all the information they need
  • Strong passion to succeed, contagious energy and desire to have fun in the process
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills: you can effectively articulate and communicate ideas both verbally and in writing
  • Time management: you can effectively divide your time between specific activities; you have demonstrated ability to plan, multi-task, and adhere to deadlines
  • Interpersonal skills: you have a collaborative mindset and can work well with others
  • Humility and openness to feedback: you are always looking to learn and have an insatiable curiosity and hunger to grow

NICE TO HAVE:

  • Reliable transport and a valid drivers licence.
  • A fun, friendly and outgoing personality

Business Unit: Discovery Central Services
Function: Product Management (Technical)
Date: 12 Jul 2023
About Discovery

Discovery’s core purpose is to make people healthier and to enhance and protect their lives. We seek out and invest in exceptional individuals who understand and support our core purpose, and whose own values align with those of Discovery. Our fast-paced and dynamic environment enables smart, self-driven people to be their best. As global thought leaders, Discovery is passionate about innovating in order to not only achieve financial success, but to ignite positive and meaningful change within our society.

About Vitality Global

Vitality Global, a subsidiary of Discovery Limited is responsible for the expansion of the Vitality Shared-Value Insurance business model beyond South Africa and the UK, serving to fully leverage the assets and intellectual property of Discovery beyond its primary markets. The business forms equity or contractual partnerships with leading global insurers to integrate Vitality and shared value with partner’s insurance and financial services products in the markets where they operate. Vitality Global also operates a business providing wellness solutions to employer groups in the United States. Vitality Health International, a business unit within Vitality Global coordinates and focuses on resource allocation to Discovery’s emerging, global health insurance initiatives. Vitality Global is also responsible for Discovery’s 25 percent equity investment in Ping An Health, the largest comprehensive medical insurer in China. Taken together, Vitality’s businesses jointly reach more than 30 million lives across 40 markets; delivered through partnerships with leading insurers in every continent around the world.

About Ping An Health

Ping An Group is a world-leading technology-powered personal financial services group, which applies innovations to drive technology-powered business transformation and build a world-leading healthcare ecosystem. Ping An Group has 227m retail clients and 647m online users. Ranked first in the Global Brand Finance Insurance 100 and sixth in Forbes Global 2000, Ping An is a powerful brand across China.

Ping An Health is a dynamic business in a vibrant and rapidly evolving market. Ping An Health’s extraordinary success as a specialist health insurer in China has been fueled by digital technology, data analytics, and the role of Shared-Value and wellness in the business model. Since 2010, Discovery has owned a 25% equity stake in Ping An Health.


About the role

This is an expat assignment in Shanghai, China. The Product Manager is ultimately responsible for working with Ping An Health (PAH) to co-develop core Vitality + Insurance capabilities to drive sustainable business growth in China. Through understanding the local market environment, cultivating strong relationships with Ping An colleagues, and identifying which areas of Discovery’s expertise can be adapted and leveraged, the role is to ensure the effective localization and joint implementation of strategic projects.

Key Outputs / Job Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:
Vitality Shared-Value insurance capability localization.
  • Managing the transfer of Vitality and Shared-Value insurance capabilities and best practice to PAH across a range of functions, including R&D, actuarial, marketing, risk management, operations, systems, and distribution.
  • Supporting the design, rollout, and ongoing enhancement of the Vitality proposition and Shared-Value insurance in order to ensure:
    • Alignment with Vitality principles.
    • Incorporation of the latest global Vitality strategies and findings, and the latest advancements in health and wellness.

PAH Shared-Value strategy
  • Maintaining an ongoing understanding of the complete business context, in order to identify opportunities to localize and implement Discovery capabilities.
  • Identifying practical pathways for implementable solutions, given the current status of PAH capabilities and objectives.
  • Building a strategic business outlook to identify future ongoing opportunities for DSY capabilities to be effectively localized and implemented in PAH.

Product management
  • Securing alignment of objectives, resolution of obstacles and problems, and collaboration on strategic and operational decisions, with PAH, by creating and maintaining impactful relationships.
  • Coordinating resources across PAH and DSY to effectively localize and transfer Shared-Value capabilities.
  • Mobilizing DSY and PAH resources to adapt, localize and, where required, find ways to re-develop DSY capabilities and methodologies to suit the local Chinese market.

Stakeholder management
  • Locally work together with PAH colleagues to collaborate, manage, and co-deliver PAH-DSY key projects, and, critically, be accountable for implementation results.
  • Maintaining a strong “trusted advisor” relationship with all PAH stakeholders, through the delivery of impactful and results-driven solutions.


Work Experience
  • Multi-disciplinary experience in Vitality Health, Discovery Life, Discovery Health, Vitality or Vitality Group: R&D, client journeys, Shared-Value integration, etc.
  • Product management experience in the design and implementation of wellness products.
  • 7+ years of experience in the financial / insurance sector.
  • Engaging effectively with senior executives.
  • Networking and relationship-building.
  • Using strong presentation and communication skills.
  • Working independently and in different environments.
  • Working with ambiguous, unstructured, complex problems under pressure.
  • Operating in a multi-stakeholder environment managing different expectations and needs.
  • Understanding healthcare data and performing analysis, interpreting data trends and communicating implications.
  • Leading by influence rather than authority.

Preferred
  • Knowledge and experience of the China healthcare market.
  • Consulting experience.

Education / Qualifications / Accreditations with Professional Body

  • Postgraduate degree with a strong analytical or business focus, and a proven record of academic excellence.
  • Actuary (preferred, not essential, especially if you have strong relevant Product Manager experience).

Technical Skills or Knowledge

  • Fluent in Mandarin (this would be exceptionally advantageous).
  • Product management.

EMPLOYMENT EQUITY

The Company’s approved Employment Equity Plan and Targets will be considered as part of the recruitment process. As an Equal Opportunities employer, we actively encourage and welcome people with various disabilities to apply.

Associate 3: Enterprise Risk (Internal Audit)


Why should I work for EY in Risk?

EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team up to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

Management and Boards of Directors rely heavily on Internal Audit to provide important proactive assessments and assurance around the effectiveness of controls and company processes, while also providing objective advisory support. You will be engaged in delivering some of the most significant and class-leading internal audit and risk engagements globally. As part of our market-leading global network of risk professionals, you will gain the valuable experience you need to become a successful risk advisor. At EY, we recognize that it is the perspectives, skills and enthusiasm you bring to our clients that makes the difference.


Job purpose

As Associate3 in Enterprise Risk (Internal Audit), you will make a significant technical contribution to client engagements and internal projects. Within your role, you will actively establish, maintain and strengthen internal and external relationships.

Working closely with colleagues, you will confirm whether the work plan is properly executed, documented and concluded in compliance with EY's guidelines.


Your client responsibilities

  • Work effectively as a team member, sharing responsibility, providing support, maintaining communication and updating senior team members on progress.
  • Assign and manage tasks with other team members considering engagement needs and identified business outcomes, and organize own work such that important items get done first.
  • Build strong internal relationships within EY and with other services across the organization.
  • Develop and maintain productive working relationships with client personnel.
  • Research client industry, company structure, key customers and suppliers and possible insight into operations and the various processes.
  • Manage own time in line with budgets
  • Preparing business process descriptions through interviews with the client and documenting understanding of business process and confirm the business process descriptions by performing a walkthrough of the process.
  • Identifying possible business risks and control weaknesses from the business processes under review.
  • Drafting detailed audit programmes to test controls in place.
  • Assessment of design and implementation of key controls as well as the operating effectiveness, accuracy and validity thereof.
  • Identify basic data analytic procedures
  • Compilation of working papers substantiating scope and results of testing.
  • Provide a coaching / mentoring role.
  • Draft individual sections of documents and presentations to explain issues and solution options and implications.
  • Display a logical thought process in understanding client challenges and exploring possible solutions.
  • Identify and escalate potential risks and issues to project manager along with suggested preventive or mitigating actions.
  • Draft audit findings for review by EY Management.


Your people responsibilities

  • Act as a visible role model for our people.
  • Coach and mentor junior team members.
  • Give honest supportive feedback to colleagues.
  • Take personal responsibility for own performance and career development.
  • Play an active role in EY and Service line team activities.
  • Understand and follow workplace policies and procedures.


Technical skills requirements

  • Must have Honours in Internal Audit, Accounting, Business, Finance or other related field
  • CIA or part CIA will be an added benefit
  • Minimum of 3 years of related work experience
  • Related audit or applicable business experience
  • Proficient in Microsoft office (including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint).


Additional skills requirements

  • Strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Demonstrated integrity, values, principles, and work ethic.
  • Enquiring Mind
  • Analytical
  • Self-starter
  • Team Player
  • Share EY’s values and vision
  • Disciplined
  • Able to handle pressure
  • Team building ability
  • Good communication skills

Role purpose:


The core responsibility of the business integration specialist role is:


To support the design and implementation of solutions/capabilities that will ensure the strategic expansion of the FTTx department.
To support the management of operational efficiencies with an emphasis on order management within the FTTx department. This will entail a detailed focus on the key aspect of order management in order to improve customer journey experience, ensure the inclusion of FTTx technical requirements onto relevant roadmaps and improve the conversion of orders created to cash.

Your responsibilities will include:


Systems, Processes and Automation:

Responsible for a broad understanding of the FTTx systems architecture, both within Vodacom as well as of selected business partners.
Identify opportunities for innovative automation and integration within Vodacom systems (convergence) as well as those of third-party infrastructure providers.
Lead the overall technical design and delivery of solutions to ensure these are delivered through the agreed delivery processes, guiding the technical teams as applicable to ensure successful end to end solution e.g. facilitation of configuration, participation in testing, rollout coordination, co-ordinate system integration across multiple teams.
Define technical workflows to enable business capabilities by documenting and prioritizing process/system change requests.
Continually assess, maintain, and re-evaluate in order to optimise or automate existing business and system processes.
Provide guidance to product, sales and service delivery teams to ensure alignment on new initiatives implemented.
Facilitate solution compliance to security, privacy, and regulatory needs.
Advocate adoption of new technologies into business processes, capabilities and solutions.


Order Management:

Support the order management process by identifying fallouts and addressing them timeously in order to meet the connections and revenue targets.
Ensure alignment of customer acquisition, fulfilment and retentions business and systems processes between internal and external business partners within order management.
Review and analyse the effectiveness and efficiency of existing key areas of system processes, and then support the design and implementation/development for improving and enhancing those areas.
Work with system support team (Technology Team and EBU IT) to identify and resolve repetitive and critical end user system issues by a) initiating system improvement/enhancement projects and b) initiating refresher/new training with learning & development team to ensure end user knowledge gap is closed.


Reporting:
Work with the reporting team to initiate and ensure monitoring tools, control measures with Revenue Assurance and analytics are in place for business and system processes.
Conduct detailed analysis on daily, weekly, and monthly performance of the orders created in the pipeline.
Provide business intelligence to the FTTx organization on the efficiency of the orders in the pipeline and conversion rate of orders created to cash monthly.
Perform impact analysis by initiating ad-hoc reports on all production issues and recommend appropriate solutions.

The ideal candidate for this role will have:


Job Experience/Education
Matric is essential
Relevant 3 year Bachelor’s Degree or National Diploma in in Engineering or IT Studies (essential)
A minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience preferable within the Telecoms industry


Job Knowledge:
In-depth understanding of the Fixed and Mobile environment
In-depth understanding of the OSS / BSS systems and processes (FTTX advantageous).
Ability to understand IT systems
Ability to understand business and system processes together with customer experience journeys.


Skills:
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal)
Proficient with Microsoft Excel, Power Point, Visio and Word
Analytical thinking e.g., analysing data trends and anomalies
Logical reasoning e.g., problem solving ability
Understanding of the Agile Development processes
Proficiency in programming languages and data structures
Adapting and Responding to Change
Entrepreneurial and Commercial Thinking


Closing date for Applications: 17 July 2023.


The base location for this role is, Midrand, Vodacom Campus.

Job Title: Skills Development Specialist

About Discovery

Discovery’s core purpose is to make people healthier and to enhance and protect their lives. We seek out and invest in exceptional individuals who understand and support our core purpose, and whose own values align with those of Discovery. Our fast-paced and dynamic environment enables smart, self-driven people to be their best. As global thought leaders, Discovery is passionate about innovating in order to not only achieve financial success, but to ignite positive and meaningful change within our society.

Job Purpose

Key Outputs may include but are not limited to:

  • Support the Skills Development & Leadership and Learning Team through research, dashboard formulation and trend analysis of training measurement.

Identify gaps in Discovery’s learning data and make recommendations for potential process changes within business. Reporting on business adherence to data quality governance rules and policies.

IT – Software Development
Johannesburg – Gauteng

The ideal candidate should be highly skilled and motivated, possessing a strong background in data analysis and visualization. Your main role will involve utilizing Power BI to design visually appealing and interactive dashboards and reports. ATTRIBUTES:
  • Excellent communication, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills.

That’s the person we – an award-winning international branding and human engagement agency – are searching for. Please tell us we can stop now?

Campaign strategy
  • Ensure strategies are in place for inbound marketing campaigns with specific performance targets and objectives tailored to meet or exceed client business and commercial expectations
  • Continuously develop a strong understanding of the products, competition, industry, marketing goals and objectives of each client

  • Ensure all client account are well managed
KPIs and Reports
  • Measure the effectiveness of campaigns and achieve incremental increases in success
  • Draw insight from data regarding user trends and behavior in order to enhance performance context per account

Client Focus
  • Work closely with the account management team to ensure they are kept up to speed with progress and results
  • Maintain regular contact with clients and provide timely efficient responses to all queries
  • To attend and actively take part in client meetings
Analytical and Technical
  • Ensure knowledge of the digital industry and changes within inbound marketing is kept up to date and relevant

  • Write web copy, blog posts, email messages, research papers, white papers, case studies, and/or other publications as required
  • Ensure traffic is driven to content assets by leveraging landing pages, social media promotions, search engine optimization, paid advertisements and more
Best practice and organisation
  • Efficiently manage workload and accurately record your time using the company timesheet system
  • Share knowledge, insight, best practice, tactics and ideas
  • Contribute towards a drive for excellence across the agency

Inbound Marketing Specialist Job Requirements:

Bonus Points: Hubspot Certified

display_title: Senior Specialist: Enterprise Sales Finance Business Partner
job_description:
Role Purpose

The Senior Specialist: Finance Business Partner is responsible for leading, managing, coordinating and developing the overall business plan associated with Sales Customer contracts in accordance with company policies, regulatory framework and applicable laws. The Senior Specialist: Finance Business Partner will be responsible to develop industry best practice principles across the company contract elements, from Sales, Service Delivery, Service Management, IT support, Finance and Governance/Legal. Acts as the primary contact between the potential partners, business unit, regulatory and legal, ensuring that all financial matters are addressed efficiently and promptly.

The Senior Specialist: Finance Business Partner must understand the business processes of all LTSA functional areas and execute such processes in order to meet Contractual Requirements. The finance business partner will be dealing with complex customised contracts that normally do not conform to normal standard contract terms of the organisation. Hence the Finance Business Partner is responsible to design and implement new processes within the organisation to achieve contract obligations and mitigate customer contractual risks. The Finance Business Partner will be exposed to high risks and severe pressure, that can severely impact the organisations financial results.

Finance business partner work alongside different business departments, providing financial information, tools, analysis and insight to executives, develop new processes, helping them make more informed decisions and driving business strategy. Their role is to provide 'real time' support and analysis, to be a trusted adviser and to add value that will assist in decision making

The Senior Specialist: Finance Business Partner must develop all risk management models associated with the contracts, to each cross-functional department within the organisation. The Senior Specialist: Finance Business and Commercial should have a full overview of the contract and related project requirements ensuring full business support on contract completion
Emphasis is also placed on ensuring and developing models on contract profitability, revenue and efficiency improvements. This role will focus on governance, compilation and analysis of contract performance and risks, operational performance and financial data.

Role Description

Business Partnering

Develop business engagement models in support of effective execution and planning of the Business Partner Revenue Forecasts across a specific operational division. Variance analysis including reviewing monthly results and providing detailed analysis and explanation for executive management, review and challenge actual performance, identifying key variances and suggesting potential opportunities and actions to rectify poor performance.

Implement business product management models in line with best practices that accurately reflects commercial, contractual and legal aspects in accordance with company policies. Strategic development based upon the review and analysis of financial information to identify key trends and areas for future improvement, challenging poor or exceptional performance in financial KPIs and advise on rectification actions. Develop and Implement effective commercial procedures, or initiating change, to ensure key operational, commercial and financial targets are delivered. Provision of decision support through modelling ‘what if’ scenarios, challenge assumptions and make recommendations on preferred outcomes. Provide ad-hoc analysis and insights on specific issues.

Financial Management, Accounting & Reporting

Ensure contract execution aligned with business cases, operational and financial targets to maximise revenue and margins.Manage cross functional operational efficiency based on business performance data and KPI’s. Establish relationships with the Sales Executives team ensuring quality and timeliness of processing and reporting. Establish compliance criteria and parameters for cross functional efficiency measurement. Support Sales Business with planning and development of Budget input associated with revised business plans. Manage the Sales Business units to ensure that deliverables remain within budgets and report the managed variances within contract structures.

Reporting and Business Analytics

Develop monthly reporting on BI Platforms, with re and integrate in LIT Reporting platforms. Ensures that Reporting and Analytics is developed in line with company objectives, and information can be access real time. Manage the budgeting process with Business Partner Chief the annual strategic capex budgeting requirements for LTSA for CPM submission. Monitor, track, report to Exco and group and provide feedback to business units of approved spend. (4+8,7+5). Provides accurate and timely reporting on all business financial reports in relation to projects with related scorecards for Exco.Develop and Implement Strategic alignment to the New Liquid Business Segments with the Chief Officers associated with EBU and CBU units.

Governance and Risk Management

Develop governance processes and structures aimed at sound and accurate execution of monthly obligations and operational requirements. Develop and Implement structures that will ensure QoS internally with business units. Develop cross functional financial business partner capability and alignment to achieve operational requirements for LIT.Develop and implement risk management structures across business units on account delivery and support teams.

Drive risk resolution and feedback loop as a key risk management function. Develop Budgets and Risk Management Models within the business areas associated with contracts and report Monthly to Exco where applicable. Manage cross functional business and contractual risks through LIT risk management policies.

Corporate Performance Enhancement

Implement constant improvement measures on current systems and procedures for internal efficiencies regarding monthly revenue forecasting. Maintains an Integrated Business Unit Reporting and provides accurate forecasting of Key Financial indicators. Acts proactively and thinks strategically, in anticipating organisational needs, recognising the wider business environment and dynamics. Recommends a range of suitable options from which to develop sustainable plans and objectives. Business Case methodology control and reports up to Group Level for all LTSA business Cases.


Role Requirements


Tertiary Qualifications in CPM, Legal and/or Business Management. NQF 7 Essential

B Com degree Essential

Professional accounting qualification Desirable

2 -3 Years Management experience Desirable

5 - 7 years Financial, business, commercial and FBP experience in the ICT sector Essential

All Appointments are subject to the Labour Legislation in the respective country.
