display_title: Group FP&A Manager - Fixed Term Contract (12 months)
job_description:
Group Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) Manager - Fixed Term Contract (12 months)

Your purpose

The Group Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) Manager is a high impact role. Your purpose is to support our Corporate Finance Director, in ensuring the Mr Price Group’s financial plan is relevant, accurate and sufficiently flexible to drive the business and model options and various financial scenarios.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Overall group reporting entails the consolidation, review and analysis of monthly executive reporting packs and Divisional and Group budgets.
  • Present a consolidated view of our group’s financial performance.
  • Prepare Half and Year-end analyst packs and board monthly reports.
  • You offer insight into business performance while influencing and supporting business planning, commercial decision making, forecasting and the budgeting processes of the group.
  • You manage the annual budgeting process and periodic forecasting for the Group.
  • You oversee and validate the short-term cash flow projections for the group.
  • This is a high engagement role where you partner with the Division Financial Directors; Divisional Finance Managers; to support and inject rigour into monthly forecasting and their annual budget preparations prior to submission to Group.
  • Collaborate and engage with stakeholders across the Group offering business planning, commercial and financial analysis. Your stakeholders include Group Support
  • Cost Centre Managers; Internal/external audit; Group treasury & tax; Group head of investor relations and the Group data analytics team.
  • Prepare 5 Year Projections and Forecasting Analysis.
  • Partner with Treasury and Tax to ensure accurate forecasting of cash, interest, and tax.
  • Manage the Group Centre of Excellence (COE) functions financial management function, monthly reporting, budgets, half-year and year-end statutory packs.
  • Monitor and measure results for compliance with financial covenants.
  • Review and interrogate business case funding requests (eg Capex allocation support). Prepare ad-hoc analysis to assist with commercial business decisions.
  • Lead the analysis for corporate finance related transactions and support the CFO and CEO with ad-hoc analysis.
  • Identify areas of commercial risk and opportunity through financial analysis and insight. ensuring these are swiftly identified and acted on by the business functions.

What are the requirements?

  • CA (SA)
  • 5 years’ experience in Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A)
  • Retail experience would be advantageous
  • Our environment is high pace, high pressure, high change, high performance, and deadline oriented. Fit into our environment is essential for success.
  • The suitable candidate will also display the following competencies: results-oriented; stakeholder management; strategic and critical thinking; collaboration; influence; people leadership; a team player; innovative; commercial awareness; maturity; the ability to communicate at various levels including with the C-suite; tech-savvy and analytical.
  • This role is urgent, thus we require someone available immediately

Who we are


Mr Price Group is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to Employment Equity.

Digital E-Commerce Manager Retail
Johannesburg North, Johannesburg - Gauteng - South Africa
An excellent career opportunity awaits you in the luxury retail brand sector. Our client, a renowned retail brand, is searching for a professional with experience in digital marketing to transform and optimize their eCommerce website for superior customer journeys. We're looking for a forward-thinking professional, passionate about creating a seamless, user-friendly online shopping experience.
You will bring a minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience in a Digital Marketing Agency or a dedicated Digital marketing team within the Retail Branding sector. Your professional skills should encompass technical proficiency with eCommerce platforms such as Shopify, Payment Gateways, Google Analytics, and Everlytic. A successful track record of driving results across a broad spectrum of digital channels, including SEO, Display Social, Email, and Paid Media is a must-have.
In this role, you'll take charge of various eCommerce operations, including daily online shop management, product data management, and eCommerce stock management. You'll also be responsible for updating the website content and collaborating with the Marketing Manager to devise strategies that ensure profitability and meet sales targets.
Additionally, you'll work alongside our social and digital marketer and other team members to boost traffic, plan promotions, and increase revenue. Designing monthly reports on e-commerce metrics, handling customer queries, and liaising with third-party service providers will also fall under your remit.
You will oversee sales and stock on additional digital wholesale channels and manage the external ad agency regarding budget spend and campaign work. Moreover, you'll collaborate with the graphic designer to plan and create biweekly newsletters, proofread marketing content, and create content for the website and newsletters.

Team Leader- Advanced Business Analytics

Job Description

Our client is looking for a motivated, creative and technical person with a talent for leadership and an aptitude for business to join their consulting team in the role of Team Leader for their Advanced Business Analytics focus area.

The focus of this position is to lead a small technical team of highly skilled individuals as you partner with their clients to solve problems with the application of data science, software engineering and classical business analytics. Consultants acting in this role will work with their team to understand and define client problems and develop solutions to solve them.

Solutions you develop will typically include the development of software applications and machine learning or statistical models that result in recommendations and actionable insights. You and your team will communicate these insights back to the client with the use of reports and visualizations.

The nature of the work requires that you are primarily based at their offices in Johannesburg or at their client’s premises, however international travel in support clients in Africa may be necessary a few times a year.

Responsibilities

  • Lead a team of data scientists, software developers and business analysts.
  • Lead projects and mentor team members in project leadership.
  • Sustain and grow existing projects with the help of your team.
  • Identify and assist in winning new projects with existing and new clients in the business analytics space.
  • Contribute to company strategy.
  • Build relationships with our clients in support of growing our contracts with them and meeting their needs.
  • Work with our clients to explore and define their requirements.
  • Mentor and advise your team on appropriate methodology and techniques for developing models, frameworks and performing analysis for project work.
  • Research and develop analyses, models and reports supporting a variety of client requirements.
  • Present and support your team in presenting models, insights and recommendations in person

or via video conferencing and telecommunication systems.

Education and experience:

  • A graduate degree with a strong background in mathematics, applied mathematics, statistics or engineering.
  • A post graduate degree in which you have applied Machine Learning techniques.
  • 4+ years of programming experience in MATLAB / Python or a similar language.
  • 2+ years of leadership experience.
  • Experience with project management.
  • Management experience is a plus.

Characteristics:

  • Strong leadership skills and an interest in developing and mentoring your team.
  • Self-driven with the ability to take initiative and make things happen.
  • The ability to see the “big picture” and translate it into practical actions by diving into the technical work to achieve the client’s goals.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to see issues from different perspectives.
  • Strong knowledge and interest in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive modelling, data analytics, data visualization and data interpretation.
  • The ability to extract and communicate data insights is essential.
  • The ability to think creatively and solve new problems with limited resources is critical for success.
  • Strong communication skills and the confidence and ability to present effectively across different levels of seniority.
  • The ability to communicate with people from different technical domains (IT, engineering, finance) as well as marketing specialists and business managers.
  • High attention to detail.
  • The ability to perform under pressure

Should you meet the requirements for this position, please email your CV to it.careers@goldmantech.co.za. You can also contact Brooke on 031 350 4019 or alternatively you can visit our website www.goldmantech.co.za

Should you not hear from us within 3 days, please consider your application unsuccessful.




or email us: it.careers(at)goldmantech.co.za

Head: Analytical Systems
Job Purpose
The Head: Analytics Systems within Group Risk Analytics (GRA) will report into the Divisional Head: Credit Risk Systems. The incumbent of the role is accountable for providing an integrated lens on Nedbank’s risk systems and metrics within GRA and perform a cross-functional role in supporting credit and non-credit areas within the organisation
Job Responsibilities
  • Support the group-wide productionisation of models and processes for credit and non-credit risk types.
  • Stay abreast of developments in quantitative analytics to ensure Nedbank’s analytical tools and solutions are up-to-date and in-line with international best practises.
  • System maintenance and foundational system enhancements for the SAS Digital Model Deployment (DMD) Platform and SAS IFRS9 impairment solutions.
  • Support the implementation and regrounds of Nedbank’s IFRS9 model suite, in conjunction with maintenance of model implementation standards and methodologies.
  • Ensure consistency and automation of data and processes across GRA.
  • Drive optimal use of our analytics system investments to enable risk functions to efficiently utilise the output from the Group’s operational processes.
  • Drive business optimisation through engagement with stakeholders to create integration, automation and process efficiency including digitisation and Cloud migration.
  • Support and ensure the optimal implementation of GRA specific and Group wide projects.
  • Provide support across the Group when required i.e., the resolution of all system related issues and knowledge sharing.
  • Drive the implementation and review of IFRS9 BCBS239 compliance which includes the linkage to Group Data Services.
  • Engage and manage all cluster relationships pertaining to the SAS DMD Platform and SAS IFRS9 impairments solution.

Leadership
  • Lead a team of Quantitative Analysts in the delivery / realisation of key outcomes for the Credit Risk Systems team.
  • Create and maintain a high-performing team by identifying key talent through conducting career conversations and the use of the talent grid principles and developing talent retention programmes and strategies.
  • Build a depth of skills and knowledge in the team by sharing knowledge and insights.Ensure continuous improvement goals are achieved by creating an environment whereby self and team are encouraged to challenge the status quo by initiating constructive debates about work practices.
Essential Qualifications - NQF Level
  • Advanced Diplomas/National 1st Degrees

  • SAS programming preferred or similar (SQL / R / Python) knowledge
Minimum Experience Level
The following minimum experience is required:
  • 6+ years’ experience in credit risk analytics, data, and systems management.
  • Knowledge of credit risk systems and processes, data, and the Nedbank data landscape.
Technical / Professional Knowledge

  • Communication Strategies

  • Governance, Risk and Controls
  • Principles of project management

  • Business writing and presentation skills

Job ID: 17501
    Position Type: Full-Time
    Job Function: Human Resources & Training
    Workplace Type: Head Office
    Division: TFG Human Resources
    Province: Western Cape
    Location: Cape Town North
    Suburb: Parow (Parow)


Position Description:

We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as an OD & Reward Consultant. As a valued member of our HR Shared Service, you will play a pivotal role in providing exceptional service and fostering an outstanding employee experience for our diverse workforce of over 34,000 individuals.

The remuneration team takes pride in spearheading the delivery of Reward and OD initiatives for The Foschini Group, encompassing the development of reward structures, practices, and consultation services. As the successful candidate, your main focus will be on delivering outstanding customer service while consistently enhancing efficiency and effectiveness to exceed Service Level Agreement standards. Additionally, this role offers the opportunity to collaborate and provide support to other teams as needed.

Join us in this dynamic environment where your expertise will make a significant impact on our organisation and employee satisfaction.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Implementation and execution of remuneration strategies
  • Deliver outputs as per OD and Reward principles, guidelines, and processes
  • Keep up to date with key policy changes; new legislations; and new initiatives / projects as directed by the Remuneration Manager
  • Be accountable for specific divisions regarding remuneration operational delivery, implementation and execution of projects as directed
  • Guided by the annual calendar, meet business deadlines within SLA standards, including readiness for key internal meetings (e.g. Forums, annual increase mandates, variable pay and structural changes)
  • Implementation of annual increases, variable pay activities, Sectorial determination increases and salary benchmarks calculations as per principles and guidelines
  • Partner with internal key stakeholders such as Payroll, Data Analytics & Talent Acquisition
  • Ensure allocated Remuneration activities, including queries are prepared and delivered within SLA and quality standards
  • Prepare offers, restraint/retention and relevant packages accurately using updated templates, matrices and signed off by relevant stakeholders as per processes
  • Ensure that consultation is provided to line managers with regards to optimal structures when changes are being considered, with escalation to the relevant parties where necessary
  • Ensure that relevant documentation and systems are aligned/maintained
Qualifications, Skills and Experience:
  • Degree: B.Com HR/Industrial & Organizational Psychology/B.Com Finance or Statistics or equivalent
  • GRP modules (completed or in progress)
  • 3 to 5 years’ relevant remuneration experience
  • Strong technical understanding of variable pay, pay review processes, Sectorial determination, EEA4, Remchannel data submissions and Incentive calculations
  • Strong compensation (Guaranteed and Variable pay principles) and benefits knowledge
  • MS Office package proficiency (Excel intermediate to advance)
  • Ability to operate in a complex environment with highly demanding stakeholders
  • Strong ability to build and manage relationships at all levels
This individual is able to…
  • Take accountability and ensures delivery to SLA’s
  • Interprets and simplifies complex and contradictory information when resolving remuneration queries
  • Use technology to enhance productivity, improve problem solving and deliver remuneration advice and support
  • Identify and communicate opportunities to improve the efficiency, effectiveness and quality of work processes
  • Inspire trust and gain the confidence of others through displaying honesty and integrity
  • Convey information and communicate ideas in a clear, concise and impactful manner
  • Readily takes on new challenges and opportunities with a sense of urgency and eagerness
  • Act as the specialist when providing advice and support to various stakeholders
  • Understands interrelation between OD and Remuneration processes and business impact
Preference will be given, but not limited to candidates from designated groups in terms of the Employment Equity Act.

What will you do?

Santam Group Finance has a Business Enablement Manager role available. The role reports to the Head: Group Finance & Data Transformation and will be based at Santam Head Office in Bellville, Cape Town .

The Business Enablement Manager is responsible for the development of the enabling capabilities required by Santam Finance to transition to its future target operating model and achieve its strategic vision, specifically the management of data and provision of analytics and insight, management of change in the financial organisation, continuous improvement of operations and enforcement of relevant governance and policies. What will make you successful in this role?

Data Management and governance: Oversee the development of the Group Finance Data Operating Model and embed data management capabilities into the various Group Finance teams. Ensure appropriate data governance applied to financial data aligned to Santam’s policies and standards.
Data analytics and insights: Oversee the development of the analytics and insights capability of Santam Finance and manage the deployment of relevant tools and training. Drive analytics/ insights initiatives to ensure effective delivery of appropriate models/ reporting, along with required people and process changes.
Business Enablement: Ensure that appropriate performance measurements for Santam Finance are defined and reported on and monitor delivery of benefits from Finance value streams. Oversee refinement of the Finance target operating model aligned to the Finance vision and strategy, and drive maturity of the Finance services catalogue. Oversee delivery and impact of change initiatives (including the impact of corporate finance actions, changes in business unit/ subsidiary processes or systems and Group Finance value streams) in conjunction with project resources and relevant IT teams. Taking the lead on transition management; ensuring that "Business as Usual" is maintained during the transition and changes are effectively integrated into the business.
Governance Framework: Ensure development and application of the Finance governance and control framework across the Santam Group and develop mechanisms for monitoring of compliance.
Continuous improvement: Ensure LEAN principles are applied by Finance teams through the necessary processes, tools and systems. Ensure consistent delivery of optimisation and standardisation initiatives across Group Finance and effective use of Greenbelt team members across Finance.
Risk Management: Oversee the first-line risk management activities of Group Finance, aligned to Enterprise Risk Management requirements.

Collaboration with the leadership team of Group Finance, the broader finance community in the group as well as the relevant teams in the IT and HR organisations, will be critical for successful delivery in the role. Qualification and Experience

Relevant Bachelor’s degree (Commerce, Business Science, Engineering); MBA will be advantageous
At least 6 years management experience
Demonstrated ability to implement complex change initiatives and/or establishment of business capabilities
5 years of experience in an analytical or reporting role, working with data and translating this into information for decision making purposes; sound knowledge of analytical methods and tools; ability to development meaningful reports from several sources
Sound experience in complex stakeholder management under high-pressure circumstances
Sound understanding of financial principles and concepts
Sound understanding of business strategy implementation
Experience in financial services industry would be advantageous
Ability to travel locally Skills

Influencing people
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Stakeholder Management
Project management and planning skills
Analytical and Business reporting skills
Presentation skills
Negotiation and networking skills
Ability to work independently
Conceptual thinking and problem-solving skills Competencies

Being Resilient
Collaborates
Cultivates & Drives Innovation
Customer Focus
Drives Results
Insurance & Business Acumen
Analytical skills
Business Partnering
Execution Discipline
Financial Acumen
Data Literacy

Emotional Intelligence
Critical Thinking
Decision Making
Curiosity with Creativity

Applying expertise and technology
Work well in diverse and changing environment About The Company

Santam is the market leader in the general insurance industry in Southern Africa. We are a large, diversified, expanding and transforming company and whilst based in South Africa, we are rapidly moving into a number of emerging markets, both in Africa and Asia.

Our success is rooted in our passion for our clients and everything we do is centered on our delivery of Insurance Good and Proper. We’re about people. People drive our business so it follows that we want to recruit the best people possible whether they work for us permanently or for a short time as temporary employees.

Senior Associate: Employee Experience

Johannesburg, ZA

June 22, 2023

The greatest asset of most organizations is their people. In an era of rapidly developing technology, greater workforce mobility and increasing customer demands, having a cohesive human capital strategy is crucial for business success. We know that high-performing businesses cultivate and grow talent, carefully balancing costs and rewards. From employee engagement to change management, we take a rounded perspective, based on leading-edge thinking, data, analytics and software, unearthing new ways to attract, engage and retain talent – and shape the Talent Management & Organizational Development.

Our human capital clients are varied – we advise organisations across all industries, from financial services to retail, telecommunications and energy. We advise many of the world’s leading and largest companies and often interact with our offices around the world to provide a truly global service offering. We provide invaluable advice to companies at some of the most exciting and critical moments in their lifecycle, at times when employee engagement and retention is crucial – from mergers and acquisitions to listing on the stock market.

The Role

You will work as both a project manager and a key contributor to projects that help client organizations enable business strategies and improve how they attract, retain and engage talent. This will include, but not be limited to, the following:

  • Sell, develop and implement solutions including talent acquisition, talent analytics, career architecture, competency management, organizational design, performance management, leader succession and development, workforce wellbeing and employee engagement.
  • Taking EX insights gathered through our work and supporting other project managers and sellers across the broader Talent business in integrating these into their client work across the employee experience spectrum.
  • Supporting the delivery of insights software administration projects (pulse, virtual focus groups and other) by developing relationships with clients, suppliers and project team members to coordinate the logistics of the day to day running of their projects. This will include understanding organisational hierarchies/matrix structures and helping set-up surveys and reporting structures that align to each unique organisation.
  • Support for design and set-up of employee perception questionnaires, support for translations, printing / on-line set-up, distribution and return of questionnaire materials will also be required.
  • Provide actionable insights on improving employee engagement, shaping a high-performance culture and achieving optimal returns on talent and program investments
  • Contribute to new business development by drafting statements of work, project plans and budgets involving multiple workflow streams and client teams
  • Demonstrate effective sales behaviours, including team collaboration, creativity, compelling RFP writing, persistent follow-up, sound judgment in scoping/pricing, and focusing on closing the deal
  • Deliver profitable revenue to the business through individual sales and billable hours goals

The requirements

  • Bachelor or Master’s degree in for example (but not limited to) business administration, HR, psychology etc.
  • +4 years in management consulting experience
  • You are extremely curious about what makes people tick and you are eager to help them thrive in their job and organization.
  • You are good impacting and influencing to convince people with ideas and good practices and you have strong abilities in sales
  • You are good at building relationships, both internally and externally.
  • You deliver top quality, you are proactive and flexible and you show a can do mentality. You are enthusiastic, a team player, creative and able to think out of the box.
  • Your English is sophisticated; additional language skills will be a plus.
  • Good problem-solving and analytical skills, as well as excellent communication skills, as you will be interacting with clients from the beginning.
  • You have availability to work remotely and client based; you enjoy travelling for work

The Application Process

  • Stage 1: Online application and recruiter review
  • Stage 2: Pre-recorded video interview
  • Stage 3: Live video interview with hiring manager and team
  • Stage 4: Offer and onboarding

Preference will be given to applicants from designated groups, in line with the South African Employment Equity Act.
WTW is committed to finding opportunities to promote workplace flexibility when possible based on the needs of our customers and the company. We are pleased to say that this role meets the criteria for flexible work.

display_title: Senior SQL and .Net Core Developer (post level 9)
job_description:
Job Title
Senior SQL and .Net Core Developer (post level 9) (Job ID 5316)
Organizational Unit
University of the Free State -> Vice-Rector: Operations -> Information and Communications Technology Services
Contract Type
Permanent
Occupational Level
Senior Management
Location
Bloemfontein Campus - Bloemfontein, FS ZA (Primary)
Closing Date
15/7/2023
Description

This post was previously advertised as Job ID: 4575, 4701 & 5169. All applications received in response to the previous advertisement will automatically be considered again. Previous applicants, therefore, do not need to reapply.

KINDLY TAKE NOTE: Applications may only be submitted online through the official UFS vacancy website: https://ufs.hua.hrsmart.com/hr/ats/JobSearch/viewAll - Applications submitted through any other platform will not be considered.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Technical development and implementation of databases.
  • Consolidate and optimise available data warehouse infrastructure.
  • Design and implement ETL procedures for intake of data from both internal and outside sources, as well as ensure data is verified and quality is checked.
  • Design and implement ETL processes and data architecture to ensure the proper functioning of analytics lad, as well as client’s or third-party’s reporting environments and dashboard.
  • Carry out monitoring, tuning and database performance analysis.
  • Perform the design and extension of data marts, Metadata and data models.
  • Ensure that all the data warehouse architecture codes are maintained in a version control system.
  • Design and implement warehouse database structures.
  • Create the database and database objects such as the tables, tablespaces, synonyms, views, triggers, stored procedures, defaults, domains and indexes.
  • Analyse, review and write applications and programs based on customer needs and requirements.
  • Conduct analysis of customer needs and develop solutions to software challenges.
  • Assist with querying and extracting data from large databases.
  • Produce data reports from complex data sets.
  • Maintain confidentiality of work-related information and materials.
  • Design and develop reports and analytics capability.
  • Liaise with the data quality manager to identify and resolve data issues through the configuration of data cleansing and de-duplication software.
  • Manage the database aspects of the reporting and analytics platform(s) to ensure that reporting jobs are successfully run and analytics data aligns with timeliness/completeness requirements.
  • Liaise with database administrators to ensure the data warehouse is tuned for optimal performance.
  • Liaise with business analysts and project managers to develop and refine reporting and analytics requirements.
  • Ensure that all technology solutions are properly architected and specified.
  • Evaluate code to ensure its validity and operability.
  • Ensure coding structures to predefined architecture.
  • Build and maintain reusable code libraries.
  • Code development in pre-defined coding languages that aligns with UFS development needs.
  • Optimisation of applications in terms of speed, scalability, and operability.
  • The incumbent will be expected to work overtime as and when required.
  • Responsible to transform design and user interface mock-ups into functional web applications and systems powered by CMS.
  • Ensure that HTML / CSS is cross-browser and standards compliant and meets accessibility requirements.
  • Integrate web applications and custom systems with existing applications on campus or third-party / open-source platforms.
  • Resolve and or escalate issues in a timely fashion.
  • Integrate data from various back-end services and databases.
  • Determine technical requirements.
  • Evaluate codes to ensure that it is valid, properly structured, meet industry standards and are compatible with browsers, devices, or operating systems.
  • Ensure that all user input is validated before submitting to the back-end.
  • Manage timelines.
  • Inform the supervisor of risks to projects.
  • Code testing for sign-off.

Inherent Job Requirements

  • A B.Sc. degree in Information Technology/ B.Tech. degree in Information Technology/ B.Com. degree in Information Technology/related B. degree on NQF level 7.
or
  • A 3-year National Diploma in Information Technology on NQF level 6.
  • A minimum of two (2) years relevant working experience related to the duties and responsibilities.

Recommendations

  • Three (3) to four (4) years’ relevant experience.
  • A minimum of three (3) years’ relevant experience of code development, data design, modelling and application/ implementation.
  • Experience in web application development and restful technologies.
  • Advance computer skills.
  • Exceptional knowledge in Standard Web Languages like:
  • HTML
  • CSS
  • JavaScript
  • JQuery
  • Bootstrap
  • XML
  • JSON
  • .NET 4.5+ and .NET Core 3+
  • C#
  • T-SQL / SQL
  • Exceptional knowledge in Main Development Languages like (but not limited to) C#.
  • Exceptional knowledge in Database Technologies in MSSQL and Oracle SQL
  • Knowledge of relational database systems, Object Oriented Programming, and web application development.
  • Knowledge and experience in Development Frameworks like Entity Framework, MVC, .NET Core
  • Background in creating complex stored procedures and SQL scripts.
  • Knowledge of other SQL languages
  • MariaDB
  • Snowflake
  • MySQL
  • PostgreSQL
Competencies

Key Competencies Required:

  • Results Orientated:
  • The ability to stick with tasks, not give up, and overcome obstacles in completing one’s task.
  • The ability to be reliable, responsible, dependable and to fulfil obligations.
  • The ability to deal calmly and effectively with high stress situations.
  • Strategic Thinking:
  • The ability to deal with several activities at a time.
  • The ability to carefully analyse information and use logic to address issues and problems at work.
  • Business Acumen:
  • The ability to adhere to rules and strictly follow work regulations.
  • Proficient in using MS Office.
  • Leading:
  • The ability to be cooperative with others, display a good-natured attitude, and encourage people to work together.
  • Building Coalitions:
  • The ability to make decisions through consultation, collaboration, and working with close supervision.

Required Documents

Please ensure all relevant documentation is attached to your application. INCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.
  • Certified copies must not be older than 6 months
  • A detailed curriculum vitae and cover letter.
  • Certified copies (not older than 6 months) of qualifications (please provide the SAQA accreditation in the case of foreign qualifications).
  • A certified copy (not older than 6 months) of your identity document (ID).
  • Proof of registration with a Professional Body (if applicable).
  • A copy of your driver’s license (if applicable).
  • A service record of your current employer / last employer (only applicable to external applicants).

Assumption of duties:
01 September 2023.

Closing date:
15 July 2023.

Salary:
The salary scale is available on request.

Fringe Benefits:
(Subject to specific conditions): pension scheme, medical aid scheme, group life insurance, housing allowance, leave and sick leave, service bonus and study benefits.

Enquiries:
For enquiries, please feel free to contact me at 051 401 2979 or email at jardines@ufs.ac.za or Recruit@ufs.ac.za. Additionally, kindly contact 051 401 9810 / 9813 / 9814/ 9848 for assistance.

General:
The UFS is a designated employer and is committed to the pursuit of excellence, diversity, and redress in achieving its equity targets in accordance with the Employment Equity Plan of the University and its Employment Equity goals and targets. Preference will be given to candidates from the under-represented designated groups, including candidates with disabilities. Our Employment Equity Policy is available at : https://ufsacza.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/supportservices/hr/Employment Equity/EEA13_EE Plan UFS 1 March 2022 (003).pdf?csf=1&web=1&e=TjtoXH

The University processes personal information in line with its obligations under the Protection of Personal Information Act (POPIA) and any personal information provided to the University will be treated as confidential and processed in accordance with the rights provided to data subjects under POPIA.

The UFS reserves the right to not fill this post. The UFS will only consider applications of candidates who meet all the inherent requirements of the position. Applications that are incomplete will not be considered. Communication will be limited to shortlisted candidates only. Should you not be contacted within six weeks of the closing date for applications, you may assume that your application was unsuccessful.

The UFS will only consider applications of candidates who meet all the inherent requirements of the position.

Gauteng, Tshwane (Pretoria)
We are recruiting for a Senior Manager - IT Audit.
Key Performance Areas

Assist the Chief Audit Executive in Preparing Strategic Risk-Based Audit Plans on the Risk Profile of the Organisation
  • Review the strategic objectives of the organization and the action plans designed to achieve those objectives.
  • Monitor the environment to determine risk factors that may impact the achievement of the objectives.
  • Identity audit needs based on strategic objectives and the risk profile.

Co-ordinate Value Adding Reports and Prepare Packs for the Board and its Committees
  • Assist the CAE in the following tasks:
  • Assess the actual assurance provided and to whom the assurance is provided including the quality of the assurance.
  • Do risk mapping using the strategic, key operational and business unit-level risk profiles to establish what risks are assured and by whom and what risks should be assured and by whom.
  • Provide input into the blueprint for the combined assurance which includes the risk-based assurance coverage, analysed per assurance provider and management/ governance committee responsible.


  • Evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of controls based on audits conducted to provide a written assessment to the Board.
  • Compile Audit Committee quarterly reports for Audit Committee meetings.
  • Develop the Internal Audit Charter

Develop Audit Policies and Methodologies
  • Identify appropriate audit methodologies that are available including the use of technology.
  • Review the audit manual, policies and processes for adequacy and recommend and assist in making the necessary improvements.

Drive the Execution and Completion of Audits as per the Annual Internal Audit Plan
  • Drive the execution & completion of audits as per the annual audit plan.
  • Identifying performance gaps during the audit execution and audit staff competency and proficiency gaps and advise business on areas of improvement.
  • Perform quality assurance reviews on the work of internal audit.
  • Provide technical advice to the IT Audit staff on technical application of the Standards for the Professional Practice of Internal Audit.
  • Determine whether the organisation’s network of risk management, control and governance processes, as designed and represented by management is adequate and functioning.
  • Ensure that quality and continuous improvement are fostered in the organisation’s control process.

Strategy Development and Operational Planning
  • Guide the development and implementation of the departmens strategy and plan that ensure alignment with short-term and long-term objectives.
  • Guide implementation of the overall strategic plan for the department.
  • Guide the implementation of specific key performance indicators and measures against outcomes detailed in the departmental strategic plans.

Policy Review and Implementation
  • Support the development and implementation of policy, procedures and processes for the business unit and ensure effective execution of policy and practices.
  • Collaborate with appropriate structures to ensure effective execution of policy and practices.
  • Ensure that all employees in the team know and understand the RAF policies.

Stakeholder Management
  • Maintain proactive and progressive relationships with key stakeholders.
  • Engage with relevant internal stakeholders.
  • Communicate with all levels of relevant stakeholder contact.
  • Delegate inquiries and requests for information from both internal and external stakeholders

People Management
  • Ensure the motivation, cohesiveness, and alignment of the organization’s team members.
  • Ensure Implementation of human capital processes and procedures to control/regulate workplace conflict and/or institute corrective measures and consultation processes to address deviations from standards.

Financial Management
  • Ensure that the periodic financial and strategic goals of RAF as well as the performance expectations of the various teams are achieved.
  • Report and review operations financial and non-financial goals.

Qualifications and Experience
  • Bachelor’s Degree/ Advanced Diploma in Auditing/ Accounting/ IT related qualification.
  • Postgraduate in Auditing (Internal and External) or IT related qualification.
  • CISA certification is Compulsory.
  • Registration with the Information Systems Auditing Control Association (ISACA).


  • Other certifications such as CGEIT, CRISC, CISM, CIA, CISSP, MBL, MBA will be an added advantage.
  • Minimum of 9 - 10 years' relevant experience in an IT Auditing related environment of which 3 years must have been on managerial level/area of expertise.
  • Cyber and security review is compulsory.
  • Data analytics experience is compulsory.
  • Project assurance reviews is compulsory.
  • SAP Basis and SAP Application Controls review experience is an added advantage.
  • Experience in Non-Internal Auditing is an added advantage.

Technical and Behavioural Competencies Required
  • Strategic capability.
  • Business and financial acumen.
  • Compliance and governance.
  • Leadership agility.
  • Client Service Orientation.
  • Policy conceptualization and formulation.
  • Risk management.
  • Service delivery innovation.
  • Knowledge of IT governance frameworks, practices, and practical.
  • (COBIT, ITIL, NIST, ISO27001) and Project Management Frameworks (e.g., Prince 2, Agile, PMBOK), King IV, etc.
  • Knowledge of management information systems terminology, concepts, etc.
  • Principles relating to Governance, Risk Management, and control frameworks.
  • Excellent skill in conducting quality control reviews of audit work products including Quality Assurance Improvement Program (QAIP).
  • Excellent skill in planning and project management.
Proficient in computer skills.
For more information please contact:
Tebogo Rankhumise

display_title: Licensing Technology Sales Representative - Public Sector
job_description:
Licensing Technology Sales Representative - Public Sector-230002N2

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages : English
Preferred Qualifications


Oracle is leading the digital revolution. We are empowering nearly half a million businesses across the globe to turn untapped potential into real business value. You will connect the biggest enterprises of today with the tools to compete in the digital economy of tomorrow.

Description

What You’ll Do
Be the vital piece of the puzzle that connects us to the millions of businesses that need our help to evolve. If you are passionate, entrepreneurial, innovative, and believe in being consultative and having fun whilst you work, then this could be the perfect opportunity for you.

We are seeking a motivated sales individual who can sell our entire technology solutions portfolio in a license sales model. As we continue to help customers to transition to Cloud, we make sure their needs for an On-premise solution are still covered.

You would cover a wide range of solutions from Database, data management Solutions (Analytics, Integration..etc) as well as Cybersecurity, middleware, and other exciting digital solutions. You will help your customers, who have growing data volumes and aggressive service-level expectations, maximize the potential of their IT organizations

Having a sense of humor in what can be a pressure environment helps, and the rewards for your contribution include a compensation and benefits package and a continuous training program in a structured environment that are world-class.

Job Description

  • Develop infrastructure/Database/Middleware/BI/Big data License Sales opportunities and maintain customer relationships in a designated market vertical/customer.
  • The portfolio will be our wide technology portfolio. Although the right candidate should be able to orchestrate a speech across the complete offering of Oracle in front of a client and work alongside other internal teams to be one Oracle for the customer.
  • Promote and evangelize Oracle products to selected customers, partners, and internal audiences
  • Develop relationships and collaborate with our partners to define, recommend, and drive sales
  • Develop and execute a sales plan that provides complete territory and sector-specific coverage
  • Develop appropriate sales programs and solutions; maintain up-to-date competitive information and compile regional success stories
  • Meet with senior customer contacts to build credibility and develop lasting relationships
  • Closing deals winning business etc. as well as developing opportunities
  • Engage with Pre-Sales Technical support for customer meetings to develop customer discussions further
  • Lead successful go-to-market campaigns by working closely with internal marketing specialists
  • Contribute and lead in account planning, customer/market analysis, and strategy sessions
  • Contribute individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Being able to orchestrate proposals together with other internal business groups in the same solutions team or others. Understand that is all about the customer.

Required Skills/Experience

What You’ll Bring
Your enthusiasm, knowledge, and customer-centricity will help us continue our growth as a top IT company.

We also look for:

  • Experience of working within the Public Sector Industry - Mandatory
  • 5+ years of experience in direct software sales to complex/Large Enterprises
  • Experience in the designated market vertical /customer would be required
  • Good understanding of the information technology customer needs and strong technical expertise to become a trusted advisor across a wide technology portfolio.
  • Proven track record in a sales-driven organization, selling technology-related products and services
  • Solid written, verbal, and presentation skills
  • Creative with strong problem-solving skills and an ability to succeed in a fast-paced environment
  • Proven ability to work well as part of an extended sales team
  • Knowledge of Oracle products is preferred but not essential
  • Fluency in English
  • Team player and self-motivated

A career at Oracle is defined by you. We give you the freedom—and the skills—to write your own success story. Whatever avenue you go down, you’ll gain priceless learning experiences and be supported to do your best work.

Create the future with us. Apply now.

In line with our obligations under the Employment Equity Act 1998, preference will be given to candidates from designated groups.


Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to a large number of named accounts/non-named accounts/geographical territory (mainly Tier 3 accounts).

Primary job duty is to sell technology software products and related services in a defined territory. Identifies, qualifies and closes new opportunities. Manages accounts including the entire sales process from business development prospecting and specifications through contract negotiations, signing, and post-sales support. Leverages the Oracle sales model to maximize revenue growth and increase local market share. Builds and expands business partner revenue and self sufficiency.

Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. 8 years applicable experience including 7 years of technology sales experience. Ability to forecast, manage sales expenses, and successfully close new Oracle business. Business development, prospecting and presentation skills. Excellent communication skills and problem solving ability. Proven track record of exceeding sales objective and territory/account development. Experience as the focal point for clients for all sales and related issues. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle*s competitors. Travel may be needed. Bachelor degree or equivalent.

As part of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required to successfully complete a pre-employment screening process. This will involve identity and employment verification, professional references, education verification and professional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).

Job: Sales

Location: ZA-ZA,South Africa-Johannesburg

Job Type: Regular Employee Hire

Organization: Oracle

Business Intelligence Analyst

IT – Analyst, Data Management
Johannesburg – Gauteng

ENVIRONMENT:
Our client, a leading provider serving clients in the USA, Europe, and the UK, is seeking a talented Business Intelligence Analyst to join their team. They pride themselves on their cutting-edge software technology and their commitment to staying ahead of market trends. In this role, you will play a vital part in extracting valuable insights from large datasets and supporting the decision-making process. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to transform data into actionable information, enabling well-informed business decisions. Having a Microsoft Business Intelligence (MSBI) certification, particularly in Querying Data with Transact-SQL (70-461), would be advantageous. A bachelor’s degree is also beneficial, along with at least 3 years of experience working with SQL Server databases and Transact-SQL.
DUTIES:
  • Identify potential process improvements and areas within the business for the BI team to get involved.
  • Preparing reports and presentations and deriving business insights
  • Ad hoc analysis (scenario modelling, impact analysis etc.)
  • Develop, test, and implement data driven (SQL) reports.
  • Identify new process improvement opportunities.
  • Excellent written and verbal skills
  • Analise customer behavior, market trends and demographics.
  • Project management skills.
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Any Microsoft Business Intelligence (MSBI) certification – No negotiations (70-461: Querying Data with Transact-SQL advantageous).
  • Bachelor’s degree advantageous.

  • Experience with SSRS.
  • Database documentation experience.

Job Title
Key Accounts Manager Projects
Job Description
We’re looking for a Key Account Manager - Projects to join our Sales Team in Johannesburg South Africa.
Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.
As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!
Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.
As a Key Account Manager you’ll be responsible for growing Signify's footprint in key verticals, delivering large complex projects and ensuring financial metrics are met or exceeded, establishing long term relationships and expanding Signify's install base of state of the art lighting technology.
We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!
What you’ll do
  • This role is responsible for building and fostering relationships with selected key accounts to maximize, profitability and customer satisfaction with these accounts
  • As a Key Account Manager have an in-depth understanding of the customer strategy in the country and define an account strategy that drives profitable high growth opportunities for Signify as well as operationally managing the execution
  • Responsible for developing and executing a Strategic Account Management vision/plan to enable profitable growth of Signify business with the account. Accountable for entire business with the named account, personally driving most important transactions (projects or sell-in)
  • Expected to unlock more and higher value project opportunities by building and leveraging solid network of contacts within customer and ecosystem landscape – generating pull for our innovations. such a KAM see that in Systems & Services, VAP, Agriculture, Professional Projects (i.e. Professional Public, Professional O&I, Professional R&H).
  • Establishes and nurtures productive, professional relationships with key personnel in assigned few key accounts with the objective of establishing Signify as trusted business partner
  • Defines and leads Account Team consisting of cross-functional Signify personnel (e.g. Sales Specialists, Channel / End User Marketing, Product Marketing, Order Desk, Quote Support, Proposal Management, LiAS, Project Management, Customer Satisfaction etc.) with the objective of meeting account performance objectives and customer’s expectations
  • Ensures profitable business growth with the account, as per assigned targets
  • Proactively leads a joint company-strategic account planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones for a one and three-year period
  • Proactively leads a joint-company, strategic account planning process, that develops mutual performance objectives and financial targets, identifies white spaces for relationship and business development, and sets critical milestones for a one and three-year period
  • Effectively manages complex dynamics within the customer ecosystem – cross-functional customer team, 3rd party specifiers & deal influencers, Signify partners and alliances
  • Lives by our competencies and behaviors
Your Experience
  • 5+ years of proven track record in key account management and consultative selling principles in a fast-paced technology industry
  • Strong CRM (SFDC) cadence
  • 5+ years of strong history of quota achievement with stellar experience presenting products & services to accounts
  • Experience in selling complex offerings consisting of multiple building blocks – e.g., diverse hardware, software, servicing
  • Key account planning skills and focus on strategic relationships development
  • Technical qualification and experience in light current will be an advantage e.g. NDip./N6 Elec. Eng.
Our candidate profile is just a guide. We know that many talented people only apply for jobs when there is an exact match. If you don't fit all the criteria but believe this role is for you, we would very much like to hear from you.
What you’ll get in return…
We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.
See
#SignifyLife
through the eyes of our employees!

Looking for a challenging and rewarding career opportunity as a Principal Data Scientist? Our client is currently seeking an experienced and driven individual to join their team based in Sandton.

As the Principal Data Scientist, you will be responsible for analyzing large datasets using various data science techniques, such as statistics, simulation, optimization, and machine learning. Your primary focus will be on driving predictive and prescriptive intelligence for business applications.

To be considered for this role, you must have a Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Operations Research, or Engineering. A PhD in one of these fields would be advantageous. You should also have at least 13 years of applied experience using advanced analytics, statistical methods, and data science.

In addition, you must have fluency in computer programming and data structures, with expert coding capability in R/Python and SQL. Experience in Agile project delivery is also required, along with demonstrated thought leadership in the field of data science.

Experience in any of the following areas will be preferred: retail/customer loyalty, price & cost optimization, inventory optimization, sales and operations planning, and digital twins. Applied experience in deep learning techniques, such as NLP and computer vision, is preferred but not essential.

You should have good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields. Additionally, you should have at least 4 years of experience in distributed computing, Databricks, Spark, containers, Git, and building effective CI/CD pipelines, PowerBI, and web frameworks. Azure certifications are preferred.

This is an exciting opportunity to work with a dynamic and innovative team that is focused on delivering cutting-edge solutions in the field of data science. If you have the skills and experience required for this role, please submit your application today

Experience : 5-7 years
Panagora Group is a social enterprise dedicated to providing high-quality, high-impact international health, development, and learning consulting. We are a dynamic woman- and employee-owned small business partner focused on market-based and integrated local solutions that strengthen country capacity and independence; and on learning, communications, and technology solutions to accelerate and heighten impact. As a small business, we are able to implement novel and innovative approaches using highly participatory approaches to mobilize community, civil society, and government energy in defining and owning solutions, and to promote inclusive development that benefits all groups.


The Technical Support Services (TSS) Activity helps USAID/South Africa and Regional Health Office (RHO) to address technical priorities and develop creative, innovative solutions to strategically allocate resources, strengthen connections with partners, and replicate best practices and effective program models. Through the TSS contract, Panagora Group augments capacity by providing technical, operational, and administrative support to USAID’s largest health portfolio. TSS deploys advisors in response to USAID requests for priority work with government stakeholders, implementing partners, and/or other entities. TSS supports Health Office staff and teams to integrate creative solutions into routine work. TSS also provides international and local expertise for surge support, as needed, for USAID Program Cycle requirements, planning, development, outreach, communications, and Health Office human resource functions.

Position Summary

The Solutions Advisor | Strategic Information provides public health programming, reengineering, data management, analytic, and visualization support across TSS projects to support USAID/South Africa as well as USAID regional health offices (including but not limited to RHO, Eswatini, Lesotho, and Mozambique) to meet critical program objectives. S/he will be responsible for various tasks as described below; for these tasks the Solutions Advisor | Strategic Information will both complete the work and as requested develop the capacity of colleagues, USAID, government or implementing partner counterparts. The Solutions Advisor | Strategic Information will integrate innovative solutions to all projects, leverage what has worked previously, and adapt approaches to integrate lessons learned and to customize solutions to the unique needs of each Health Office.


Primary Responsibilities

The Solutions Advisor | Strategic Information will support one or more of the following tasks, core activities and deliverables as listed below and as assigned , based on TSS’ work plans . For these activities the consultant may be asked to complete the tasks and/or develop the capacity of colleagues, USAID, government or implementing partner counterparts to complete these tasks. Other activities/tasks may be assigned based on the needs of TSS as defined in our work plan.


Data management support

  • Support the implementation of strategies to improve data management and reporting including data collection, data quality assurance, and data sharing to improve routine data reporting .
  • Support with the review of current USAID reporting requirements, processes, and tools, including identifying gaps and areas for improvement and provid e recommendations .
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to find innovative solutions to programmatic and operational challenges related to data management and reporting.
  • Conceptualize and design data cleaning and data quality assessment (DQA) approaches and tools.
  • Create, review, and refine both written and visual project content and deliverables for a diverse audience, including process flow diagrams, standard operating procedures, and training slide decks.

Analytics support

  • Conceptualize comprehensive responses to data requests from a variety of stakeholders through the design and development of metrics, the comprehensive interpretation of the analytics, and generating and providing recommendations.
  • Support with the preliminary review of datasets for integrity as necessary and transforming data sets.
  • Support with the development of guidelines and best practices related to data science and analytics.
  • Work across USAID country teams (including South Africa, RHO, Mozambique, Eswatini, Lesotho) to use priority data to highlight programmatic success and opportunities for improvement in issue briefs or presentations in a variety of settings.
  • Conceptualize, facilitate and contribute to communities of practice to bring the latest knowledge and resources to influence data analytics, visualization, and best practices for programmatic results.

Data Visualization support

  • Using the Tableau visualization software and architecture create interactive dashboards and accompanying summary interpretations for USAID health offices (including South Africa, RHO, Mozambique, Eswatini, Lesotho), implementing partners, and other stakeholders, as required .
  • Guide the design and development of a wide variety of data visualization products to support end users to understand and use the information to make programmatic decisions.
  • Find innovative solutions to show and/or visualize data with the goal of facilitating its understanding and use by USAID and its stakeholders.
  • Support the implementation of best practices within and across USAID health offices and support the understanding and use of data using Tableau for improved program performance.


Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in public health, data management, project management, or related discipline and/or appropriate certification or relevant work experience .
  • 4+ years working in data management and/or data analytic projects within Southern Africa.
  • Excellent work product design, formatting, and visual skills, including demonstrable design knowledge, such as layout, typography, color, and interaction design; expertise with charting and other data visualization techniques.
  • Experience with Tableau is required .
  • Experience in data analytic programs such as R, Stata, and/or SPSS advantageous
  • Experience with USAID and/or PEPFAR programs and indicators and general knowledge of the issues concerning HIV and tuberculosis in Southern Africa.
  • Comfortable working in teams as well as acting independently in the implementation of specific tasks, multitasking and prioritizing.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work with individuals from diverse professional backgrounds, with experience working in multidisciplinary teams.
  • Analytical thinking and attention to detail, with demonstrated experience in managing complex projects in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment.
  • Strong stakeholder relationship and communication skills .
  • Proven capacity to take initiative, strong work ethic, and the ability to work well independently and as part of a team.
  • Excellent verbal and written English language skills, including report writing and presentations in the English language.
  • Proven capacity to take initiative and willingness to learn new skills as needed.


To Apply: Fill out the online application. Please include a cover letter and resume. Applications without a cover letter will not be considered. Applicants will be required to complete a skills test.


No telephone inquiries, please. Finalists will be contacted. Only applicants who include the required application components will be considered.

  • Work within a team of Risk Analysts on best practice Credit Risk Management principles and statistical analysis.

  • Develop and monitor predictive models aimed at the optimisation of risk decision-making.
  • Present ideas via reports and presentations, outlining findings and making recommendations for improvements to senior stakeholders.
  • Investigate data integrity issues, test assumptions and validate analytical results, ensuring accuracy and sensitivity of findings.

  • Assist implementing strategy changes to live decision systems.

Syntech is a fast-growing technology distributor, and our goal is to improve lives through the innovative technology we bring to the market – from cutting-edge smart home technology to the latest innovative gaming gear, consumer electronics, and commercial solutions.

We are looking for a full-time Marketing Supervisor to join our marketing team in Cape Town. You’ll work on-site alongside a growing team of talented creatives and marketing specialists to implement B2B and B2C campaigns.

The Marketing Supervisor is responsible for leading a team of marketing professionals to develop and execute marketing campaigns, strategies, and initiatives that drive business growth. This role requires a strong focus on people management and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

Job Responsibilities

  • Manage a team of marketing professionals, providing guidance, coaching, and support to help them achieve their goals and grow their skills.
  • Oversee monthly KPA sessions for each marketing team member, with specific focus on ensuring all outputs are data-driven & quantifiable.
  • Develop and execute comprehensive marketing campaigns, strategies, and initiatives that align with overall business objectives.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, product, and design, to ensure marketing efforts are aligned with overall business goals.
  • Monitor campaign performance, analyse results, and make data-driven recommendations for continuous improvement.
  • Manage marketing budgets, ensuring campaigns are delivered on-time and on-budget.
  • Develop and maintain relationships with internal stakeholders, vendors, and partners to ensure seamless execution of campaigns.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in marketing.
  • Develop and maintain the marketing calendar, ensuring all campaigns are planned and executed on-time and on-budget.
  • Collaborate with the sales team to develop targeted marketing campaigns that support lead generation and revenue growth.
  • Create and execute A/B testing plans to optimize campaign performance and ROI.
  • Manage the development of marketing collateral, including product sheets, case studies, and presentations.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or a related field.
  • At least 5-7 years of experience in marketing, with a focus on campaign management, strategy development, and team management.
  • Strong people management skills, with the ability to motivate, inspire, and coach team members to achieve their goals.
  • Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and manage budgets.
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Analytical mindset with a focus on data-driven decision making.
  • Experience in collating and analysing marketing data, presenting findings to senior management, and making data-driven recommendations.
  • Excellent leadership skills, with the ability to build and maintain a high-performing team.
  • Experience with marketing automation tools, CRM systems, and analytics platforms.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing business needs.

We’re hiring an RPA Developer!

You would be part of the Mr Price Advance team which looks after data analytics, reporting, data science and automations across the group

why you should join the team?

We’re focusing on improving and modernizing our business processes, enter RPA. With automation we can unlock time within our business ensuring processes are optimised and efficient.

requirements to apply
