  • Process modelling experience using MS Visio or any other tools with a solid understanding of workflow-based logic.
  • Ability to write technical specification documents with the added skill to present technical details to non-technical audiences.
  • Experience in database configuration, writing SQL queries and troubleshooting.
  • Experience consuming APIs.
  • Agile development methodology advantageous.
  • Knowledge of artificial intelligence and machine learning advantageous.
  • Strong attention to detail, problem solving/analytical skills .
  • Excellent presentation, verbal, and written communication skills.
  • Self-motivated, able to work independently, multitask in a fast-paced environment, prioritise and able to take initiative.

a day in your life

  • Design, develop, test, and deploy automation workflows.
  • Support and maintain RPA solutions.
  • Create & Update technical documentation.
  • Participate in user process discovery workshops.

about us

We have benefits! From the financial benefits like medical aid for you and your fam, pension fund, bonus structures & shares, to the cultural benefits like a growth & innovation culture, half day Fri-yay’s, study leave & great coffee! We have ‘em all.

The greatest asset of most organizations is their people. In an era of rapidly developing technology, greater workforce mobility and increasing customer demands, having a cohesive human capital strategy is crucial for business success. We know that high-performing businesses cultivate and grow talent, carefully balancing costs and rewards. From employee engagement to change management, we take a rounded perspective, based on leading-edge thinking, data, analytics and software, unearthing new ways to attract, engage and retain talent – and shape the Talent Management & Organizational Development.

Our human capital clients are varied – we advise organisations across all industries, from financial services to retail, telecommunications and energy. We advise many of the world’s leading and largest companies and often interact with our offices around the world to provide a truly global service offering. We provide invaluable advice to companies at some of the most exciting and critical moments in their lifecycle, at times when employee engagement and retention is crucial – from mergers and acquisitions to listing on the stock market.

The Role

You will work as both a project manager and a key contributor to projects that help client organizations enable business strategies and improve how they attract, retain and engage talent. This will include, but not be limited to, the following:

  • Sell, develop and implement solutions including talent acquisition, talent analytics, career architecture, competency management, organizational design, performance management, leader succession and development, workforce wellbeing and employee engagement.
  • Taking EX insights gathered through our work and supporting other project managers and sellers across the broader Talent business in integrating these into their client work across the employee experience spectrum.
  • Supporting the delivery of insights software administration projects (pulse, virtual focus groups and other) by developing relationships with clients, suppliers and project team members to coordinate the logistics of the day to day running of their projects. This will include understanding organisational hierarchies/matrix structures and helping set-up surveys and reporting structures that align to each unique organisation.
  • Support for design and set-up of employee perception questionnaires, support for translations, printing / on-line set-up, distribution and return of questionnaire materials will also be required.
  • Provide actionable insights on improving employee engagement, shaping a high-performance culture and achieving optimal returns on talent and program investments
  • Contribute to new business development by drafting statements of work, project plans and budgets involving multiple workflow streams and client teams
  • Demonstrate effective sales behaviours, including team collaboration, creativity, compelling RFP writing, persistent follow-up, sound judgment in scoping/pricing, and focusing on closing the deal
  • Deliver profitable revenue to the business through individual sales and billable hours goals

The requirements


  • Bachelor or Master’s degree in for example (but not limited to) business administration, HR, psychology etc.
  • +4 years in management consulting experience
  • You are extremely curious about what makes people tick and you are eager to help them thrive in their job and organization.
  • You are good impacting and influencing to convince people with ideas and good practices and you have strong abilities in sales
  • You are good at building relationships, both internally and externally.
  • You deliver top quality, you are proactive and flexible and you show a can do mentality. You are enthusiastic, a team player, creative and able to think out of the box.
  • Your English is sophisticated; additional language skills will be a plus.
  • Good problem-solving and analytical skills, as well as excellent communication skills, as you will be interacting with clients from the beginning.
  • You have availability to work remotely and client based; you enjoy travelling for work

The Application Process

  • Stage 1: Online application and recruiter review
  • Stage 2: Pre-recorded video interview
  • Stage 3: Live video interview with hiring manager and team
  • Stage 4: Offer and onboarding

Preference will be given to applicants from designated groups, in line with the South African Employment Equity Act.
WTW is committed to finding opportunities to promote workplace flexibility when possible based on the needs of our customers and the company. We are pleased to say that this role meets the criteria for flexible work.

Who We Are


Yoco was founded in 2015, and now processes over US$2 billion annually. We’re the payments provider for over 200 000 self-employed, and opening commerce for all. We’re breaking down barriers and unlocking economic opportunities that enable people to thrive.

We have over 350 team members globally, operating across international markets, all with a bias for boldness, and a passion for simple, progressive solutions. We believe in uniting different people to solve hard problems together.

Our mission of making society more equal takes a variety of people, with different backgrounds and points of view, so we can keep building solutions that work for and include everyone.

Yoco is growing, and as we grow we have compelling challenges ahead of us.

Growing means we’re enabling more self-employed people and businesses to thrive every day. It also means that ambitious problem-solvers with big ideas are challenged, stimulated and will thrive at Yoco.

We don’t stop pushing, we break things to rebuild, we challenge ourselves and each other. We’re constantly evolving — and we’re doing it fast.

Grow With Us.


About the Total Reward Team


Within the Yoco People & Culture team, the Total Reward function straddles the People Enablement ( Talent Acquisition and Operations) and People Experience ( Business Partnering and EX-design) functions.


Collectively, we are on a mission to reposition the Yoco People & Culture team as a strategic enablement function, influencing business decisions using people data and analytics, and providing data driven insights to influence all aspects of the Yoco candidate and employee journey.


About the Compensation Analyst role


This is an opportunity for an enthusiastic Analyst to help us expand our Compensation and People Analytics capabilities and deliver on the vision of the Yoco People & Culture team.

As a Total Reward function, we combine compensation and people analytics, model design, compensation expertise and strategic thinking to deliver on the operational requirements of reward-related people processes and provide long range insights into people-related business decisions.


What You Will Be Doing

  • Act as the execution partner to the Head of Total Reward, requiring you to have an intricate understanding of the company's total reward strategy, compensation & benefits policies, frameworks and processes, and act as a subject matter expert in this regard.

  • Act as an advisory and business partner to all business leaders in the area of compensation and benefits, leading any related change or execution efforts in tandem with the Head of Total Reward.

  • Foster an open and transparent approach to all compensation and benefits engagements by being knowledgeable and able to talk through our remuneration principles effortlessly.

  • Support hiring managers and recruiters with offer and package structuring, role sizing and matters of internal parity when it comes to remuneration and benefits structuring.

  • Manage the administration, pre-work and execution of the salary increase process.

  • Support and manage the administration and execution of the annual share allocations and vesting process.

  • Support and guide the payroll and talent acquisition teams with compensation and benefits queries and processes.

  • Set up systems to track and monitor employee costs and provide useful insights and data to the finance team.

  • Ensure compliance with organisational and legislative governance frameworks and standards in all the countries where Yoco has registered entities.

  • Ensure that our data management practices adhere to privacy and legal compliance requirements.

  • Continuously research compensation and benefits data from outside the organisation, feeding this into our thinking and design of our total reward offering.

  • Continuously upskill yourself on the most current compensation and benefits trends, remuneration surveys and management tools.



About You


  • You have a strong background & proven track record in Compensation Analytics with experience in broader People Analytics being an advantage

  • Strong proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets and analytics visualisation tools e.g. Tableau, SQL, Power BI or similar.

  • You have exceptional analytical, problem solving and compensation modelling skills, with an aptitude for keeping it simple.

  • You have strong communication skills - you’re able to crunch numbers, synthesise and communicate meaningful insights.

  • You have a solid understanding of benefits and compensation programs, policies, procedures, and applicable legislation.

  • You have demonstrated the ability to roll up your sleeves, get stuck in and work within multiple teams.

  • You are passionate, humble and have a strong orientation towards enabling shared success.



The People We Are Looking For


We’re looking for people who want to grow. And as Yoco grows we hope they stay with us, long term

Building things that make society more equal is a daunting task. And it’s not for everyone. We never stop pushing, we break things to rebuild, we challenge ourselves and teammates. We start over, we constantly evolve — and we do it fast. We know that it’s just the right kind of meaningful madness for our kind of visionary human.

So, who are you? You’re someone who resonates with our mission, but also our values, when it comes to how we work.

You’re a curious problem-solver with a passion for doing good. You’re bright and grounded, experimental and bold. You play open cards and get stuck in. You’re not afraid of change. You close the loop.

At Yoco, we love to laugh, cherish each other’s quirks, and be authentic.

Find out more about who we are here.

We're looking for a SEO Manager to join our digital-first agency in Cape Town.

We are looking for an SEO Manager to coordinate SEO efforts, including onsite and offsite optimization and keyword expansion research. You’ll also oversee paid search campaigns to ensure their success.

We are looking for an analytical and perceptive professional who is a skilled communicator and able to collaborate with various teams. Current knowledge of SEO practices and techniques is essential to this role.

Your goal will be to ensure that content is search-engine friendly and optimized to increase our company’s profitability.

Responsibilities

  • BSc/BA in Marketing, Business or related field

Technical Maintenance Data Query Analyst

We seek out and invest in exceptional individuals who understand and support our core purpose, and whose own values align with those of Discovery. As global thought leaders, Discovery is passionate about innovating in order to not only achieve financial success, but to ignite positive and meaningful change within our society.
Discovery value – Force for good

Introduction

VKB Agriculture (Pty) Ltd is a dynamic agricultural company in the Northeast Free State with interests in Limpopo. This organization, which strives towards healthy and modern business practices offers employees the opportunity to utilize and develop their knowledge and skills in a competitive work environment. We offer you the opportunity to establish yourself within a professional, corporate environment in the countryside.

Job Description

SAICA trainee program within the Internal Audit department where you will gain relevant experience and exposure in all the different subsidiaries of the VKB group in the Free State. The successful candidate will be required to perform ad-hoc audits, routine audits and other Internal Audit functions within the VKB Group.

Risk & Reporting Analytics Manager Finance/Admin
Cape Town - Western Cape
ENVIRONMENT:
DEVELOP & implement a comprehensive and effective Credit Risk Management Framework utilising your expertise to fill the role of the next Risk & Reporting Analytics Manager sought by an innovative Financial Services Group. You will further support the implementation of the Credit Strategy through the development of policy, including the monitoring and forecasting of the Credit Risk Portfolio. The successful incumbent requires a Bachelors tertiary qualification in Commerce/Science/Humanities with a focus on Stats/IT/Economics or Maths or similar discipline, have 5 years experience in Credit Risk Analysis on lending products and relational databases with the ability to effectively use statistical software particularly SAS. Prior experience in Financial Services/Retail Credit will be preferred and you must have the strong ability to interpret data and communicate this to key stakeholders.
DUTIES:
  • Develop analytical methodology, tools, processes and control frameworks to assess credit risk.
  • Manage credit risk reporting and dashboard development.
  • Monitor reports for scorecard performance, policy exceptions, adherence to defined risk tolerance and performance.
  • Forecast credit risk across portfolios, considering emerging risks and changes in external conditions.
  • Ensure reporting is aligned to shareholders requirements.
  • Lead monthly risk meeting, presenting portfolio overviews and promoting discussions on current focus areas.

To provide assistance in any of the 3 Event Support functions – Data Management, Event Relations and Event Support

Event Relations – the team will work on non-revenue outbound calling campaigns which may include but is not limited to visitor invites,

Christian Vision SA is looking for a full-time Digital Campaign Manager with a passion for evangelism and a heart for ministry to drive growth and innovation through our digital marketing efforts across a wide variety of channels.

About us

Christian Vision (CV) is a global Christian charity with evangelism at our heart. Founded in 1988 by Lord Robert Edmiston, CV’s strong desire is to serve and equip Christians, and the local church, in their evangelistic endeavours. To this end, we work to see impact in three key areas:

  • Introducing people to Jesus;
  • Mobilising Christians to evangelise; and
  • Resourcing the Church with free digital content and knowledge.

Job Overview

The Digital Campaign Manager is responsible for developing, implementing, tracking, optimising and reporting on our digital marketing campaigns across all webs, digital communications, database marketing, social media, email and online advertising campaign channels. This position reports to the Marketing Manager.

Specific Responsibilities

  • To create, run, monitor and optimise Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, Google Search and
    Google UAC campaigns in English and other African languages.
  • To allocate marketing budget towards achieving KPIs and goals (weekly, monthly,
    quarterly and annual).
  • To leverage analytics to track and interpret data sets to understand campaign
    performance, identify optimisation opportunities, drive decisions, and measure outcomes.
  • To provide data validation and campaign reporting. Clearly report results, key learnings
    from campaign tests, and propose recommendations based on analytical insights.
  • To innovate using AI, chatbot, and other emerging technologies.
  • To conduct research on target audiences as well as emerging digital techniques and
    technologies to introduce people to Jesus.

General Responsibilities

Fulfil other duties, as common to all employees and as directed, within parameters outlined in
both the mission and vision statements. This includes:

  • To be available for personal and spiritual growth opportunities.
  • To pro-actively maintain a positive attitude.
  • To adhere to all regulations, CV policies, procedures and guidelines.
  • To undertake professional development as required.
  • To adhere to all occupational health and safety requirements of CV.
  • To keep confidential the affairs of CV and its employees.
  • To represent CV in a positive manner.
  • To keep abreast of the latest methods and technologies.

Skills/ Experience/ Education

  • Highly skilled and competent in the use of Facebook Ads Manager and Google AdWords.
  • Experienced in Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, Statsbot, Sprout Social and
Supermetrics.
  • Has experience in performance marketing campaigns (cost per view, response, lead
campaigns, etc.).
  • A bachelor’s degree or other qualification in marketing, advertising or a related field is
preferred.
  • A 3+ year track record of participating in successful campaigns.

This role is based in Bellville (Cape Town, South Africa). Interested parties can submit their CV and cover letter, summarising why they are qualified for the position and want to work in ministry, via the ‘Apply Now’ button below.

We believe in a world where growth thrives across borders and cultures. That's why our Founder and CEO Rick Hammell started Atlas, coining the term Employer of Record (EOR) simultaneously. As an EOR, Atlas employs people to work for companies anywhere in the world. Before we came along, the only businesses offering a similar solution were essentially brokers. They'd outsource your HR and payroll services to third-party providers in different countries. Today, we're the only 100% Direct EOR in the world, partnering with clients to get to market 82% faster, at a reduced cost, and with lower risk through local expertise in over 160 countries.


Atlas technology powers the idea that companies can employ whoever they want, wherever they are in the world. Through our cloud-based platform, we deliver the Human Resources infrastructure that underpins international growth, leaving companies free to focus on the strategy that makes it happen. We partner with our clients through their international life cycle from the first dip in the global pool until the moment it's time to set up their own entities and run payroll. Atlas is here from point A to point Z.


The future of work is borderless, and so are we. So, it helps that our people are located around the globe — in the US, UK, India, China and beyond — and speak 90+ languages. Diversity and inclusion are at our core.


Atlas invests in Environment, Social and Governance initiatives through our impact program. Impact is central to our vision as a business and at the heart of our culture. Through impact we are addressing our environmental impact for society, for the planet and for our long-term success. Employee wellness, diversity and charitable activities are at the core of our social responsibility. Impact ensures Corporate Governance operates ethically and responsibly while preserving our customers and employees' trust.

What we value:

About the Company:

Our Client is a fast-growing startup that provides Crypto Education to thousands of students every month. Their mission is to build the ultimate crypto training and worldwide community for anyone to learn crypto in a fun, simple, and safe way.

They are searching for an excellent Video Content Editor to help them create engaging and informative content that will attract and retain a wide audience mainly on their YouTube channel. You will be responsible for developing and implementing content strategies that promote their brand, increase visibility and drive user acquisition for their Crypto Trading courses. If you have a passion for crypto, excellent editing skills and experience with video content creation, this exciting opportunity could be perfect for you.

Job Summary:

As a Video Content Editor at Crypto School, you will be responsible for creating and editing video content that drives user acquisition and engagement across all of our marketing channels, with a specific focus on our YouTube channel. You will work closely with the Head of Marketing and our video content producers to develop innovative and creative strategies that increase our brand awareness, build our audience, and drive registrations for our Crypto Trading courses.

  • Expert knowledge of YouTube content and its best practices for driving user acquisition and engagement, as well as other social media types of content (Twitter, Instagram, TikTok)

Nice to Haves:
  • Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, journalism, or a related field would be advantageous.
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
  • Some experience with data and analytics tools to monitor and optimize content performance would be advantageous.

JOB OVERVIEW
Business Segment: Consumer & High Net Worth Clients
Location: ZA, WC, Cape Town, Granger Bay Boulevard
Job Type: Full-time
Job ID: 80305082_80280106
Date Posted: 2/14/2023

JOB DESCRIPTION

To develop and oversee the implementation of marketing strategies and activities for the regional provincial units across the Western Cape geographies to grow and retain clients and assets. To be accountable for all aspects of go-to-market planning and implementation for Western Cape to position the business unit’s capabilities to internal distribution channels, staff, clients, and the external market.

QUALIFICATIONS

Marketing Degree
More than 8 Years’ experience in leading a Senior Marketing team in the implementation of marketing strategy for a medium to large organisation.

A proven track record in converting organisational knowledge and target audience insights into executable communication plans, coupled with the ability to design and oversee the implementation of marketing strategies either globally or across Africa.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Keep informed of developments in the fields of marketing, communications, public relations, digital marketing, client experience and financial services in order to use the insights gained to drive the organisation agility and innovation.

Commission appropriate research, through Strategic Insights Team, to develop relevant client insights to give direction to the Marketing and Communications Strategy. Translate and analyses research results to influence business action.

Provide the business units Heads with insight around competitive positioning and develop action plans to differentiate offerings through marketing communication. Enable effective decision making by reporting on the effectiveness of campaigns to assess the return on investment.

Execute and analyze integrated marketing strategies, take to market plans, and value propositions to deliver the desired client experience.

Drive and oversee client hospitality and event plans in support of deeper client relationships. Direct the development of marketing solutions which capitalize on new client opportunities.

Act as the voice of the client, ensuring ongoing client insights gathering, and the incorporation of behavioral sciences and data analytics Financial.

Management

Develop and monitor budgets for marketing spent within the business unit that is consistent with the financial guidelines provided by the business unit and Western Cape Provincial Marketing. Responsible for ensuring that the marketing financial objectives within the business unit are met by overseeing forecasting requirements; preparing a consolidated annual budget for marketing across the business unit; analyzing overall variances; and directing corrective actions within the team.

People:
Develop recognition for formal and informal collaboration that resolves issues, prevents issues, and creates value for internal and external clients. Accountable for the recruitment, development, motivation, and retention of marketing staff ensuring the team is adequately staffed and skilled to deliver on the marketing plan.

Partner with Human Capital to ensure skills assessments and competency-based training takes place as and when required to build expertise within the team and to foster an environment in which leaning, and development are emphasized and valued.

Build organizational capabilities through evaluating likely future requirements and ensuring that individuals are provided with the best possible development opportunities in line with these.

Develop and maintain open communication with direct reports and support staff to foster greater co-operation and teamwork. Monitor and manage the performance and development of staff within the team. This includes regular one-on-one feedback sessions, conducting mid-year and final performance appraisals, as well as the moderation and relative distribution of all appraisals for the team.

Product:
Provide strategic direction to all third-party agencies working on the business units marketing inclusive of but not limited to advertising, digital, promotions and media agencies ensuring all marketing activities contribute to the Wealth strategy and continuously drive proof points of Consumers High Net Worth & Business Banking.

Provide input into the development of new markets and propositions within the various business units to support the continued relevance of the various business units' offering.

Direct and oversee all marketing related activities and functions including direct marketing, digital and social media marketing, public relations, events, sponsorships and market research ensuring effective implementation in line with the marketing plan.

Strategy

Develop and implement marketing strategies, inclusive of a communications, public relations, marketing and digital and social media strategy, for the Consumers High Net Worth & Business Banking unit.

Develop an in-depth understanding of the various business unit strategies, plans and objectives in order to develop marketing strategies in line with the business needs, Standard Bank Groups Marketing and Comms strategy and overall Western Cape Marketing strategy.

Develop global marketing strategies with local execution and create centre of excellence where appropriate to drive agile adoption of marketing practices from one jurisdiction to the other.

Technology & Architecture:
Drive the development and implementation of a digital marketing strategy.

Develop and implement marketing evaluation systems that relate business unit goals and objectives to the impact of marketing interventions in order to illustrate the return of investment of the various interventions.

Zenysis is a global technology startup that builds an integration and advanced analytics software that empowers governments and international organizations to deliver lifesaving health programs in a truly-data driven way.
We are a diverse team of software engineers, diplomats, and public health and development experts, and we are on a mission to transform the capacity of governments and international organizations to respond to the biggest global health challenges of our time.
Governments in 12 countries across Africa, Asia, and South America currently use our software to deliver lifesaving healthcare to millions of people in need, track pandemic threats, and coordinate responses to large-scale emergencies.
We are currently funded by USAID, the Global Fund, Gavi, the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation and PAHO among others. We also have access to venture capital funding and recently landed a US$13.3M investment that we are using to build our team and accelerate our growth.
At Zenysis, we are proactive about ensuring a healthy work/life balance and invest heavily in learning and personal development. As a global company, diversity, equity, and inclusion are core parts of our values and how we conduct ourselves as a team.

The Role:
We are looking for a Technical Project Manager (TPM) to lead the technical delivery of our projects and support the expansion of our portfolio in South Africa.
As a TPM, you will assume full ownership of the technology implementation of a project, which involves scoping integrations, defining appropriate data access policies, outlining pipeline connections, cleaning and transforming data for integration, communicating integration instructions to the engineering team and producing external and internal documentation of completed integrations.
You will collaborate closely with User Engagement Specialists (UES), Project Managers (PM), Engineers, and users to determine the necessary analytical outputs and manipulate input data to achieve these outputs through the process of architecting an integration.
Additionally, you will be responsible for verifying integrated data with the project team and addressing any inconsistencies discovered during the data validation process. Throughout the project's lifespan, you will be in charge of maintaining integrations in partnership with the engineering team and will be the primary point of contact and responsible for technical troubleshooting.

Responsibilities:

Data integration:

    • End to end ownership and management of all assigned data integrationsLead external technical staff communication to scope integrations, with the goal of defining the data access method while considering aspects like integration longevity and fulfilling use cases.
    • Lead collaboration with UESs and PMs to gain a complete understanding of the use cases and identify the relevant data elements and indicators to integrate.
    • Prepare data for integration by carrying out data cleaning and data preparation, which involves developing suitable data pull scripts, integration instructions, or dataprep work flows.
    • Develop clear integration execution documentation and instructions to guide the Engineers.
    • Monitor integration progress and regularly update the project team, clients, and users on progress and timelines.
    • Create technical internal and external documentation for all integrations.

Project Technical Support:

    • Full ownership of investigating and resolving integration-related issues on the platform and providing regular updates to all stakeholders (both internal and external) on the progress toward solutions.
    • Collaborate with the Engineering team to address critical technical issues with the platform by efficiently communicating about technical problems and following up on progress.
    • Provide technical guidance and support to country teams and business units concerning technical implementation.
    • Contribute to project design, work planning, management (including timelines and budgets), and reporting.
    • Establish and maintain strong working relationships with project implementing partners, government stakeholders, and other clients.

New Product Development:

    • Collaborate with the Engineering and Product Teams to provide guidance on suitable considerations for product development activities associated with country deployments.
    • Participate and make valuable contributions to product development swimlanes related to TPM workflows.

Qualifications:

    • Bachelor's Degree in engineering, data science, or other relevant technical field.
    • 3+ years of experience in technical project management, information systems management or data analysis.
    • Knowledge of health information systems, experience working with health programs (particularly HIV and TB), and exposure to public health approaches related to the implementation of health information systems.
    • Significant experience working with data analysis/manipulation tools such as SQL (mandatory), R, Excel, Python, Google Dataprep or similar tools and processes for data analytics, data quality assessments, data visualisation, communications, and data use.
    • Experience working virtually with users and high-level stakeholders to understand their needs and coordinate project execution.
    • Excellent communication skills (reading and writing) in English and a strong track record of collaboration and communication with a wide range of people across all organisational levels, both internal and external.
    • Proven ability to synthesise complex information and present clear and concise conclusions and recommendations for decision making.
Please submit your resume and a cover letter describing why you are the best fit for this position. Candidates must have legal authorization to work in South Africa.

Incubeta is a growth partner for our clients, offering solutions across media, technology, creative and data that address their challenges and move the needle on their businesses. Our mantra is 'We don't sell products/services, we solve business problems'

Deepening relationships with existing clients is a key driver for Incubeta’s growth so it is vital that we are consistently looking for opportunities to deliver further value to clients (in the form of additional services of course) that will bolster their digital marketing activities, ultimately leading to improved business performance.

To support this growth strategy, Incubeta MENA is looking for a Mid Level Paid Media Manager who will work alongside the paid media team in this region to deliver solutions that will drive business value for our clients.

OVERVIEW:

A Paid Media Manager is responsible for managing a portfolio of clients & digital media campaigns across various digital platforms. They are responsible for campaign strategy, execution, optimisation, analysis and reporting. The Paid Media Manager will act as a technical expert for clients as well for Account Directors/managers and other team members. They must be able to communicate effectively and manage internal and external client expectations. Media Managers are required to apply their extensive media expertise to deliver the best possible performance whilst achieving the clients desired business and marketing goals. The Paid Media Manager will be client facing and work in close cooperation with the Client Services, Media Managers, Solution Consultant, Data and Analytics implementation teams, and other stakeholders.


WHAT IS THE PURPOSE OF THE ROLE?
The Media Manager role role will form part of the paid media team within the MENA Market and as an expert specializing in Paid Performance Media, you will be primarily responsible for providing digital campaign strategies, across Paid Media Channels in order to transform and increase the success of our existing and future customers, primarily leveraging Facebook Business Manager, Twitter Ads, Linkedin, Snapchat etc and how they integrate into the Google Marketing Stack (GMP).

You will assist our Key Regional Clients in driving their business and marketing goals by combining your knowledge to create best-in-class campaign strategies, setup and execution. You will collaborate closely with paired Subject-Matter Experts (SME's) and with cross-functional teams, such as client service, solution consultants, SEO, organic social, and creative.

At its core, a Paid Media Manager requires knowledge of:

  • Digital media strategy, content & communication advice
  • Audience strategy
  • Campaign Management and Optimisation,
  • Conversion Optimisation
  • Website tracking
  • Performance reporting & Analysis.
  • Client management

PLACE WITHIN ORGANISATION

  • Reports to the Head of Paid Media
  • Closely interacts with Paid Media Client Service Director, Solution Consultants, Client Services, Project Managers and Global Implementation & Delivery Teams.
  • Works closely with Platform Partners, ie. Google, Facebook / Smartly / Pinterest / Twitter / LinkedIn/TikTok etc., to stay ahead of tech, gain access to betas & conferences etc.

WORKING HOURS:

Please be advised that this role aligns with the Middle Eastern time zone, however individuals will be required to work the standard Monday - Friday. There may however be instances where individuals may be asked to support the team on a Sunday - Thursday rotation when colleagues are on leave or off ill however this will be on the odd occasion.

KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE - IMPERATIVE

  • Minimum 2 years of experience
  • Working 100% independently on basis of level profile
  • Experience in running, implementing and managing Google Ads campaigns ( Microsoft Ads, Apple Search and Search Ads 360 campaigns advantageous)
  • Certification on at least 2 platforms (Facebook/IG, Twitter, LinkedIn, Snapchat, TikTok)
  • GMP certification on CM360, DV360, SA360 would be advantageous
  • Experience with setup and testing of tracking requirements of online campaigns.
  • Strong strategic analysis and profound advisory skills
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to translate customer needs to deliver high levels of satisfaction
  • Experience in educating and reporting back to clients
  • Sound understanding of the digital advertising industry, knowledge of the underlying technology, major tech providers, agencies landscape and online media buying and selling processes, including the programmatic buying landscape
  • Proven knowledge of Incubeta products/services or similar products/services that Incubeta services
  • Strong understanding of all digital marketing channels, ad technologies, cross-media solutions and passionate about (ad) technology and how technology can shape the online advertising industry and ecosystem for the benefit of our clients
  • Highly motivated, enthusiastic, goal-orientated and a team player
  • Native or bilingual proficiency in the English language. Understanding of the Arabic language is advantageous
  • A people person - comfortable with collaboration and can build internal relationships with cross-functional teams
  • Excellent organisational and problem-solving/decision-making skills
  • Experience in providing forecast and creating presentations
  • Strong presentation skills

KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE - ADVANTAGE

  • Experience building & optimising feeds for data-driven projects / and or DPL
  • Experience working with Facebook Marketing Partners, for example: Smartly or Nannigans to increase investment yield
  • Knowledge of Digital transformation
  • 3rd Party tracking solutions
  • Data Studio and dash-building experience
  • Strong mobile and app experience, including Firebase and AppsFlyer

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Overall account creation and setup
  • Employ Strategic Campaign setup with sufficient research and following directions given by the head of paid media and/or country consultant
  • Working closely with internal & external Consultants, Account Managers and Clients to develop and implement media campaign strategies
  • Ongoing optimisation of campaigns and providing strategic feedback.
  • Working closely with solution consultants to ensure seamless integration with full GP stack for clients where necessary.
  • Training and development
  • Being able to troubleshoot issues within CM360, SA360, DV360 and presenting solutions
  • Build and traffic campaigns in Google Ads / Paid Social (FB/IG, Twitter, Snapchat, TikTok, LinkedIn) / SA360 platforms
  • Ability to execute in-app campaigns (Display & Social)
  • Regular review of performance of campaigns across revenue, performance and pacing
  • Ensure campaign delivery against revenue goals and Key Performance Indicators as established with the client and consultants
  • Daily reporting and monitoring of campaigns to ensure performance goals and revenue objectives are met
  • Being able to interpret data outside of search / programmatic & delivering a holistic overview to the client
  • Ability to check different channel behaviour & impact of various channels on digital campaign performance
  • Ensure all correct revenues and media costs are reported on a monthly basis.
  • Being able to motivate oneself & to continue self development

Travel Benefits

  • Occasional travel to Dubai may be required based on clients’ needs.

KEY COMPETENCIES AND WORK ETHIC

  • Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Display professional and example behaviour at all times
  • Specialised knowledge - have worked in a serious, thoughtful and sustained way to master the specialized knowledge needed to succeed in their fields; and that they keep this knowledge up-to-date so that they can continue to deliver the best work possible
  • Competency - Professionals get the job done. They're reliable, and they keep their promises. If circumstances arise that prevent them from delivering on their promises, they manage expectations up front, and they do their best to make the situation right. Professionals don't make excuses but focus on finding solutions.
  • Solutions-oriented with a growth mindset
  • Display honesty and integrity at all times
  • Accountable for their actions even when making mistakes
  • Show respect for the people around them, regardless of their role or situation
  • Exhibit a high degree of emotional intelligence (EI) by considering the emotions and needs of others, e.g. they don't let a bad day impact their interaction with colleagues or clients
  • Project a positive attitude at all times towards clients’ team members and motivate team members when they are less positive
  • Display strong interpersonal skills. Ability to build strong relationships with clients and colleagues; display a strong team spirit
  • Maintain the highest standards of delivery, productivity and effectiveness at all times
  • Organised and detail-oriented
  • A good head for numbers and working with large sets of data
  • Display focus and dedication at all times
  • Advanced computer knowledge (Excel)
  • Approachable and open to constructive criticism
  • Exceptional time management skills and ability to prioritise a high volume of projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, unpredictable environment
  • Ability to remain calm and thrive under pressure
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Display a high level of independence. This includes but is not limited to taking decisions independently while staying within the company guidelines; having a proactive attitude; staying self-motivated; being self-reliant; continuous self-development without expecting to be taken by the hand.
  • Display a hunger for knowledge and a willingness to learn in any situation
  • Respect, appreciation and contribution towards decision making

If you feel you fit the above criteria, please send your CV and cover letter.

display_title: Crime and Security Threat/Risk Identification, Profiling, Analyst
job_description:
Crime and Security Threat/Risk Identification, Profiling, Analyst

Helderkruin, Roodepoort

Reporting to: General Manager

The above position is vacant at Helderkruin, Roodepoort reporting to the General Manager Specialised Services.

Crime and Security Threat/Risk Identification, Profiling, Analysis

To identify, collect, analyse and report on security crime and threat information for early warning and to aide decision making and should disseminate information through quality intelligence reports on agreed intervals and when requested. The Analyst must also keep abreast with security information / intelligence related issues in the media / press including social media and other platforms.

Key Performance Areas:

Security Threat Information Collection

The Analyst will be responsible for collection of Security Threat Information from open sources / existing supplier sources on the threats

  • Working on an online database
  • Conduct constant and continuous Security crime and threat Information gathering - be pro-active in approach and in issuing timely alerts;
  • Daily search open sources including Social Media Networks monitoring for crime and security threats and providing incident Situational information/updates where feasible
  • Conduct Environmental scans daily and issue reports / alerts
  • Collect information and profiling key individuals.
  • Research, identify and profile industries and markets in South Africa to identify trends, hotspots and activities of criminal elements and crime syndicates
  • Identify Crime Hotspots/Risk Areas where crime syndicates are operating and further provide recommendations for focused interventions in hotspot areas.
  • Identify the Modus Operandi and specific targets, sites, areas (Geographical info)
  • Respond to Adhoc requests and provide reports on entities / persons of interest and Conduct Individual Threat Assessments (Use open sources)

Minimum Requirements:

  • Matric certificate, At least 2 years’ experience in Analytical environment.
  • Administration, interpersonal communication and client liaison skills are required.
  • Strong planning, leadership, organizational skills as well as good interpersonal and communication skills are essential.
  • Clear background check and polygraph test.
  • A minimum of 2 years' experience working in law enforcement or data analysis.
  • Strong working knowledge of data gathering, verification, and analysis.
  • Excellent grasp of Countering Crime, GIS & Data Analytics programs.
  • Pattern recognition and strategic thinking skills.
  • Strong team-working and collaboration skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience in Report Writing and grammar excellence
  • Computer Literate in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Other
  • Computer literacy on Microsoft Programs essential.
  • Analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Customer focused
  • Team player
  • Applicants with no or little experience will also be considered for positions, based on skills levels for entry level acceptance.


Interested candidates whose credentials best match the requirements can send their CV’s before close of business on 07 October 2022

Email address: Thulim@fidelitysecurity.co.za


We reserve the right not to make an appointment to any advertised position. Whilst preference is given to existing employees at all times and the choice made is purely on merit, Historically Disadvantaged Candidates and Black Female Candidates are encouraged and supported in the FSG team. Whilst black female candidates will be given priority as per our transformation policy subject to the above criteria.

Fidelity Services Group (Pty) Ltd supports global fair practice and business ethics on continuous development of our human capital as the key resource to our success in the markets in which we participate.

Should you not be contacted regarding this position within 10 working days from the closing date, please regard your application as unsuccessful

CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.

What does that mean for you? You’ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You’ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You’ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our
Hybrid Work Model
.
Job Description
The position is responsible for supporting the Senior Director Finance - IMETA (including but not limited to Business Optimization, Long Term Planning, Annual Budgeting, Forecasting, and Standard Reporting, Commercial Profitability Analysis, Transformation and Risk Management) as well as working alongside the Finance Business Partners and the wider business to support on strategic analysis and insight on key initiatives to drive growth, increase profitability, reduce cost to serve, as well as broader financial support. The position will drive performance and strategic decision-making by focusing on implementing standard processes, managing service levels and delivering operational efficiency.
Key Accountabilities:
  • Lead the IMETA Finance team to provide Finance BPs and the wider business with analytics and insights to support strategic and operational decision making, and in doing so, influences improved business performance and capital allocation decisions.
  • Drives the implementation and application of a regional consistent commercial policy, through the use of standard practices and tools.
  • Budgeting and Forecasting: Lead the development and management of the annual budget and quarterly forecasting processes. This involves working with the regions to develop budgets and forecasts, reviewing and analyzing budget variances, and recommending changes to achieve financial targets.
  • Financial Reporting: Lead the development and review of financial reports, presentations, and other materials for executive management. This includes analyzing financial data, interpreting financial results, and providing recommendations based on the analysis.
  • The be the point of contact for the Global and IMETA transformation office
  • Delivery of the bankable plan. Short term achievements for FY23 and ensuring framework and structure for achievement of the outer years.
  • Lead the risk management process for IMETA Developing and implementing a comprehensive risk management strategy for the company. This includes identifying and assessing risks and supporting in the development of risk mitigation plans.
Preferred Education
Bachelors - Accounting, Technical/Professional Qualification - Accounting
Preferred Level of Work Experience
7 - 10 years

AVI LIMITED is home to many of South Africa’s leading and best-loved brands! Listed on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange and centred on the FMCG market, AVI’s extensive brand portfolio includes more than 50 brands. Our brands span a range of categories including hot beverages, sweet and savoury biscuits and snacks, frozen convenience foods, out-of-home ranges, personal care products, cosmetics, footwear, accessories, and fashion apparel. We have a well-developed Shared Services structure spanning: International, IT, Finance, Logistics, Marketing, Procurement and Field Marketing, which allows us to take advantage of our scale. Our single-minded purpose is our brands' growth and development.

An exciting opportunity exists for a SAP FIELD SYSTEMS SUPPORT ANALYST at our IT Shared Services Division in Bryanston, Johannesburg. The purpose of the role is to ensure stability and service delivery of the SAP Production Systems and maintaining good governance. The successful candidate will work closely with the business in ensuring the stability of the SAP productive environment and analysing and resolving issues that may arise. First and second-line support of the following SAP workstreams will be pivotal for success in this role: Customer to Cash and Vendor (Procure) to Pay, including but not limited to Production, Quality Management, Plant Maintenance and Warehouse Management. The SAP Systems Support Analyst will also be responsible for the up-skilling of users and transferring knowledge to obtain end-user buy-in and ensure that end-user skills are aligned with the organisations’ objectives.

Line Manager: Retail Systems Manager

Number of Direct Reports: None

Job Specification:

Key Performance Areas:

  • Ensure Stability and Service Delivery of Sap Production Systems
  • Support implemented functionality in accordance with Service Level Agreements
  • Quality Assurance
  • Problem management (analysis and addressing the root cause of recurring incidents)
  • User (including superusers) training needs assessments
  • Documentation of implemented functionality
  • Enforce change management governance
  • Housekeeping of SAP systems
  • Contributes toward business transformation initiatives and continuous improvement activity
  • Provides input on the detailed specification of process and system changes
  • Act as the first line of support to end-users for system issues
  • Problem solve/troubleshoot end-user issues
  • Liaises directly with Applications Support team to address break-fix and/or business as usual changes required in support of issue resolution or business need
  • Participate in the testing and validation of process and system changes where required
  • Training
  • Identifies individuals who should be trained/up-skilled and provides ongoing, on-site support to the end-users
  • Provide input and recommends reporting requirements for business KPI’s and helps drive potential business analytics solutions covering business need
  • Assist and ensure business-relevant documentation (training and scenario documentation down to process steps) are aligned with actual business and system processes, and drives amendments to align the same
  • Identifies training needs for end-users and review training material for both initial training and follow up assessment of user skills
  • Apply/recommends changes to training documentation where unclear or insufficient information creates bottlenecks or is not aligned
  • Engages with end-users and determines skills requirements
  • Regular on-site follow-up visits to test user knowledge and ensure users are applying the correct system processes
  • Projects
  • Project Implementation assistance & follow up
  • Participates actively in Change Management plan e.g. conducts surveys, briefing/debriefing, systems liaison
  • Conducts regular on-site process audits in terms of effective system utilization

Minimum Requirements:

Experience:

  • Minimum of 5 years’ SAP support/consulting experience
  • Minimum of 5 years’ customer support experience in the IT industry

Qualifications:

  • Matric/Grade 12
  • Business/IT Degree or Diploma
  • SAP Certification advantageous

Additional Requirements:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office
  • Microsoft Project an advantage
  • Additional SAP skills in cross-functional areas and enabling technologies advantageous
  • Valid Driver’s Licence
  • Own transportation to travel between our sites
  • Able to be on standby every three weeks’

Competencies:

  • Thinking Rationally
  • Thinking Analytically
  • Documenting Facts
  • Interpreting Data
  • Continuous Improving
  • Building Relationships
  • Articulating Information
  • Taking Initiative

An established Creative Agency, based in the East of Johannesburg, has a vacancy for a senior Web & SEO Specialist

The Web & SEO specialist is responsible for the implementation of digital strategy for on-boarded brands.

Working in collaboration with the lead strategists & SEO specialist, you will be responsible for a group of brands within the department. You will immerse yourself in the brands under your remit, by gaining a thorough understanding of their industry category, as well as their business objectives. In this role, you will use your strong communication and client leadership skills to build relationships with clients key personnel. You will work strategically to identify the Client’s needs and challenges, providing sustainable solutions and results driven work. You will collaborate with internal and external cross-functional teams, to deliver strategic and client service excellence.

Qualifications/ Experience

  • 3-5 years experience within a marketing function (preferably agency)
  • Qualification in Marketing or certification in Digital Marketing (Google Search, etc.)
  • An understanding of project management disciplines
  • Excellent customer service and relationship-building skills (desirable)
  • Good understanding of search and digital marketing is crucial
  • Analytics experience is vital (Google Analytics, Google Search Console, as well as any other tools utilised such as SEMRush, AhRefs, etc.)

Competencies

  • Digital (Search) Native – focused on customer centricity
  • Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills – confident to present to clients at all levels
  • An understanding of SEO and how it fits into the overall marketing mix
  • Strategically-driven and analytical in approach
  • Able to extrapolate insights through data analysis

Responsibilities

  • Deliver on day-to-day strategic tasks such as keyword research, and monitoring campaigns and projects
  • Use good writing and storytelling skills, to structure insights and present recommendations aligned to objectives
  • Think strategically and act tactically, using the data provided to develop clear and consistent search strategies
  • Identify opportunities to up-sell and cross-sell
  • Seek out proactive opportunities to increase client satisfaction and loyalty
  • Monitor and maintain high levels of Client service
  • Work closely with the digital project manager, in terms of deliverables per project
  • Work seamlessly with cross-functional teams within the business and its clients, building strong relationships

Responsible for developing and implementing social media strategies in order to increase the brands' online presence and improve the marketing and sales efforts. Run the social marketing campaigns through social media platforms and work closely with marketing and sales departments, the brand team as well as with our digital in-house team. Have a finger on the pulse of the latest social media trends and able to execute campaigns accordingly. Drive to change the status quo and build purposeful brands.


Responsibilities

Strategy and Roadmap

Create marketing and social media campaigns and strategies, including budget planning, content ideation and implementation schedules. Create integrated and cost-effective social media strategies.


Social Marketing Plan Execution

Manage large, top-of-funnel digital marketing campaigns and several aspects of the execution plan, such as creating concepts and contents, setting audiences and value propositions, and integrating digital channels. Set and implement social media and communication campaigns to align with marketing strategies. Set out social media activities and or creative to meet campaign objectives. Stay abreast of micro moments and position the brand to have a presence during those micro moments.


Marketing Campaign Development

Coordinate activities of affiliates agencies and act as their primary point of contact while working within an established SLA to deliver successful advertising/promotion/other marketing campaigns.


Stakeholder Engagement

Ensure brand consistency in marketing and social media messages by working with various company department members, including advertising, product development and brand management. Communicate TIH's CSI efforts to business.


Social Marketing Capabilities

Explore new opportunities and trends across the social marketing space and support implementation of specific capability-building initiatives outlined in the social marketing capability road map. Grow and expand company social media presence into new social media platforms and increase presence on existing platforms including Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter and Instagram.


Website Maps and Templates Development

QA our website properties to make sure they are aligned to our social media efforts and communications Provide & QA engaging text, image and video content for social media accounts.


Insights and Reporting

Collect customer data and analyses interactions and visits, use this information to create comprehensive reports and improve future marketing strategies and campaigns. Analyse and report on social media campaigns.


Continuous Improvement

Review existing operations in own area of work and implement improvements in social media strategy. Map out how digital assets will be optimized for the social platforms as well as recommend new assets to internal team for new social platform.


Leadership and Direction

Translate the business goals and objectives to ensure the social strategy is aligned. Develop and grow knowledge and talent within the team in order to stay on top of the latest social media trends.


Budgeting

Manage the content and social media budgets and report on ROI appropriately.


Compliance

Responsible for quality control of the social media content. Knowledgeable on GDPR and POPI rules and regulations and ensuring compliance.


Organisational Capability Building

Provide coaching and guidance to the wider digital marketing stakeholders to develop their social media knowledge.


General Education

Grade 12/ SAQA Accredited Equivalent (Essential);

Certifications in FaceBook BluePrint; Twitter Flight School; LinkedIn; Instagram (Essential);

Google Ads and Analytics (Advantageous); Relevant degree and/or Diploma (Advantageous)


General Experience

4 to 5 years social media specialisation/management (Essential);

Knowledge of standard and current social media practices (Essential);

Experience within a financial services industry and Ecommerce (Advantageous)


Managerial Experience

2 or more years proven experience as a social media manager to deliver predetermined objectives as specified by more senior managers (Essential)

Who are we: A leading global Affiliate / Digital Performance Marketing agency opening offices in CT

Who are we looking for: A Managing Director

What will you do:

  • Lead a team of media buyers, design, content and web developers, and oversee the management of all advertiser accounts to continually grow revenue.
  • Set sales goals and work with your team in obtaining monthly and quarterly margin goals, as well as tracking and recording individual and team progress, wins and challenges.
  • Identify and analyse strategic advertiser accounts and areas of growth opportunity with the team and owners.
  • Oversee the building, testing and maintenance of sales funnels for advertising partners.
  • Be actively involved in top advertiser accounts, to provide stellar service and value.
  • Manage the pipeline and drive the process to recruit and onboard new publishers.
  • Work effectively with the advertiser sales team to develop custom traffic plans for strategic advertiser accounts.
  • Ensure sales funnels adhere to regulatory and promotional guidelines.
  • Attend industry trade shows as necessary in order to manage the team in acquiring new publishers, advertisers and maintaining existing relationships.
  • Stay abreast of industry trends in the performance marketing space

What will you need:

  • High level of energy, dedication, and motivation to scale a hyper growth company
  • Demonstrated sales leadership experience including coaching, mentoring, hiring, training, and performance management
  • Resourceful and innovative, with an entrepreneurial spirit and partnership-oriented mindset
  • Possess a strong and data-driven background in marketing analytics and digital performance marketing
  • Advanced spreadsheet skills are a plus.
  • Requires an acute understanding of core online advertising revenue models (CPM, CPC, CPA), as well as traffic channels including email, display, social, PPV, search, mobile, etc.
  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent.
  • Minimum 5 year of digital media experience in a management role, with knowledge of Affiliate Marketing a must.

Benefits and Perks:

  • Retirement annuity
  • Profit share
  • Stock options
  • Hybrid work policy
  • International travel opportunities
