Company Description
-Do you have Trackless Mobile Machinery environment working experience? Here is an exciting opportunity to join Amandelbult Complex as an HRD Coordinator Mining New Mining Technology.

Anglo-American is striving towards being the number one company in digitalization, new mining technology and building modern ways in delivering learning.

You’re dedicated, talented and flexible. That’s why you’ll fit in

Guided by our purpose and our values, we enable both high performance and purposeful action as we aim to “re-imagine mining to improve people’s lives", delivering the metals and minerals that make modern life possible – from mobile phones to medicines.

Platinum

Our Platinum business mines, processes, and refines the entire range of platinum group metals (PGMs): platinum, palladium, rhodium, ruthenium, iridium, and osmium. We are the world’s leading primary producer of PGMs, which have a range of specialised applications that improve lives across the world – from vehicle fuel cells to jewellery; dentistry to glassmaking; pacemakers to petroleum refining.


Job Description
-You will be responsible to play a role of coordinating our mechanized training center, implement virtual learning systems and be responsible for liaising with suppliers/ OEM's (Original Manufactures).

Activities you need to perform include:

  • Consistently apply Safety & Health principles in all team interactions and take personal responsibility for safety of self and others to ensure zero harm and elimination of fatalities.
  • Network and keep abreast of new global developments awareness within the learning environment especially in Trackless Mobile Machinery
  • Continuously benchmark on new mining technology
  • Plan and implement the annual training plan within the mechanised mining training delivery center and ensure appropriate training budget control.
  • Establish, maintain and manage an underground working and / or surface environment and ensure that it is conducive for skills development in compliance with the Mine Health and Safety Act
  • Manage compliance with environmental and social requirements as relevant to discipline, including commitments to stakeholders.
  • Support the development of, and ultimately implement, a purpose-led, high-performing culture within the teams that is aligned with the company values, is inclusive and promotes diversity.

This role is at a band 6 level reporting to the HRD Manager


  • Qualifications
    -OD ETDP Level 5 Higher certificate
  • Blasting Certificate/NQF 3 Rock Breaker Qualification.
  • Mine Overseer Certificate.
  • Assessor and Moderator Certificate.

Experience:

  • At least five years Mechanized Mining experience including two years within the Narrow Reef underground environment. (Mine Captain)

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Proficient in Computer literacy
  • Proficient in data analysis and management for decision-making
  • Advanced levels of proficiency in developing and implementing integrated solutions to maximize value and ensure productivity, a safe and sustainable working environment and delivery against plans.
  • Mineral and Petroleum Resources Development Act (MPRDA)

Additional Information
-What we offer

When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package, but more than this, you will find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We are a large, successful multinational company – and we are still growing all the time.

Who we are?

Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine. We work together with our key partners and stakeholders to unlock the sustainable value that those resources represent for our shareholders, the communities, and countries in which we operate and for society at large. Anglo American is re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives.

How we are committed to your safety.

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, but we are also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

Background checks

By applying for this job, you provide consent that your personal details, including your fingerprints, can be used to conduct background screening where appropriate. For more information, please visit: https://www.angloamerican.com/site-services/applicant-privacy-notice/applicant-privacy-notice-en

How to apply.

To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

Closing Date: 14 July 2023

Talent Assessment Consultant: 6 Months Contract: Sandton

Responsible for providing expert assessment advice, guidance, and solutions to support effective talent selection and development practices.

The Talent Assessment Consultant collaborates closely with key stakeholders to understand their talent needs, identify assessment requirements, and deliver customized solutions aligned with organizational objectives. This position requires a strong understanding of assessment methodologies, talent management practices, and a proactive mindset to drive value-added contributions to the business.

Key Performance Areas:

Operational Assessment Activities:

  • Conduct occupational assessment sessions, write integrated competency-based reports and provide feedback on assessment results to various levels of stakeholders in accordance with the Client assessment policy, HPCSA guidelines and legislative requirements.
  • Oversee the end-to-end assessment process, ensuring the integration of creative approaches, continuous improvement initiatives, and best practices to enhance the candidate and employee experience while delivering value to the organization.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to design and implement effective and efficient assessment methodologies, tools, and processes that incorporate innovative and agile techniques, embracing new technologies and emerging trends.
  • Provide expert guidance on the use of assessment techniques, including the adoption of cutting[1]edge tools, integrated solutions, technologies, and data analytics to improve talent selection outcomes and respond to changing business needs.
  • Lead the mentoring and coaching of Psychometric interns to ensure their upskilling within the internship are sufficient for registration as Psychometrists with the HPCSA.
  • Stay abreast of emerging trends, technologies, and innovative assessment methodologies to ensure the organization remains adaptable and responsive to changing talent needs.

Project Management:

  • Manage assessment projects through effective planning, stakeholder management, and value attainment.
  • Conduct proper needs analysis, compile proposals and project plans and take full accountability for project deliverables through logistics and people management.
  • Ensure project objectives are delivered and communicated within timelines, budget and quality standards and value attainment of projects are calculated and communicated.

Client Engagement and Consultation:

  • Build credibility of assessment unit and establish collaborative relationships.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with business leaders, HR partners, and other stakeholders to understand talent requirements and provide consultation on innovative and integrated assessment solutions.
  • Monitor and guide business in the ethical use of assessments and ensure that all assessment practices are conducted in line with the Assessment Policy and Procedure.
  • Collaborate with and manage external assessment vendors to evaluate, select, and deliver robust assessment tools and technologies, fostering partnerships that support ongoing innovation, agility, and transformation in assessment practices.
  • Translate data insights into meaningful recommendations for talent decisions, showcasing the return on investment and enhancing assessment practices.

Essential Qualifications - NQF Level:

  • Honor’s Degree in Psychology / Industrial Psychology
  • Preferred Qualification: master’s degree in psychology / Industrial Psychology

Essential Certifications:

  • Must be Registered with HPCSA as a Psychometrist Independent Practice or Psychologist Experience
  • Extensive experience in talent assessment, talent management, or a related field, with a focus on assessment strategy, design, and implementation.
  • Strong knowledge of assessment methodologies, best practices, and emerging trends in talent assessment and management.
  • Proven experience in stakeholder management and consultation.

Minimum Experience Level:

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as Psychometrist in assessing and interpreting Psychometric Assessments for career guidance, recruitment, development and / or similar.
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience consulting in the capacity of assessment specialist.
  • Exposure to Cognadev, Saville, Hogan, Giotto SA and JVR would be an advantage.

Behavioral Competencies:

Building Customer Loyalty l Communication l Decision Making l Work Standards l Building partnerships l Planning and Organizing l Technical/Professional Knowledge and Skills

Communication will only be with shortlisted candidates please email me for a skills matrix: jino.swart@isilumko.co.za

display_title: Talent and Organization Lead - Consulting Principal Director (Human Potential)
job_description:
Introduction:

Join Accenture and help transform leading organisations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance.

Our Talent and Organisation/Human Potential Team helps Human Resources and C- Suite leaders develop strategies and solutions to ensure they future proof their workforce through the constantly evolving changes of work.

Accenture Strategy and Consulting professionals’ partner with clients at a senior level, helping them transform their business and materially improve their performance. They illustrate a deep understanding of the industry landscape both locally and abroad and in the context of global, economic, technology and social trends.

You will lead multiple projects in a diverse and challenging range of industries. You will need to have the ability to operate in rapidly evolving and changing environments and be comfortable with driving tangible results for our clients.

Role Essence:

  • Is an experienced Human Capital Strategist and thought leader, who will lead the strategy and delivery of the Talent and Organisation/Human Potential agenda in both selling and growing the Accenture brand;

  • Defines and executes on the people agenda - ensuring we have the right talent strategy to fuel specialized skills and capabilities, making progress on inclusion and diversity, and recruiting, developing, and retaining and engaging our people;

  • Is personally impactful with our local and global teams, clients, and ecosystem partners

Key responsibilities:

  • Act as the external face of Accenture Talent and Organisation/Human Potential practice participating with client CHROs and business leaders to build Accenture’s brand around strategic People Transformation themes and position Accenture as a leader in the Africa market.

  • Develop thought leadership and engage industry and professional groups profiling Accenture’s insights and capabilities

  • Acts as the local Talent and Organisation/Human Potential interlock and influence input and insight into the Talent and Organisation/Human global practice. Provide insights on local market needs and localising content for market relevance.

  • Develop strong relationships with key client buyers at the Business unit /Division /Function /Country Head level; client decision making typically localized/centralized

  • Makes a strong contribution as the Talent and Organisation/Human Potential Talent business representative on the Africa leadership team.

  • Identify growth opportunities; prioritize and set direction for the key Human Capital specific initiatives/offerings in Africa to support growth and profitable delivery. In addition, collaborate with Africa Sales Strategy Lead, Offering leads, and others to provide feedback and input on market competitiveness of Accenture’s offerings in Africa

  • Ensure the practice has the leadership and talent in place to support the initiatives/offerings and growth with a focus on sales effectiveness/excellence through capability building

  • Leads the Talent and Organisation/Human Potential talent transformation agenda and drive the differentiated employee experience for the practice

  • Lead multiple projects in a diverse and challenging range of industries with a demonstrated ability to operate in rapidly evolving and changing environments and be comfortable with driving tangible results for our clients

  • Use functional experience and digital technology leadership, in helping CHROs broaden their impact and strategic influence across their enterprise, through creating and implementing digital/technology enabled employee centric solutions and tools that enable higher efficiency, effectiveness and productivity of the workforce

  • Leverage enterprise workforce analytics to equip clients with meaningful data, insights and analytics to power digital solutions that transform business through proactively addressing workforce needs


Leadership experience and skills:

  • Strategy and Innovation

  • Project Management

  • Strategic C-Suite Partnering

  • Operating Model design

  • HR Shared services

  • Human Capital Analytics

  • Employee experience

  • HR Digital Transformation and ERP Platform implementation

  • Human Capital Strategy capabilities:

    • Change Management

    • Organisational Development

    • Operating Model Design

    • Organisation Design

    • Learning and Development

    • Talent Management

    • Culture

    • Employee Value Proposition

Business Unit: Discovery Connect
Function: Marketing Management
Date: 1 Jul 2023
Discovery- Developer (BI)
About Discovery
Discovery’s core purpose is to make people healthier and to enhance and protect their lives. We seek out and invest in exceptional individuals who understand and support our core purpose, and whose own values align with those of Discovery. Our fast-paced and dynamic environment enables smart, self-driven people to be their best. As global thought leaders, Discovery is passionate about innovating in order to not only achieve financial success, but to ignite positive and meaningful change within our society.

Key Purpose
Construction of complex BI Solutions based on specifications produced by the BI Architects and Systems Analysts. (BI Solutions imply ETL / Analytics / Presentation).
Driving Engagement and building relationships with key stakeholders which include Systems Analysts, BI Architects and QA Manager

Key Outputs:

  • Develop and maintain SSIS packages
  • Create required database structures
  • Develop and maintain T-SQL code
  • Analyse SQL execution plan to optimise performance
  • Version control of developed solutions within a code repository
  • Workshop solutions with Systems Analysts and Architect to compile relevant technical specifications
  • Contribute to the development of architectural guidelines and standards
  • Prototyping, Research and Development of new techniques and solutions
  • Peer review of code and solutions developed
  • Team engagement champion
  • Improving robustness and stability of ETL batches
  • Scheduling business processes via ETL tools
  • Experience in developing and maintaining an ETL Framework e.g. ETL controller
  • Create and maintain Metadata and Code repositories
  • Dynamic Sql
  • Develop and maintain SSAS models

Competencies

Knowledge:

  • Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Advanced level
  • Data Security and Protection Policies Intermediate/Advanced
  • Data Warehouse principles and practises Intermediate/Advanced
  • Kimball Methodology Intermediate/Advanced
  • Financial Services industry knowledge Advantageous

Technical Skills:

  • T-SQL, SQL Advanced
  • SQL Server BI Stack (SSIS, SSMS) Advanced
  • MS Excel Advanced
  • MDX Advantageous
  • DAX Advantageous
  • Dimensional Modelling Basic
  • Data Mining Basic

Competencies:

  • Creating and Innovating
  • Applying Expertise and Technology
  • Analysing
  • Persuading and Influencing
  • Deciding and initiating action
  • Adapting and Responding to Change
  • Learning and Researching
  • Presenting and Communicating Information
Qualification and Skills
  • National Diploma in Information Technology or a Bachelor’s degree
  • Certification on Microsoft or other ETL Tools
  • Kimball related courses (dimensional modelling)

Minimum Required Experience
  • Minimum of 4 years’ experience in BI Development in SQL Server Integration Services & Management Studio.
EMPLOYMENT EQUITY

The Company’s approved Employment Equity Plan and Targets will be considered as part of the recruitment process. As an Equal Opportunities employer, we actively encourage and welcome people with various disabilities to apply.

Marketing Co-ordinator, (1x Perm: 1x Temp) Woodmead Rneg + Ben

2 Positions :

  • TEMP - salary is max R18 000. The period is from asap to mid-December
  • PERMANENT - The salary is max R21 000
  • Grade 12 /Matric
  • Experience in marketing coordination or similar role.
  • Qualification in marketing/communications or related will be an advantage
  • Knowledge of consumer and industry trade marketing
  • Knowledge of traditional and digital marketing, content marketing, and social media marketing.
  • Experience using data analytics software for research.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • MS Office Suite
  • To be thorough and pay attention to detail
  • The ability to work well with others.
  • The ability to work on your own
  • To be flexible and open to change
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Good interpersonal and decision-making skills.
  • The ability to handle the stress

EXHIBITOR DIRECTORY - WEBSITE

  • Manage the exhibitor and sponsor listings on the website.
  • Connecting with all exhibitors and coordinating and collating all the info from exhibitors
  • Capturing all the info submitted onto the backend of the s websites

TRADE MARKETING

  • Manage the trade database by growing and cleaning on a regular basis (Manager to give instruction and targets per week)
  • Use the strategy guidelines to research new categories and industries and capture all relevant info on the database
  • Full online trade registration process – vetting, processing all online trade applications, dealing with all enquiries, preparing all lists for registration desks on site
  • Assist with trade research at the shows
  • Assist with the management of the actual entrances with the help from ops and marketing
  • Manage all relationships and exchanges with regards to trade association partners and media partners deliverables
  • Assist with the management of the online matchmaking system for trade delegates and exhibitors

SIDE EVENTS | 365 EVENTS | ACTIVATIONS

  • Work directly with Manager to manage all RSVP’s and or communication for any side event functions, exhibitor awards functions & trade functions at each show.
  • Responsible for sourcing samples for goodie bags, arranging timeous delivery and overseeing bag packing process (should goodie bags be used)
  • Responsible for communicating with exhibitors to participate in any campaigns and competitions pre or onsite
  • Ensure all logos, descriptions, images, and content received from Exhibitors for competitions or campaigns is correct and all collateral needed to be printed prior to being on site is done timeously
  • Source and manage all retail partners to assist in marketing the show through flyer handouts or activations

PRINT & PROMOTIONAL ELEMENTS

  • Liaising and negotiating with suppliers on quotes for printing collateral including but not limited to:
    • Flyers (exhibitor and activation)
    • Tickets & Badges
    • Visitor Guides

SOCIAL MEDIA AND CONTENT SUPPORT

  • Assist with rollout of content and marketing schedule on various social media platforms; Instagram | Facebook | LinkedIn | Tik Tok
  • Assist with community management on social platforms
  • Assist with content planning for various social or digital mailers and communication

ONSITE ROLES:

  • You will be requested to work additional hours from time to time to fulfil deadlines for the exhibitions
  • You will also be expected to be at the actual exhibitions for the full duration to ensure progress
  • Do monthly progress reports as requested
  • Any other duties and responsibilities as deemed necessary to fulfil the role of Marketing Coordinator

Senior Associate: Enterprise Risk (Internal Audit)


Why should I work for EY in Risk?

EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team up to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

Management and Boards of Directors rely heavily on Internal Audit to provide important proactive assessments and assurance around the effectiveness of controls and company processes, while also providing objective advisory support. You will be engaged in delivering some of the most significant and class-leading internal audit and risk engagements globally. As part of our market-leading global network of risk professionals, you will gain the valuable experience you need to become a successful risk advisor. At EY, we recognize that it is the perspectives, skills and enthusiasm you bring to our clients that makes the difference.


Your client responsibilities

  • Work effectively as a team member, sharing responsibility, providing support, maintaining communication and updating senior team members on progress.
  • Assign and manage tasks with other team members considering engagement needs and identified business outcomes, and organize own work such that important items get done first.
  • Build strong internal relationships within EY and with other services across the organization.
  • Research client industry, company structure, key customers and suppliers and possible insight into operations and the various processes
  • Develop and maintain productive working relationships with client personnel.
  • Collaborate with the client to identify critical project outcomes, work products, barriers to success, and changes in expectations or scope.
  • Manage own time in line with budgets
  • Prepare or review business process descriptions through interviews with the client’s middle and senior management and documenting understanding of business process and confirm the business process descriptions by performing a walkthrough of the process.
  • Identifying possible business risks and control weaknesses from the business processes under review.
  • Drafting detailed audit programmes to test controls in place.
  • Identify basic data analytic procedures
  • Assessment of design and implementation of key controls as well as the operating effectiveness, accuracy and validity thereof.
  • Compilation of working papers substantiating scope and results of testing.
  • Provide a coaching / mentoring role.
  • Review sections prepared by junior staff
  • Draft individual sections of documents and presentations to explain issues and solution options and implications.
  • Display a logical thought process in understanding client challenges and exploring possible solutions.
  • Identify and escalate potential risks and issues to project manager along with suggested preventive or mitigating actions.
  • Draft audit findings for review by EY Senior Management.
  • Assist with presenting findings to client


Your people responsibilities

  • Act as a visible role model for our people.
  • Coach and mentor junior team members.
  • Give honest supportive feedback to colleagues.
  • Take personal responsibility for own performance and career development.
  • Play an active role in EY and Service line team activities.
  • Understand and follow workplace policies and procedures.


Technical skills requirements

  • Must have Honours in Internal Audit, Accounting, Business, Finance or other related field
  • Must have CIA
  • Minimum of 4 years of related work experience
  • Related audit or applicable business experience
  • Proficient in Microsoft office (including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint).


Additional skills requirements

  • Strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Demonstrated integrity, values, principles, and work ethic.
  • Enquiring Mind
  • Analytical
  • Self-starter
  • Team Player
  • Share EY’s values and vision
  • Disciplined
  • Able to handle pressure
  • Team building ability
  • Good communication skills

A large retail group is looking for a Finance: Systems Business Analyst. The successful incumbent will act as the interface between the systems teams, business, and other 3rd parties, through a set of tasks and techniques. Recommend new and or improved business process information systems / software applications that will enable the functional department and business to achieve its goals.

Responsibilities:

  • Support of existing business processes, systems, and technology in Finance team
  • Enhance and/or design new systems and/or processes
  • Manage the specifications, testing and implementation of system enhancements
  • Consult with business to identify business problems and opportunities
  • Write Functional (technical) specifications
  • Project Management
  • Ensure strategic and project objectives are met
  • User support / system problem analysis
  • Provide website support
  • Inform design process and ensure design meets the business goals and objectives
  • Write effective test cases based on business requirements, use cases and design

Requirements:

  • BComm Finance or Accounting or a new CA(SA)
  • Min 5 years Accountant / Project Accountant experience with involvement with Systems and data analytic's
  • Ideally from a retail background

Are you ready for the next step in your engineering career?
Do you enjoy coaching others to achieve high standards?
Join us in shaping a more just world.
About Us
LexisNexis, a part of RELX, is a leading global provider of legal, regulatory, and business information. We help customers increase productivity and improve decision-making and outcomes. Our 10,500 experts and innovative tools help us shape a better world for our customers and communities.
About the Role
As a Senior Software Engineer, you'll perform complex research, design, and software assignments to develop our Saas software product Workflow Solution features. Providing input to project plans, scheduling and methodology, you'll be developing cross-functional software products. You'll be working on individual tasks and solving problems. This position will also mentor more-junior members of the team,
Despite the product delivery is to serve the French market, knowledge of French is not required.
Responsibilities
  • Completing complex bug fixes, and resolving technical issues
  • Operating in various development environments (Agile, Waterfall, etc.) while collaborating with key stakeholders
  • Write and review portions of detailed specifications for the development of system components.
  • Work closely with other development team members to understand moderately complex product requirements and translate them into software designs.
  • Successfully implement development processes, coding best practices, and code reviews.
  • Ensure overall code quality, resiliency and maintainability.
  • Mentor and/or train entry-level software engineers as directed by department management, ensuring they are knowledgeable in critical aspects of their roles.
Requirements
  • Have a BS degree in Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • Have substantial Software Development experience
  • Have an excellent understanding of data modelling principles, data manipulation languages and storage systems including optimization techniques.
  • Be an expert in development languages such as Microsoft.NET stack (Asp.net core, Asp.net MVC, C#, WebApi, SQL), React, JavaScript
  • Have familiarity with any of the following - Platform components: RabbitMQ pub/sub, SignalR, Redis cac, Kong Api gateway, Cloud: Azure
  • Have an advanced knowledge of industry best practices
  • Have good knowledge of test-driven development
  • Have an advanced knowledge of software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall)
Work in a way that works for you

Working with Us
LexisNexis Legal & Professional is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. Working for you

About our Team
LexisNexis is a data and analytics company with 10,500 colleagues serving customers in more than 150 countries. We’re one of the largest information and analytics companies on the planet. We design solutions that help our customers increase productivity, improve decision-making and outcomes, and be more successful.

  • Cape Town - South Africa

Head of Data
Cape Town, South Africa
On-Site, Full Time

Our Client is a fast-growing startup that provides Crypto Education to thousands of students every month. They’re part of a well known Youtube media channel and have a community base of over a million people around the world. Their mission is to build the ultimate crypto training and worldwide community for anyone to learn crypto in a fun, simple, and safe way.

They are looking for a Head of Data to join their dynamic team in Cape Town.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Set the strategy for making us a data-driven company
  • Implement the systems and tools for executing that strategy
  • Be the main technical point of contact for our exchange partners and work to automate our verification process
  • Investigate and streamline the verification process to reduce potential points of failure
Requirements:
  • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g. mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science)
  • 2+ years of experience in a data analysis role, preferably within a startup environment or a fast-paced industry
  • Proficiency in Excel and Google Sheets, including advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data manipulation
  • Experience working with APIs and SQL databases
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify key insights and trends from complex data sets
  • Familiarity with statistical analysis and A/B testing methodologies
  • Understanding of web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Mixpanel) and tracking implementation best practices
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally with product, marketing, and engineering teams
  • A passion for crypto education and a desire to help us achieve our mission of taking crypto mainstream through education
Benefits:
  • Be part of a fast-growing startup with a thriving community
  • Work with a team of passionate professionals who share your commitment to excellence
  • Enjoy a fun, dynamic work environment that encourages creativity and innovation
  • Opportunity for growth and career advancement as we continue to expand our programs and offerings
  • Competitive salary and benefits package

Job Description:


Silversoft provides industry leading software to people and project centric firms globally with offices in the United Kingdon and South Africa & supporting over 30,000 users across some of the leading firms in Advertising, Architecture and Engineering, Consulting, Audit & Accounting and Legal. Our software delivers best of suite features to attract and retain the right talent, win new business, deliver excellent projects, drive productivity and deliver insight. We deliver a fit-for-purpose platform to support the entire project & services lifecycle so our clients can reimagine the way they work, drive growth and be more profitable. Silversoft is an award winning Deltek Premium Partner, named Best International Partner (Rest of World) for six consecutive years.

About the role

Silversoft is seeking a talented Digital Marketing Specialist to drive our marketing efforts and generate qualified leads. In this dynamic role, you will develop and execute a comprehensive digital marketing strategy, utilizing marketing automation, web technology, social media, SEO, and content creation to drive inbound and outbound initiatives. With your deep expertise in digital marketing, data analysis, and strategic thinking, you will make a significant impact on our company's growth. Join our team and be part of a dedicated growth team, focused on achieving marketing excellence and driving our company's success.

Core Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute a comprehensive digital marketing strategy to consistently generate qualified leads for our sales team.
  • Deliver leads as per required monthly targets for both inbound and outbound initiatives
  • Serve as a thought leader for our brand and content, driving inbound and outbound marketing strategies through web, social media, SEO, content creation and all other required channels.
  • Optimise and maintain firm-wide SEO
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product marketing, sales, and customer success, to produce relevant content that meets the needs of both key stakeholders and our target audience.
  • Assist with organising events together with our sales team.
  • Work with our customers to create case studies and success stories to demonstrate the value of our software solutions.
  • Identify and understand the key personas within our target market, and develop messaging and positioning to drive change and establish our company as a leading solution provider.
  • Work closely with the leadership team to develop & maintain a rolling twelve-month digital marketing plan. Drive the execution of the campaigns and activities within the plan.
  • Manage the company's digital strategy, including web, SEO, content marketing, and social media.
  • Manage the company’s marketing automation platform in collaboration with the sales team
  • Ensure Marketing contributes and adds value to the customer journey from the initial contact through to sales hand over.
  • Collaborate with exco, marketing and product marketing teammates to optimise our website and content marketing (blog, social media assets, and more), as well as maintain the basic functions of our websites.
  • Research and monitor competitors
  • Use competitive intelligence to inform product positioning and messagingOther related/relevant tasks as directed by the Executive team.

Data Responsibilities

  • Research & generate quality market data, including the identification and qualification of quality leads.
  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date contact, lead, and opportunity information in our marketing and CRM other key systems.
  • Ensure all marketing automation processes are in place and well maintained with data integrity throughout
  • Measure and report on the customer journey as it relates to product adoption and usage
  • Report on leads, lead forecasts and concluded marketing events/campaigns as required.
  • Assist the firm to submit applications & report marketing results to partner/supplier organisations
  • Deliver specific lead targets monthly and quarterly as defined by exco and ensure these are handed over to the necessary team members according to the company policy and processes
  • Ensure the Marketing Scorecard is delivered as per company policy and deadlines



Job Requirements:
  • Marketing degree/diploma or equivalent working experience.
  • Specific digital marketing qualifications are highly advantageous
  • Prior experience in digital marketing, product marketing, and courageously opening doors.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills - there is a heavy amount of writing and presenting/selling ideas in this role. Our buyers are C-Level executives from Professional Services firms
  • Proficiency in marketing related software tools, including CMS platforms (WiX/Wordpress or similar), email marketing software (Hubspot), web-analytics tools, optimizing conversion paths, and testing buyer stage-specific CTAs.
  • Hubspot and CMS experience is highly beneficial
  • If you have video production and video editing skills it is a plus.
  • Enjoy working in a collaborative, cross-team capacity. This role requires you to work across functions and departments to bring to life the messaging of our firm across all channels. You are at the centre of our entire organization, constantly interacting with teammates and prospects.
  • Thrives in a high-performance environment, with a strong sales team in high demand for leads.
  • Be coachable. This is a high-performance environment, consistently growing and learning is key to our firm.

As a worldwide engineering firm, we are ambitious, exciting, lively, collaborative, and dynamic. We are making a difference to society and technological progress across the globe. That’s how our colleagues describe our company. Want to contribute to enhancing society with your expertise? Be part of an open network where you’re connected with the brightest and smartest people and technologies? Join us!


You can look forward to growing your career in a dynamic workplace with development opportunities to support your career path. Entrepreneurship and innovation are stimulated in our organization. There is plenty of room for own initiative in an open and flexible culture.


At Royal HaskoningDHV, we want our workforce to be as diverse as the people we serve and the places they come from. That’s why we strive to create a workplace and culture that is fair and inclusive. Together, we're starting a journey in which each of us, individually and as a group, accepts, welcomes, and celebrates our uniqueness because we know that embracing diversity unlocks new ideas and fosters a spirit of openness that makes it easier for people to work together.

Main Responsibilities

  • Engineering modelling and prepare/assist with components of Engineering design with guidance and inputs from senior engineers
  • Preparing design deliverables including design reports, models, BOQs, drawings etc.
  • 3D modelling and coordination of infrastructure and multi-disciplinary projects
  • Maintain project records in accordance with internal quality system
  • Work closely with multiple disciplines ensuring integration of systems and spatial coordination is achieved
  • Using company standard collaboration and coordination tools such as BIM360, Revizto, and Asite
  • Automation of daily workflows are welcomed and encouraged
  • Regular contact and communication with the Project Engineers
  • Ensure that work is done in accordance with acceptable standards of both Royal HaskoningDHV and its Clients
  • Working on international projects and getting to know and applying the relevant country and project specific standards

Qualifications, skills and experience:

  • Eng/B.Tech or related qualifications.
  • Certification from either BIM, Revit MEP, Architecture, Civil/Structural, Mechanical, Electrical preferred
  • Minimum 4 to 7 years relevant experience
  • Professional registration or Candidate registration with ECSA
  • Proficient / Competent with AutoCad, Civil 3D, Revit and related software
  • Digital/BIM training and implementation of ISO19650 standards preferred.
  • Computational design thinking
  • Good understanding / outputs from hydraulic and surge analyses and design and optimise networks based on outputs.
  • Ability to work with and apply a wide variety of codes and standards and compile and review project specifications.
  • Experience with multi-disciplinary teams on water projects will be advantageous.
  • Experience with Common Data Environments and other relevant platforms
  • Practical knowledge, use & application of EIR, BEP, MIDP, DPOW, etc. based on project experience.
  • A clear understanding of Level of Information Needs in correlation to appointed scope for each work stage
  • Practical knowledge and experience in standard methods and terminology outlined in the ISO19650-1/2
  • AT least Intermediate level of knowledge in the use, application & management of BIM Cloud Platform - Autodesk BIM360 Collaborate.
  • Knowledge of GIS packages and integration is advantageous.
  • Experience in the following software and applications preferred:
    • High level of experience in the use of multiple BIM Authoring Platforms such as Autodesk Revit.
    • Working knowledge of software packages Revit, Civil 3D, EPANET and EPASWMM, Devotech iDAS will be advantageous
    • Using tools such as BIM360, Revizto, and Asite for design coordination and review

      • Pumpstation design for water distribution, wastewater conveyance as well as treatment and processing plant internal pumpstations.

      • Interconnecting pipework, fittings and associated components.

Behavioural competencies:

  • Ability to work independently with limited supervision

In line with our Employment Equity policy, preference will be given to applicants from designated groups and suitable internal candidates.

display_title: Associate Manager, Revenue Growth Management - Southern Africa
job_description:
For over 75 years, BIC has been creating ingeniously simple and joyful products that are a part of every heart and home.


As a member of our team, you'll be a part of reigniting a beloved brand as we continue to reimagine everyday essentials in new, sustainable and responsible ways.


Our "roll up your sleeves and get the job done" approach to work creates an environment where self-starters, problem solvers and innovative thinkers thrive. BIC team members are empowered to take ownership of their careers and bring their unique perspectives to the table to make a meaningful impact on our mission.


It's a colorful world - make your mark by joining the BIC team today.


JOB SUMMARY


The purpose of this position is to lead the development of Revenue Growth Management (RGM) capability for the Southern African markets. Taking accountability for developing the overall RGM strategy and specific initiatives in partnership with Marketing and regional Sales leads in order to facilitate sustainable growth. In addition, the RGM Manager will lead the build-up of the local RGM foundation across capabilities, RGM tools and data foundation.


One of the key missions will be to translate data and analytics into actionable insights to support revenue growth management objectives via the 5 pillars (portfolio strategy, product assortment and mix, pricing strategy, promotional effectiveness and partnering with customers) and drive sustainable growth initiatives in the Southern African markets.


Additionally, this role will be responsible for tight collaboration across multiple cross-functional stakeholders both within the region, and globally.


MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES / TASKS


  • Owns the development and of regional pack price strategy and pricing analytics in order to optimize our offering in the eyes of consumers, shoppers and customers.
  • Run pricing/assortment analytics (e.g., pricing potential by pack, price pack curve, brand ladder vs. competition) and simulations. Replaced by bullet point above.
  • Develop promotion analytics and share guidelines on improvement of promo calendar (optimal discount depth / lift by pack).
  • Create trade transparency and drive trade terms optimization via establishing best-practice trade architecture and customer segmentation.
  • Prepares the implementation (e.g., sell-in stories) of all RGM initiatives and align between functions involved in RGM (especially Marketing, Sales and Finance) to implement recommendations.
  • Provides tracking of the RGM initiatives, incl. definition of key RGM KPI to be tracked, and reports progress to leadership and offer coaching to respective people within the organization in charge of implementing the RGM initiatives.
  • Hold RGM Capability building session with wider organization to infuse RGM principles into ways of working and build required RGM expertise.
  • Owns and management of market specific RGM Tools for each level to ensure they remain relevant, insightful and actionable to the local Sales, Marketing and Finance teams.
  • Provides training/coaching on relevant tools & methodology to respective stakeholders within the organization.
  • Experience working with 3rd party data and research vendors to obtain relevant data applicable to the market is advantageous.
  • Supports the planning and execution of annual pricing actions for the Southern Africa region in partnership with Sales, Marketing and Finance teams.
  • Provide ad hoc support on RGM-related matters to other functions to help them meet and exceed their budgeted revenue targets and continually improve margins.

QUALIFICATIONS


  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business or a related analytical field
  • At least 2 years of prior revenue management experience required
  • 3+ years of business experience in a data and analytics role within FMCG
  • Previous role in Category, Sales, or Finance will be advantageous
  • Knowledge of the Southern Africa market/trade environment required
  • Ability to work collaboratively across different functions in the organization
  • Proven success developing Pricing, Promotion, Assortment and Trade optimization within an FMCG environment
  • Must have strong financial analysis skills
  • Highly proficient using (financial) analysis tools such as Excel, JDEdwards, etc.. – proficiency in PowerPoint
  • Knowledge of IRI, Nielsen systems will be a plus
  • Results-oriented leader with proven track record for delivering sustainable results
  • Good interpersonal skills, especially influencing skills
  • Strong change management capabilities are a plus

BIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strongly commit to hiring people with different backgrounds and experiences to help us build better products, make better decisions, and better serve our customers. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability status, or similar characteristics. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.


BIC is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for this employment opportunity. Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to any team member at BIC via email, or directly to a BIC team member in any form without a valid written search agreement in place for that position will be deemed the sole property of BIC, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by BIC as a result of the referral or through other means.

About Mobiquity

Founded in 2011, Mobiquity provides end-to-end omnichannel digital consulting services to trusted B2B and B2C brands (HealthCare, Banking, IoT, Big Data, and cutting edge Web & Mobile Applications). With over 750 employees spread across the USA, Europe, and India, 40 different nationalities combined; we create compelling digital experiences to help our clients create the best human-centric products. Our expertise includes Strategy, Design, Product Engineering, Analytics, and Cloud Services. Each day, 50 million users interact with our solutions.

Our teams are inspired by technology but it doesn’t rule them. We love to learn, we are curious by nature and committed to making a mark. Working at Mobiquity means that sometimes you’ll be working outside your comfort zone, and you’ll work with smart people, possibly some that are even smarter than you. We value people that judge their success by the success of the team and the happiness of customers.

We’re also proud to be an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Premier Consulting Partner.

What will you be doing?

As our Solution Architect, you perform architectural design and implementation oversight during Mobiquity client engagements and consult to improve the digital roadmap of Mobiquity clients. As part of the delivery team, you are responsible for creating architecture designs, working with client stakeholders, business analysts, to transform requirements into a solution design. Communicate solution designs to development teams.

Furthermore you:

  • Participate in planning, definition, and high-level design of the target architecture as well as compare and explore competing alternatives

  • Define systems and their interfaces, allocate responsibilities to subsystems, understand solution deployment, and communicate requirements for interactions within the solution context

  • Work with customers, stakeholders, and suppliers to establish high-level Solution Intent and its information models and documentation

  • Elicit and validate critical NFRs at the solution level, participate in the definition of other requirements at the project and technical levels

  • Produce solutions using complex architectures based on advanced or emerging design patterns

  • Interact with client's IT and business teams to address technical dependencies in the deployment of solutions

  • Resolve technical issues and identify solutions by building consensus among technical stakeholders

Why work as Solution Architect for Mobiquity?

We give you a few good reasons:

  • If you have a good idea or see new opportunities for the client, then go ahead! We will support you with resources, time, and budget. Mobiquity offers you a platform to evolve your entrepreneurial skills.
  • We’re an international company, delivering global and local projects from our offices in the Netherlands, the US, and India.
  • We offer end-to-end engagement: from innovation (ideation) workshops to UX, data science, architecture to cloud-native and mobile development. We are also an AWS Advanced Consulting Partner.
  • We drive innovation at our clients, you’ll be part of the innovation workshops we host, you’re there from the first moment on.
  • And we work in different branches; from Healthcare, FinTech to IoT

What it takes to excel in this role

  • Bachelor or Master
  • 3+ years experience in relevant IT domains (prefer consulting)
  • 1+ years experience as digital Solution/System/Domain Architect
  • Hands-on experience in designing software systems (Technical Designer, Solution Architect)
  • Good experience in software architecture from an overall platform perspective
  • Excellent communications skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Solid understanding of agile principles and proven experience applying them
  • Experience with cloud-native solutions or container technologies

Nice to have

  • Experience in Digital Consulting
  • Cloud-Native mindset towards designing greenfield software solutions
  • Experience in Banking / Finance industry
  • Willingness to travel periodically
  • AWS/Azure/Google Solution Architect Professional

Occasional traveling (abroad) is part of the job.

What we offer

  • Competitive salary,
  • Medical Aid Contribution,
  • Retirement Fund,
  • Risk Insurance,
  • Phone Allowance,
  • 20 PTO days,
  • Training via our Mobiquity Academy, including access to Udemy for Business, MS Learn, AWS Learn, Google Cloud Skills,
  • A challenging learning environment and cool creative and innovative projects,
  • We invest in your growth, success, and happiness, and celebrate the world-class work you produce,
  • We are famous for our healthy work-life balance and for being really flexible,
  • Remote set-up
Do you have what it takes? Follow our instructions below to apply.


Apply

After giving your consent in the section below, please upload your resume and details. Have questions before applying? Please address them to our recruiter: Daria - dmikolaevskaia@mobiquityinc.com

Pepkor Payments and Lending is looking for an experienced Senior Credit Risk Analyst to analyse and interpret the credit risk indicators with the objective of achieving bad debt and pass rate targets and optimising portfolio profitability. Furthermore, the Senior Credit Risk Analyst will recommend credit policy and operational policy changes based on analysis.

1. Design and analytics

  • Design and continual optimisation of the credit vetting and scoring policy to ensure credit performance targets are met
  • Analysis of operational performance and recommendations to improve credit efficiencies
  • Perform ad hoc analysis required by Credit Committee to enable accurate decisioning
  • Analytical representation of Capfin with bureau on custom scorecard developments for application-, limit- and collections scorecards
  • Coach and mentor other analysts to deliver on key performance areas

2. Portfolio monitoring and recommendations

  • Daily, weekly and monthly tracking of relevant metrics
  • Ensure accurate measurement and monitoring of credit risk and credit operational performance
  • Work closely with the data team and information and analytics architect to implement data solutions in the data warehouse
  • Monitor and analyse fraud processes to ensure optimal levels of fraud through proposals/recommendations to Credit Committee on effective prevention strategies
  • Input and recommendations on the development and enhancement of the credit risk strategy and analytics for Capfin
  • Identify trends in performance and recommend policy changes to Credit Committee

3. Reporting

  • Design a reporting framework for implementation by BI team
  • Validate reporting development by BI team
  • Enhance reporting requirement to match business needs

  • A post-graduate qualification will be advantageous

Work Experience

Functional Competencies

  • Scorecard building and monitoring
  • Performance reporting and interpretation
  • Formulate policy proposals in line with mandate
  • Diagnostic analytics
  • Manage relationships with credit bureaus
  • Champion Challenger analysis

Behavioural competencies

  • Work accurately to deadlines
  • Good communication skills
  • Proactive
  • Able to work collaboratively or independently
  • Organised

Business Intelligence:

Job Description

RCL FOODS is currently looking for a Management Accountant to join the Speciality team. The role will be based in Centurion and will report to the Commercial Executive. The role requires an analytical individual with commercial and operations experience. The Management Accountant will assist with the effective running of the costing department and monitor all activities that have a cost implication. Provide commercial support and insights to the Commercial Management of the Speciality operating unit, through effective management of costings and profitability. The Management Accountant will be dealing with key issues in providing support and technical input to the commercial, sales and NPD teams to deliver insightful analysis.

Duties & Responsibilities

Through the costing team deliver on the following:

Costing Management

  • Ensure costings going to the customer/sales team is accurate.
  • Ensure costing template used is updated, relevant and relevant (i.e accurate recipes, costs).
  • Partner with New Product Develop, Operations and Sales teams to ensure all parties understand the commercial impact of relevant costing.
  • Ensure all costings is in a library where only one version can be accessed by the teams (i.e manage versions).

BOM Management

  • Maintain product costing system (MACS).
  • Develop, oversee and drive momentum of continuous BOM and routing audit processes to be conducted by Processing and Ops resources.
  • Support initiatives designed to control costs and maximize profitability.
  • Review and provide insight into proposed changes to product costs (as a result of trials or change in specifications) and new product proposals.
  • Maintain the integrity and support proper execution of the NPD approval process for BOM changes/additions.
  • Load new BOM’s for trial codes requested from Master Data.
  • Calculate and implement any approved changes to product costing, clearly outlining the impact of such changes on the cost base and ultimately, profitability.
  • Monitor, review and provide feedback on the actual impact of changes that have been made and new product costing as part of the “post launch” process.
  • Ensure all BOM changes are supported by an audit trial.

Profitability & Business Analytics, Information and Data Management

  • Drive enhanced business profitability and performance information designed to unlock margin opportunities and influence improved contributions.
  • Identify opportunities for value added reporting to improve the quality and content of reporting and message management.
  • Development of a central business performance and tracking platform, through innovative reporting tools and business analytics.
  • Share relevant data with senior management teams to enable reliable business decision making.

BOM Audits & Factory Trials

  • Ensure the team is always available for factory trials to enable accurate costings.
  • On a quarterly basis BOM audits will be performed with the broader operations team and needs to be facilitated by this function.
  • Ensure findings from BOM audits are clearly reported & executed with relevant approval.

Commercial Insight and Technical Expertise

  • Provide calculations, detailed analysis, presentations and associated recommendations emanating from any and all queries that arise as a result of changes in business operations, the economic climate or potentially might offer more profitable solutions.
  • Provide practical commercial expertise and insights to the Speciality Exec and run with any ad hoc business performance enhancement requests.

Stock take management

  • Co-ordination and management of monthly stock take processes including variance analysis and reporting.
  • Review tools in preparation for the month stock take.


Minimum Requirements

  • B.Com Accounting/Management Accounting (non-negotiable)
  • CIMA or CA (SA) essential.
  • Honours Degree Advantageous.
  • Minimum of 3-5 years operational cost and management accounting experience, including commercial costing.
  • Excellent knowledge of FMCG or manufacturing or complex plant experience required.
  • Syspro or SAP experience ideal.

overview

An international Data Analytics company based in South Africa is looking Business Analyst to join their team. description

The Business Rules Analyst is responsible for the reviewing and analysis of business requirements, proposing solution designs, defining the scope thereof, creating functional specifications, documenting configuration requirements, customizing software settings and parameters, integrating various components or modules, and ensuring the software functions as required. The Business Rules Analyst must ensure that both the client and internal team understand the requirements, the accepted solution and expected outcomes

Key Responsibilities and Competencies:

  • Gain an understanding of the Company’s product offerings and system capabilities.
  • Engage with clients to review and analyse their requirements, determine operational objectives and
    document the business requirement specifications
  • Scope the solution and translate the business requirements into detailed functional specifications
    indicating software development and configuration requirements, inclusive of workflow
    charts/diagrams
  • Facilitate and conduct walk-throughs of the requirement specifications to the client and internal
    delivery team
  • Configure and/or perform a comprehensive quality assessment of the client’s solution
  • Document and communicate configuration-related information
  • Diagnose and resolve configuration-related issues, investigate build failures, and identify and implement corrective actions
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including configuration specifications, standard
    operating procedures, and troubleshooting guides
  • Provide input into effort estimation exercises and test cases/scenarios for full QA coverage
  • Provide day-to-day consulting assistance for multiple clients

Knowledge Requirements:

  • Complete understanding of the different Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) phases, including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, and deployment, and how configuration management fits into these phases
  • Understanding of relational database and client-server concepts
  • Understanding of Change Management processes and how to effectively manage software configuration changes, including proper documentation, versioning, and release management
  • Proficient in Excel (Advanced Level), Word, PowerPoint and Visio
  • Microsoft SQL knowledge and experience
  • High level of English proficiency (both verbal and written)
  • Familiar with Agile methodology
  • Process Improvement Exposure
  • Programming experience advantageous

experience, qualifications and skills

Strong presentation skills:

  • Conceptual thinker with logical and critical problem-solving style and approach.
  • Analytical skills to diagnose and resolve configuration-related issues, investigate build failures, and identify and implement corrective actions
  • Detail orientated and inquisitive
  • Ability to multi-task, be flexible and have the ability to prioritise with a sense of urgency and work
    under pressure to tight deadlines, which includes the possibility of working over weekends and ‘outside of office hours’.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate with developers, QA teams, and other
    stakeholders
  • Excellent customer service orientation.
  • Strong sense of ownership and accountability
    Strong time-management skills
    Ability to work with foreign cultures and willingness to travel
    Ability to work within a team and independently

Experience:

  • 3-5 years of experience in the IT environment with at least 3 years hands-on experience in a business
    analysis role.

  • Experience in conducting training with clients is beneficial.

Title:

Market Related - Very Negotiable

Description:
An opportunity exists at one of our esteemed clients in Industria West, Roodepoort for a Deputy Digital News Editor within their Digital Department (Editorial), reporting to the Digital News Editor. The position is full time office-based and entails rotational shifts.
Main Responsibilities:

  • To compile and organise a running diary for future events and generate story ideas.

  • To evaluate and make recommendations in terms of what will work well online.

  • To manage, mentor and train journalists and interns in order to produce outstanding copy.

  • To ensure deadlines are met.

  • To line edit stories in order to identify problems such as libel or inaccuracy and to ensure complete fairness.

  • To help manage the news room, making sure problems are identified and dealt with promptly.

  • Monitor our sister publications for relevant news stories and stories which can be repackaged and used on our website.

  • Translate Afrikaans stories from our News Network, to be used on our website.

  • To liaise with the Digital Editor, Print Editor, Reporters, Chief Sub Editor and bureaus.

  • To monitor electronic news, other newspapers and magazines, and the wires.

  • To assist in hiring reporters.

  • To ensure all sources in the assigned beat areas are regularly covered.

  • To liaise with the multimedia department to ensure visual elements of stories.

  • To assist the Digital News Editor to ensure the daily flow of news, pictures and other news material.

  • Develop strategies for generating meaningful and engaging content that garners a high volume of visits and encourages awareness and excitement.

  • Analyse statistics by monitoring digital platforms, website performance, traffic, engagement of audience and data available.

  • Monitor analytics to maximise all stories and articles published on the website.

  • Adhere to Google algorithm requirements and write with SEO and Google search in mind.

  • Study and adhere to our organisations Voice and Style Guide.

  • Adhere to Code of Ethics and Editorial Standards and Practices.


    • Category:
    General

  • Matric/Grade 12 qualification or SAQA Accredited Equivalent.

  • Bachelors or higher degree in Journalism / Linguistics or appropriate work experience.

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in mainstream journalism.

  • Minimum 2 years’ experience managing a news desk / team of reporters.

  • Advanced awareness of media law and current trends.

  • Good talent for writing and copy tasting abilities.

  • Ability to accurately translate copy from Afrikaans to English.

  • Knowledge of our News Network publications would be beneficial.

  • Excellent communication skills

  • People management skills

  • Excellent organisational skills

  • Good administrative skills

  • Ability to work under pressure and irregular hours

  • News awareness

  • Self-motivated

  • Deadline driven

  • Team player

  • Valid driver’s licence

  • Own vehicle

  • Good references

Head of Marketing (JB3347)
Hillcrest, Durban

Overview
We are assisting our client in finding a highly experienced and dynamic individual to join their team as the Head of Marketing. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and executing marketing strategies, managing the brand, and driving customer interest and sales. This is a senior leadership role requiring a strong background in digital and marketing experience, particularly in web, social, and emerging technologies, as well as a deep understanding of the consumer goods industry.

The ideal candidate will hold a degree in Marketing or a related field and have 8 – 10 years of digital and marketing experience.
Experience in the FMCG sector will be highly beneficial.

Minimum Requirements:
A degree in marketing or a related field.
Minimum of 10 years of digital and marketing experience, particularly with web, social, and emerging technologies.
Minimum of 5 years in a similar capacity.
Experience in the consumer goods industry, particularly FMCG, is highly beneficial.
Strong industry knowledge and understanding of market trends, consumer habits, and competitors' positioning.
Proficiency in marketing principles, market research techniques, and key marketing performance metrics.
Technology proficiency in social media, analytics, SEO, email marketing, and other relevant tools.
Excellent skills in presenting and analyzing data, as well as creating actionable reports.
Resourcefulness and ability to multitask and prioritize work in a fast-paced environment.
Confidence, decisiveness, and willingness to take initiative.
Hands-on approach to all aspects of marketing and communication in the business.
Out-of-the-box thinking and ability to constructively interrogate briefs, ideas, and plans for the benefit of the work and brand.
Strategic thinking and planning skills.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop an annual marketing strategy that drives customer interest and sales.
Manage and maintain the company's brand story and strategy, ensuring consistency across all marketing touchpoints.
Prepare and manage monthly, quarterly, and annual budgets for the Marketing Department.
Lead the development and execution of all marketing campaigns across social media, print advertising, PR, and digital channels, including testing, tracking, reporting/analysis, and making recommendations for optimization.
Collaborate with the Buying Team to develop a sales-driven promotional program, using data to inform product placement, in-store signage, marketing campaigns, and media placement.
Analyze consumer behavior, purchase trends, and sales data to determine customer personas and maintain a set of customer archetypes through regular research and store visits.
Conduct regular competitor analyses and provide recommendations and updates to the marketing strategy based on pricing changes, new products and features, and campaigns.
Oversee the digital channel strategy, working closely with the Social Media Manager to ensure alignment with the overall marketing plan and achievement of channel KPIs.
Manage the creative team's output by establishing a clear briefing process, developing a creative style guide, and maintaining the brand identity.
Hold regular meetings with the buying team and senior management to review pipeline, resolve challenges, brainstorm solutions, and provide campaign reporting and results.
Lead and develop the Marketing and Creative Team, setting measurable KPIs and objectives, and conducting quarterly presentations to the executive team.

Senior Associate: Enterprise Risk (Internal Audit)


Why should I work for EY in Risk?

EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team up to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

Management and Boards of Directors rely heavily on Internal Audit to provide important proactive assessments and assurance around the effectiveness of controls and company processes, while also providing objective advisory support. You will be engaged in delivering some of the most significant and class-leading internal audit and risk engagements globally. As part of our market-leading global network of risk professionals, you will gain the valuable experience you need to become a successful risk advisor. At EY, we recognize that it is the perspectives, skills and enthusiasm you bring to our clients that makes the difference.


Your client responsibilities

  • Work effectively as a team member, sharing responsibility, providing support, maintaining communication and updating senior team members on progress.
  • Assign and manage tasks with other team members considering engagement needs and identified business outcomes, and organize own work such that important items get done first.
  • Build strong internal relationships within EY and with other services across the organization.
  • Research client industry, company structure, key customers and suppliers and possible insight into operations and the various processes
  • Develop and maintain productive working relationships with client personnel.
  • Collaborate with the client to identify critical project outcomes, work products, barriers to success, and changes in expectations or scope.
  • Manage own time in line with budgets
  • Prepare or review business process descriptions through interviews with the client’s middle and senior management and documenting understanding of business process and confirm the business process descriptions by performing a walkthrough of the process.
  • Identifying possible business risks and control weaknesses from the business processes under review.
  • Drafting detailed audit programmes to test controls in place.
  • Identify basic data analytic procedures
  • Assessment of design and implementation of key controls as well as the operating effectiveness, accuracy and validity thereof.
  • Compilation of working papers substantiating scope and results of testing.
  • Provide a coaching / mentoring role.
  • Review sections prepared by junior staff
  • Draft individual sections of documents and presentations to explain issues and solution options and implications.
  • Display a logical thought process in understanding client challenges and exploring possible solutions.
  • Identify and escalate potential risks and issues to project manager along with suggested preventive or mitigating actions.
  • Draft audit findings for review by EY Senior Management.
  • Assist with presenting findings to client


Your people responsibilities

  • Act as a visible role model for our people.
  • Coach and mentor junior team members.
  • Give honest supportive feedback to colleagues.
  • Take personal responsibility for own performance and career development.
  • Play an active role in EY and Service line team activities.
  • Understand and follow workplace policies and procedures.


Technical skills requirements

  • Must have Honours in Internal Audit, Accounting, Business, Finance or other related field
  • Must have CIA
  • Minimum of 4 years of related work experience
  • Related audit or applicable business experience
  • Proficient in Microsoft office (including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint).


Additional skills requirements

  • Strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Demonstrated integrity, values, principles, and work ethic.
  • Enquiring Mind
  • Analytical
  • Self-starter
  • Team Player
  • Share EY’s values and vision
  • Disciplined
  • Able to handle pressure
  • Team building ability
  • Good communication skills

As a Junior Investment Analyst, you will be working within our team of highly experienced, thought-leading, and

entrepreneurial-minded investment professionals. This is a key new role that intersects with all the functions

performed across our investment team, and through which you will be supported and empowered to develop

hands-on knowledge and expertise across multiple areas of our investment firm. We are manager of client

assets, a global investment advisor, and a provider of global fund manager research. In this role you will benefit

from hands-on exposure to both the local and offshore asset management industry. In addition, through

involvement in each area of our rigorous and institutional quality investment process, you will get the

opportunity to develop the expertise that will accelerate your growth as an investment professional.

The Role

The successful candidate will report to the Chief Investment Officer, and shall be responsible for assisting with

investment analytics, implementation, and the improvement of processes across the investment functions.

Investment analytics plays a pivotal role in our investment process, and the successful candidate will have a

broad range of responsibilities in this area, including quantitative analysis, data management and modelling,

and performance calculations and attribution analytics, all of which provide key inputs into various aspects of

the investment team’s processes. The role will contribute to the investment team’s research, asset allocation,

portfolio management, implementation, compliance and reporting activities.

Work Experience

The ideal candidate for this role will have 1 – 3 years’ experience within the financial services industry. Examples

of financial services industry experience would include the following:

  • Understanding of the investment environment and financial markets both local and international (incl.
CIS’s, ETF’s, equities, benchmarks)

  • Quantitative analysis (modelling, design and development)
  • Financial modelling
  • Development of analytical tools (incl. Excel, BI tools, proprietary tools)
  • Structuring and processing large amounts of data
  • Performance attribution analysis
  • Performance calculations
  • Portfolio mandate and regulatory compliance monitoring
  • Trade implementation
  • Trade life cycle management (incl. execution, confirmation and settlement)
  • Understanding of investment analysis metrics (incl. tracking error, standard deviation)
  • Compilation and delivery of investment reporting (to the investment team and clients)
  • Sourcing and maintenance of market data and data from 3rd parties
  • CIS operations (incl. asset and liability administration, Manco, trustees, custodians)
  • Design and implementation of internal process improvements
Qualifications and Skills

Qualifications and skills serve to provide the potential candidate with a strong foundation upon which to grow

and develop within this role. The type of qualifications and skills we are looking for include the following:

Degrees (or similar): Bachelor’s, Honours or Master’s degrees (fields incl. Actuarial Science; Finance;

Mathematics; Statistics; Computer Science; Investment Management)

Degree Results: Upper Second; First-Class; Deans Merit List

Additional Studies: Studying towards or completed CFA, CIPM, CFP or other fields of specialisation

Computer Skills: Proficient use of all MS Office applications (ability to use MS Excel is essential to succeed in this

role); Programming experience (e.g., SQL, Python, Java, C#, R); Experience with trade management, analytics,

and market data systems (e.g., Refinitiv, Bloomberg, Morningstar, FE Analytics)

To apply for this role please send your CV, ID and transcripts to operations@asearch.co.za

We are seeking an experienced and self-motivated individual to join our team as an ERP Administrator. The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining and improving our ERP system's performance, security, and functionality. The ERP Administrator will also be responsible for managing system upgrades, troubleshooting issues, and providing support to end users.

Experience :

  • Strong understanding of ERP system architecture, configuration, customization, and integration with other systems.
  • Ability to troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve technical issues related to the ERP system.
  • Experience in system upgrades and testing procedures.
