Job Description

Our client based in Kyalami is seeking to employ a Demand Planner to do the following:


Supports the Demand Planning Manager and Brands to develop the consensus forecast for the brands based on statistical forecast and sales & marketing activities such as promotions (GWP, local sets) and new product launches;


  • Develops the SKU & aggregate forecast based on the in-market intelligence from the multifunctional teams (e.g. incorporating latest promotion plans, in-market performance of the new launches, competitive activities, macro market trends, customers’ plans, trade inventory etc.);


  • Collaborates with Affiliate Inventory Managers and brand & sales team to manage and shape demand especially during extended out of stocks situations;


  • Maintains the Demand Planning Attributes & Master data such as Characteristics Value Combinations (CVCs), Product lifecycle (PLC’s), Demand Type (DT), Strategic Indicator (SI), and History Start Date (HSD);


  • Conduct New Product pre & post launch analysis with brands and regional demand planning team and recommend actions for future launches based on historical insights (pipeline, sell-in velocity, cannibalization, execution excellence);


  • Leads the pre(Branded) SIOP meetings focusing on demand trends insights, building blocks assumptions, and share scenarios planning based on risks & opportunity assessments;


  • Leads the Demand Review section as part of the monthly SIOP meetings, focusing the team on key trends insights and focus the team’s energy on strategic areas which makes the biggest impact to the business (e.g. key assumptions which assumptions went right/wrong, key demand drivers insights, cannibalization learnings for reapplication, key building blocks assumptions); and


  • Conduct forecast analytics and share analysis insights and recommendations.


  • Generate, analyze and communicate key reports and data throughout the region in line with regional strategy and local requirements.


Skill Requirements / Personal Competencies

  • Knowledge of supply chain management concepts, i.e. Plan, Source, Make, Deliver and Return
  • Strong analytical and problem solving abilities
  • Proactive and a team player
  • Continuously look for forecast accuracy improvement opportunities
  • Critical thinking skills to identify where analysis is required & then do it
  • Ability to work in a dynamic, pressurised environment
  • Experience with Microsoft Office with strong experience in Excel (Advanced) and PowerPoint (Basic)
  • Experience in and/or exposure to S&OP processes and procedures
  • Excellent communication skills - both formal and informal
  • Ability to communicate within all levels of the organisation
  • Strong meeting facilitation skills
  • Strong negotiating skills
  • Knowledge of statistical modeling techniques


Education and Experience

  • Bachelor’s Degree in related field
  • SAP/ERP knowledge, APO would be advantageous
  • Demand Planning systems knowledge
  • 3 to 5 years planning experience
  • APICS or other forecasting certification preferred

We are seeking a highly capable Materials Manager.

The incumbent will be responsible to head the warehouse and for the overall management of the daily operations of the warehouse within the business whilst effectively and efficiently ensuring that operational activities are executed on time and in accordance with the Service Level Agreement (SLA) conditions and that all administration is completed timeously and accurately.

Reporting to the Head of Supply Chain – the core functions of the Material’s Manager include managing inventory and purchasing procedures for raw materials and other supplies within the company. Collaborate with other managers to determine supply needs, purchase supplies and materials according to specifications and coordinate and supervise receiving procedures.

A tertiary qualification in Supply Chain or related is essential.

  • Previous Supply Chain Management experience having worked within a Manufacturing (FMCG), or related Industry is essential.
  • Experience in the use of an ERP system and/or WMS. Syspro would be an advantage.
  • Must understand process development and management.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills.
  • Data management skills.
  • Relationship-building and interpersonal skills.
  • Creative thinking to help bring products to the market faster.
  • Technical ability, including a solid understanding of artificial intelligence, analytics software and innovations that can impact the supply chain.

Location: Cape Town, South Africa

Contract: Full-time

Remuneration Range: Competitive


Responsibilities

Manage the AgriCarbon Commercial Department;

  • Draft and deliver on the agreed budget once it has been approved
  • Manage, recruit, motivate and retain staff which includes the Onboarding team and Account Managers
  • Lead the development of a detailed plan/strategy to document how CNG can scale AgriCarbon across South Africa
  • Define and understand the market opportunity
  • Oversee / lead customers through the sales process from external discovery through to signed contract, onboarding, and contract renewals
  • Spearhead customers’ escalations/issues and collaborate with team to drive them to an expeditious resolution
  • Make commercially astute decisions relating to your department as well as the broader programme within agreed parameters
  • Manage and develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders
  • Weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting on the status and performance of your division
  • Keep the CEO and/or AgriCarbon Programme Manager informed about all issues that provide a threat to delivering on the budget
  • Develop, refine and implement the sales and marketing strategy
  • Oversee the development and implementation an AgriCarbon farmer support programme to assist farmers on their regenerative farming journey (“customer success journey”) working closely with our Agronomists and Soil Scientists

Build a thorough understanding of the AgriCarbon brand and service offering;

  • Work closely with the AgriCarbon Marketing team and help refine and expand the Marketing Strategy
  • Understand the market opportunity available and prioritise the business development strategy in consultation with the other departments
  • Have a solid understanding of the ag ecosystem of agribusiness

Lead the Partner Sales route for AgriCarbon partners;

  • Oversee and work closely with the AgriCarbon Partnerships & Integrations team
  • Build deep relationships with various partners, such as Ag service providers, farmer associations, industry bodies etc, at local and regional level
  • Coach partners to increase enrolments, differentiate competitive offerings, and build relationships
  • Help create & communicate relevant information around enrolment and eligibility that matches the partners farmers segmentation and seasonal opportunities
  • Help partners achieve their KPI and carbon targets with customized strategies
  • Support Partners at events, field days, and webinars

Lead the Farmer Sales Route;

  • As part of your farmer direct route to market you will, oversee all new and existing farmer customers
  • Develop high quality presentations that
  • Accurately and compellingly present the AgriCarbon programme and benefits to farmers
  • Articulate the value proposition of the AgriCarbon programme to a farmer’s unique situation
  • Support farmers at field events and webinars

Close and begin farmer onboarding;

  • Educate/enable farmers to effectively enrol their farms
  • Ensure an effective eligibility assessment process for farmer enrolment
  • Achieve KPIs and carbon targets with customized strategies and prospecting
  • Oversee the activities of the onboarding team, and / or (Key) Account Managers to ensure effective handover to the Data & Analytics Teams

About Climate Neutral Group and Anthesis Group

Climate Neutral Group (CNG) is a fast-growing organization with a clear purpose: to enhance the Net Zero journey to combat climate change. Since its foundation in 2002, Climate Neutral Group has been stimulating organizations in Climate-Neutral entrepreneurship: from A to Zero CO2 emissions. CNG recently merged with Anthesis Group.

CNG helps organizations to get insight in their CO2 emissions, to reduce their emissions and to offset their residual emissions and to substantiate their climate neutral claims through our Climate Neutral Certification Program. Climate Neutral Group has grown strongly in recent years. More information can be found at: www.climateneutralgroup.com/en

In 2022 Climate Neutral Group became part of Anthesis, the sustainability activator!

Proud to be a B Corp, we seek to make a significant contribution to a world which is more resilient and productive. We do this by working with cities, corporates, investors and other organisations to drive sustainable performance. We develop financially driven sustainability strategies, underpinned by technical expertise and delivered by innovative collaborative teams across the world. The company combines the reach of big professional services groups with the deep expertise of boutiques.

Anthesis has clients across industry sectors from corporate multinationals such as Reckitt Benckiser, Cisco, Tesco, The North Face and Target, and also supports early-stage companies through Anthesis Ventures. The company brings together 1100+ experts operating in 42 countries around the world and has offices in Andorra, Brazil, Canada, China, Colombia, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, the Middle East, the Philippines, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, the UK, and the US.

At Anthesis Group, we are truly committed to putting people and our planet at the heart of all we do.

We encourage all employees to contribute their ideas, perspectives, and experiences to help us create an inclusive and equitable workplace. By embracing diversity and providing equal opportunities, we believe we can drive innovation, foster creativity, and achieve our shared goals. So, if you’re ready to be a part of something truly extraordinary, then we want you! Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, pregnancy, martial status, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Together, we can continue to build a diverse and inclusive workforce where everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed and thrive.

If you require any reasonable adjustments to be made to your application process, or need this job advert in a different format, just let us know and we’ll be happy to help.

Job summary

The Sales & Customer Success Manager’s main objective is to grow CNG’s AgriCarbon business in South Africa. You will lead the AgriCarbon commercial department, with full responsibility for the delivery of the agreed targets and budget, as well as the development and implementation of the go-to-market strategy to sign-up new farmers and partner organisations. You will be expected to focus on our farmer clients – current and future – to understand their needs and build our business to meet those needs. You will collaborate closely with the Carbon, Research, Agronomy and Data teams to drive operational efficiency and data driven decision making through AgriCarbon’s Digital Data Collection Platform.

The position requires someone with extensive experience in heading up a sales / business development department, ideally with exposure to the commercial agriculture space. Excellent in-person and remote communication skills are crucial, as are good business management skills and commercial flair. The successful candidate will be highly skilled and confident in establishing partnerships, with a proven ability to close, as well as demonstrating crossfunctional leadership to drive growth across a range of industry partners.

Competencies

  • Strong problem-solving and communications skills, ability to clearly articulate thoughts, strong EQ skills, very proactive
  • Understands the customer’s needs to cultivate trust & lasting relationships
  • Strong business acumen and understanding of economics especially as it relates to agriculture
  • Shows optimism and an ability to recover from setbacks
  • Sales-passionate; able to follow and contribute to sales processes, coordinate cross functional customer enablement, and drive toward strong ROI for customers
  • Flexible to support customers after hours to resolve time-sensitive matters, and to travel for customer engagement and industry events
  • Passionately wants to win, has a vision, and can articulate an action plan, proven ability to motivate a cross functional team to achieve goals
  • Ability to leverage shared successes to elevate the broader team’s performance
  • Fluency in Afrikaans an added advantage

Qualifications

  • A minimum of 10 years track record in the management of a sales/business development unit or department, working with strategic / complex accounts or consulting experience
  • B2B sales, key account management and demonstrated consistent success in achieving quarterly and annual targets in a fast growing business
  • Relevant tertiary qualification(s) essential
  • Proven ability to deliver on the budget and to manage a team
  • Understand farming as a business a big plus
  • Passion for developing new accounts and industry relationships
  • Proof of prior success driving growth and convincing partners to adopt new approaches/technologies
  • Experience using sales support CRM (Customer Relationship Management) tools
  • Ability to travel regularly for extended periods

Compensation at Climate Neutral Group South Africa:

To help us attract and retain top talent, CNG pays employees competitively to the market. In return, we expect each employee to, at a minimum:

  • Meet expectations in terms of work effort and performance;
  • Take the initiative to build the skills and knowledge needed to do their job effectively; and
  • Embody CNG’s values.

Does this sound like your dream job? If so, go ahead and apply for the position and we’ll be in touch.

We appreciate your interest in Climate Neutral Group.

Careers that Change Lives

Join our Sales Enablement & Excellence (SEE) organization as Regional SEE Lead in EMEA Region Led Markets.
Our focus is to arm the commercial organization with the needed data insights, tools and training to drive operational efficiencies, profitable growth and increase market share, whist maintaining a clear focus on customer needs.
The Regional Sales Enablement and Excellence Lead role is designed to work closely with the commercial leaders in the country/region to drive sales force effectiveness and to optimize sales processes & governance. The role acts as a critical support to Customer Relationship Management, territory alignment & targeting, Sales Incentive Plan management, account segmentation and other key initiatives to drive disciplined and successful commercial execution.

For this role, you will be expected to be located in Johannesburg, South Africa.

A Day in the Life

· Define the organization structure and resource allocation to increase sales force efficiency and ultimately maximize value to the customer. Lead the salesforce sizing, territory design and target setting process for the region.

· Actively contribute to the design and execution of the Go to Market strategies within the region.

· Deploy and implement performance KPIs & dashboards alongside our Sales Analytics & Excellence team and support periodic performance reviews with commercial leaders.

· Enable the sales force team through the design and implementation of competitive Sales Incentive Plans.

· Lead the CRM roll-out (Salesforce.com) and adoption of sales enablement tools to improve collaboration, productivity and customer experience.

· Identify training needs and support the Commercial Training team in the successful deployment of training, education and coaching to increase the skills and business acumen of the sales organization.

· Provide data insights to support leadership on sound commercial decision making. Ensure sharing of commercial best practices across the sales force and continuously improve effectiveness and efficiency of commercial processes.

· Ensure coordination within Global Commercial Operations & Customer Experience and with other departments including Finance, Marketing and business enablers to drive organizational excellence and ensure organizational success.

Must Haves

· Bachelor’s degree with 5+ years of relevant work experience in business analytics, sales and operations

· Experience with CRM tools (Salesforce.com is a plus)

· Broad perspective and business acumen, able to think strategically and at the same time be hands-on and detail oriented

· Experience in a multicultural, diverse environment and interaction with many stakeholders

· Strong influencing and executive communication & presentation skills (with fluency in both written and spoken English)

· Excellent analytical skills in Excel and knowledge of PowerPoint and Word

· Good knowledge of IT software/systems – Tableau, Power BI

· Willingness to Travel up to 20% of time

Nice to Haves

· Sales Enablement/Commercial Excellence or Sales Management experience in MedTech or the Healthcare Industry

· Strong grasp of Company business strategy, future growth plans and solid understanding of Healthcare Markets

We Offer

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package to all our employees:

· Flexible working environment

· Annual Incentive Plan % depending on company results

· Pension scheme and group discount on healthcare insurance

· Training possibilities via Cornerstone/Harvard Manage Monitor/Skills Lab

· Employee Assistance Program and Recognize! (Global recognition program)

Our commitment

Our unwavering commitment to inclusion, diversity, and equity (ID&E) means zero barriers to opportunity within Medtronic and a culture where all employees belong, are respected, and feel valued for who they are and the life experiences they contribute.

We know equity starts beyond our workplace, and we must play a role in addressing systemic inequities in our communities if we hope to have long-term sustainable impact.

Anchored in our Mission, we continue to drive ID&E forward both to enhance the well-being of Medtronic employees and to accelerate innovation that brings our lifesaving technologies to more people in more places around the world.

About Medtronic
Bold thinking. Bolder actions. We are Medtronic.

We lead global healthcare technology and boldly attack the most challenging health problems facing humanity by searching out and finding solutions. Our Mission — to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life — unites a global team of 90,000+ passionate people. Powered by our diverse knowledge, insatiable curiosity, and desire to help all those who need it, we deliver innovative technologies that transform the lives of two people every second, every hour, every day. Expect more from us as we empower insight-driven care, experiences that put people first, and better outcomes for our world.

In everything we do, we are engineering the extraordinary.

job_description:
Job purpose:

The role is responsible for providing advanced technical expertise in the area of data analytics and analytics. This will include delivering results from a wide range of data sources, including event logs, information systems audit trail reports, application performance metrics and user behaviour analysis. The successful candidate should be able to demonstrate deep experience with various analytical techniques including advanced machine learning and predictive analytics as well as strong communication skills to facilitate business collaboration across departments. The ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously is also essential. In this role you will provide technical support on all levels within the Citrix Analytics Platforms suite which includes: Citrix Receiver/NPS (Centralized Threat Management), Citrix NetScaler Gateway/NAP (Network Access Protection) & Advanced Machine Learning Server


Requirements:

  • Prevent internal threats & data exfiltration attacks
  • Track & model individual User behaviors across enterprise
  • Identify and aggregate User Risky behaviors into Risk Profiles
  • Integrate All systems and build behavior rules
  • Setup triggers to trap fraudulent activity learned from modules and report
  • Protect Applications from external attacks
  • Track, access, and rank applications based on risks
  • Suggest mitigation steps to enhance security
  • Build applications usage profiling to create risk identifiers to trigger
  • Prevent internal threats & data exfiltration attacks
  • Track 'sensitive files' via DLP engines
  • Analyze data usage and behavior around data to enhance management of the data usage and to build triggers on strange behavior

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field required
  • 5 years of experience in software engineering, technical writing and/or system administration, with a strong background in data warehousing
  • A strong understanding of the Citrix platform is required
  • Experience in working with and/or designing complex applications and web services preferred

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for monitoring the operations of the Company systems, including quality and compliance and to propose improvements/upgrades/additions where applicable.

  • functions and processes.

Requirements:

  • 2 - 3 years Knowledge of various architecture frameworks including TOGAF and Zachman frameworks (TOGAF certification would be a distinct advantage)
  • 5+ years Demonstrable knowledge of Data Engineering Architecture and familiarity with various architecture viewpoints (business, applications, data, and technology architectures) is required.
  • 5+ years Proven experience creating data engineering solutions, building and maintaining reliable and scalable ETL on big data platforms as well as experience working with varied forms of data infrastructures
  • 5+ years Experience in working with Data Ops and/or Dev Ops Frameworks
  • 3+ years Knowledge of implementing future-fit Data Engineering technologies and capabilities such as APIs, API Portals, and Lakehouse architectures.
  • 5+ years Proven Experience in using scripting languages such as Python and SQL to create, manage, manipulate data pipelines and - sets
  • 3+ years Proven experience with data engineering in a cloud environment (AWS/Azure/Google) as well as on-premise.
  • 5+ years Experience in solution architectures, system analysis and design, data modeling and application development methodologies
  • 5+ years Experience with data profiling, data cleansing/quality, performance issues, reporting and data analysis
  • 5+ years Experience in database and data management (Data Replication, Backup and Recovery, DBMS Scaling techniques, SOA, ODS/OLTP vs Data Warehouse/OLAP/VLDB)
  • 5+ years Experience in various data modeling paradigms (dimensional, data vault, normalized, NoSQL)
  • 3+ years Experience in implementing and using EA tools and EA meta-model definition (ARIS Preferable/ or Sparx Enterprise Architect)
  • 2+ years Retail industry experience with an understanding of retail business processes and the information and data requirements of these processes.

KPAs:

  • Define and continuously improve the data engineering architecture framework and modeling standards
  • Define and create solution level data engineering architecture models that enable specific BI and analytics requirements.
  • Provide expert data engineering guidance, ensure solution architectures and designs are in line with the data engineering technology standards and conduct architecture and design reviews as part of the Architecture Review Committee.

Please note that prospective employees will be subject to security vetting. Should you not hear from us within 10 working days, please consider your application as unsuccessful.

FICO (NYSE: FICO) is a leading global analytics software company, helping businesses in 90+ countries make better decisions. Join our world-class team today and fulfill your career potential!
The Opportunity
"The Solution Success Manager role provides an opportunity to develop long term relationships with FICO customers in South Africa. You will become an expert in FICO’s Customer Communication Services (CCS) platform whilst providing industry and solution best practices, innovation, and strategy optimization advice to a portfolio of key accounts." - Senior Director, Solution Success
What You’ll Contribute
  • Manage relationships across various customer teams, brands, and/or departments to further strengthen FICO’s partnership
  • Engage regularly with customers via strategic business and account reviews to evaluate needs and strategic direction
  • Be an expert on the customer’s FICO CCS deployment and the go-to person for their strategic business direction
  • Identify and grow opportunities within your customer base and collaborate with the sales teams to ensure growth attainment
  • Continually assess, document, and analyze customer progress toward stated goals and results, educating customers on the value they generate with their FICO CCS solution
  • Ensure customers employ best practices and their FICO solution is optimized for maximum value
  • Ensure any account issues are resolved quickly, leveraging resources from across the company as needed
  • Drive insights between product management and the customer with a focus on communicating the FICO CCS Roadmap and how the roadmap will benefit customer activities
  • Develop success plans for customers that outline their critical success factors, metrics for success, potential issues and provide recommendations
  • Monitor and facilitate the customer’s adoption of our solution features and functionality, and provides the FICO team with an understanding of their overall business needs as they relate to our products
  • Partner with Professional Services to prioritize project delivery and maintain project workblocks
  • Facilitate change through the CCS Portal and empower our customers to self-serve
  • Establish a trusted adviser relationship that works to ensure customer’s overall satisfaction with our products and solutions
  • Serve as an escalation point when needed to facilitate the resolution of unexpected issues, connecting customers with the right resources for assistance, and working with our helpdesk team to provide the appropriate business and technical context to ensure resolution
  • Demonstrate competency in broader FICO product suites
What We’re Seeking
  • Relevant experience in a Customer Success role or a customer facing services role
  • Experience working with SaaS technology
  • Experience working with clients in financial services or with Telcos or Utilities is an advantage
  • Experience working with clients in Fraud or Collections is an advantage
  • Proven track record of building management and senior management relationships
  • Willingness and ability to travel 25 – 50%
Our Offer to You
  • A culture and work environment strongly reflecting our core values: Act Like an Owner, Delight Our Customers and Earn the Respect of Others.
  • The opportunity to make a difference by leveraging your unique strengths.
  • Highly competitive compensation and rewards.
  • Flexible work options, opportunities to give back to your community, social events with colleagues and a comprehensive benefits program inclusive of progressive parental leave.
#LI-DL1
Why Make a Move to FICO?
At FICO, you can develop your career with a leading organization in one of the fastest-growing fields in technology today – Big Data analytics. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive and prescriptive modeling, and much more.
FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide:
  • Credit Scoring — 150+ billion FICO Scores have been sold to date, making it the most used credit score in the world.
  • Fraud Detection and Security — 2.6+ billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems.
  • Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score.
  • Anti-Money Laundering — our solutions check more than half a billion transactions a day to prevent criminal schemes such as terrorist financing
Global trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We support many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success.
Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks!
Learn more about how you can fulfill your potential at
www.fico.com/Careers
FICO promotes a culture of inclusion and seeks to attract a diverse set of candidates for each job opportunity. We are an equal employment opportunity employer and we’re proud to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all candidates without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Research has shown that women and candidates from underrepresented communities may not apply for an opportunity if they don’t meet all stated qualifications. While our qualifications are clearly related to role success, each candidate’s profile is unique and strengths in certain skill and/or experience areas can be equally effective. If you believe you have many, but not necessarily all, of the stated qualifications we encourage you to apply.

We have more than 70 Mobile app developers across South Africa and working remotely in locations across the globe creating mobile app solutions as part of medium to large scale mobile and web projects for clients globally. Many of these solutions are high-profile consumer apps.


Our mobile app developers work with a range of technologies such as native iOS development using Swift, SwiftUI, XCode, Combine, etc., native Android development using Kotlin, Jetpack Compose, Android Studio, Java, etc. and Cross-platform development using Flutter, Xamarin, React Native and more.


Our mobile app development team includes intermediate to senior app developers as well as some of the best application architects around. In addition we hire a number of graduates each year who join DVT’s software developer graduate programme.


We have both Native and Cross-platform Mobile opportunities available.


We are a Microsoft Gold Partner.


Opportunity to work on high-profile consumer apps with up to a million users.


Grow your career - as you grow in seniority, become a Mobile Team Lead or Solutions Architect.


Create work that you can be proud of, working with DVT’s team of designers, BA’s, Scrum Masters and QA professionals to create polished, slick mobile apps.


Work is more than just work. Have fun with co-workers at our BrightSparx events and interact with DVTers outside of your team.


If you love creating mobile apps, are keen to continue learning and want to be challenged, we have a spot for you!



Starting out as custom business software developers in Cape Town in 1999, we’ve grown to become a international software development company that assists clients with digital transformation across many industries. We have offices in South Africa, the UK and the Netherlands and clients globally.


DVT’s aim is to be the favourite custom software solutions and services company. The favourite amongst our clients and the favourite amongst our staff – past, present and future.


Our services include custom software development for mobile, Web and traditional platforms, UX/UI design, cloud application services, BI and data analytics solutions, robotic process automation (RPA), project management, business analysis, DevOps and Agile consulting.


The DVT Academy, the company’s training division, provides agile related training courses, international agile certifications, a UX fundamentals course and soft-skills workshops and coaching.


DVT has grown to over 600 staff and is a company within the software and technology group Dynamic Technologies where skills development and training form an integral part of the group.



We are known for our people centric approach, unwavering business integrity and working in an Agile approach with high quality always top of mind.


At DVT we live by a set of values. Our values say who we are. They guide us in making a positive impact with our clients, business partners, the communities we operate in and amongst ourselves.

Introduction
A Technology Sales Specialist role (what we internally call a, 'Brand Sales Specialist') within IBM Security means providing industry-leading solutions to help our clients face into the challenges of cloud security, advanced threats, compliance and privacy, and mobile and remote security. It also ensures you're continuously developing – personally and professionally – to stay at the forefront of industry trends, and remaining as the trusted advisor our clients' success depend on.

Excellent onboarding and an industry leading learning culture will set you up for positive impact and success, whilst ongoing development will advance your career through an upward trajectory. Our sales environment is collaborative and experiential. Part of a team, you'll be surrounded by bright minds and keen co-creators – always willing to help and be helped – as you apply passion to work that will compel our clients to invest in IBM's products and services.

Your Role and Responsibilities


As a Brand Sales Specialist you'll work closely with clients to develop relationships, understand their needs, earn their trust and show them how IBM's industry leading solutions will solve their problems whilst delivering value to their business.

We're passionate about success. If this role is right for you, then your achievements will mean that your career is flourishing and our clients are thriving. To help ensure this win-win outcome, a 'day-in-the life' of this role may include, but not be limited to…

  • Managing a dedicated client set and defining, confirming, and communicating the differentiated value of IBM's technology at both the technical and business level.
  • Using your solution-selling expertise you'll be identifying and engaging decision makers and influencers, qualifying business opportunities, and responding to clients' needs to create strategic, long-term partnerships.
  • Managing the entire sales process, from RFI / RFP response preparation, and ensuring delivery against KPIs, with a strong emphasis on new business sales, while expanding existing accounts.
  • Collaborating with the broader IBM sales ecosystem, from Marketing to Sales and technical colleagues, to IBM Business Partners, to build sales campaigns and incremental pipeline.




Required Technical and Professional Expertise


  • Proven track record of success in technology sales, with emphasis on new client acquisition.

  • Demonstrable application of business and commercial acumen, communicated at all levels, to show the operational impact and financial value of technological solutions.

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills that are equally engaging, compelling and influential.


Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
  • Depth and breadth of knowledge regarding the Data & AI market in order to consult and advise, and quickly grow your reputation as your clients' credible, trusted advisor. (Training on IBM's Security offerings is provided)

About Business Unit
When it comes to data management and analysis, our prospective clients have massive challenges. IBM's Data & AI products solve them.

With data spread across multiple clouds in different formats it's difficult for our clients to achieve their AI-driven analytic ambitions.

IBM's industry-leading data fabric solution solves this by presenting a 'single pane of glass' view, and a set of integrated tools for business analysts, data scientists, and data engineers to consistently deliver strategy shaping insights. Quickly and consistently.

Join us and help continually introduce new clients to trail-blazing Data & AI solutions their enterprises desperately need, now and for the foreseeable future.

Your Life @ IBM
In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.

Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.

Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.

Are you ready to be an IBMer?


About IBM
Every company needs help to secure critical business capabilities against a backdrop of ransomware, advanced threats, compliance and privacy, mobile and remote workforces.

A sales career in IBM Security means contributing to, and benefiting from the success of a global network of 5,500+ security experts in 130 countries. It means ensuring our clients are at the cutting-edge of advancements to 9 global security centres that monitor 70B+ security events per day.

Location Statement

Being You @ IBM

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. SAP Authorizations Consultant

Join our client’s dynamic team as an SAP Authorizations Consultant and play a crucial role in ensuring the seamless functioning of SAP modules within their global organisation. If you possess extensive experience in SAP Authorizations, thrive on solving complex problems, and are passionate about optimising business processes, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:

  • Understand business requirements, prepare AS-IS and TO-BE documents, and obtain sign-off from users for functional and/or technical design documents.
  • Proactively propose solutions to enhance the support of new and existing business processes.
  • Configure and execute necessary changes to meet business requirements.
  • Collaborate with consultants from other modules to address integration requirements.
  • Prepare test data and documentation, conduct unit tests, regression tests, and system integration security tests, and manage change activities.

Requirements:

  • SAP Authorization Certification
  • Minimum of 8 years of experience in SAP Authorizations
  • Strong analytic skills to analyse and solve SAP Module issues

Jun 6, 2023 | BI Analyst, Data Analytics, Information Technology (IT)

Job Role

  • Responsible for sourcing, validating and transforming Data from various sources across the business into the desired data model formats.
  • A can-do attitude and a desire to learn a variety of data tools, analysis methods and turning data into actionable insights with demonstrable business impact.
  • assist in specifying complex business rules using the specified toolsets to create complex analytical models. The successful candidate is someone that understands and continuously seeks to build knowledge of data and information.
  • Analyze data models and test the outputs, investigate & troubleshoot data issues and devise solutions in line with best practice.
  • Must be able to communicate business information to Technical teams, as well as be competent in communicating challenges and solutions to the team.
  • An understanding of data management solutions and a keen sense of the strategic value of information.
  • Responsible for the end-to-end tasks within the data analysis framework working with business representatives, product owners, etc. to define and elicit requirements, draft specifications, analyse data and create reports/dashboards.

Data Preparation

  • Acquire data from various data sources and combine & transform data into interpretable datasets, reports or dashboards.
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
  • Extend the company’s data with third party sources of information when required.
  • Process, cleanse and verify the integrity of data used for analysis.
  • Perform data profiling of data contained in source systems.
  • Provide detailed analysis of all data implemented into the database.
  • Provide the data mapping and associated transformation rules for each data item.
  • Ensure that the business requirements and subsequent development activities are supported by accurate information.
  • Engage with a wide range of Technical stakeholders including data scientists, business analysts, other data engineers and solutions architects.
  • Work with data engineers and other stakeholders to understand the dynamic nature that is required to support the solution that needs to be built.

Analytics

  • Interpret data, analyze results using analytical techniques to develop Analytical Cubes, and reports.
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
  • Work with Product Owners and use data to answer key questions about the business.
  • Own and maintain dashboards, ongoing reporting, and ad hoc requests from the organization.
  • Support and maintain the project data models at multiple levels of detail and functionality (conceptual, logical, normalised, relational, dimensional, application level, subject-level, integrated, etc.).
  • Assist Data Modelers to draw up detailed data models.

Stakeholder Engagement

  • Work directly with management and other business users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships.
  • Present information using data visualisation techniques.
  • Facilitate requirements gathering workshops with the business.
  • Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to analyze information needs, functional requirements and business processes.

Coaching/Mentorship

  • Provide problem solving assistance to other team members.
  • Knowledge sharing related to business and project experience.

Requirements

Qualifications

  • Diploma/Bachelor Degree (Information Systems; Statistics; Data or Computer Science; Engineering) or equivalent (preferred but not essential)

Experience

  • 3-4 years experience performing Business and Data analysis.
  • Functional experience in Analytics, Data Visualisation or Reporting.
  • Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages.
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings for stakeholder use.
  • Experience working with data in various data sources and databases.
  • Ability to translate business requirements into Technical and non-technical terms.
  • Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases with proven SQL skills.
  • Ability to comply to and manage data assets under strict governance framework.
  • Experience in Agile development desired.
  • Business experience in Financial services and/or Asset management would be advantageous.
  • Ability to work with data profiling, data quality and reference data toolsets advantageous.

Skills

  • Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical terms.
  • Strong analytical-thinking and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information.
  • Attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Data Modeling skills required.

Competencies

  • Decision Quality
  • Effective communication.
  • Ensures Accountability
  • Business Insight: Applying knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization’s goals.
  • Balances Stakeholders: Anticipating and balancing the needs of multiple stakeholders.
  • Manages Ambiguity: Operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear.

What you need to be successful

As an Online Conversion Specialist for the online casino, you will be responsible for maximizing player conversions and revenue generation through strategic optimization of our website, promotional campaigns, and user journeys. Working closely with the marketing, design, and product teams, you will utilize your expertise in conversion rate optimization (CRO), A/B testing, and data analysis to enhance user experience, boost player acquisition, and optimize revenue streams.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field
  • Proven experience in conversion rate optimization, preferably within the online casino or online gambling industry
  • Strong analytical skills with proficiency in web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics) and A/B testing platforms
  • In-depth knowledge of CRO principles, methodologies, and best practices specific to online casinos
  • Familiarity with website optimization techniques, including UX/UI design, landing page optimization, and player journey mapping
  • Proficient in data analysis and reporting, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
  • Detail-oriented and highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously
  • Creative problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues
  • Familiarity with online casino games and the online gambling industry is a plus

Responsibilities:

  • Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) for Casino Games
    • Develop and execute CRO strategies to improve the conversion rates of the following key customer acquisition journeys:
      • Website visit to successful player Registration
      • Registered player to FTD (First Time Depositor)
      • FTD to Multi-Active player (ie driving the player to make multiple deposits)
    • Further test and refine the above player journeys to improve the conversion rates
    • Analyze player behaviour and website performance to identify areas for improvement and prioritize optimization efforts
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement A/B and multivariate testing to evaluate the effectiveness of game elements and user flows
  • Landing Page and Website Optimization:
    • Conduct comprehensive audits of our website, landing pages, and registration processes to identify and resolve any issues that may hinder conversion rates
    • Through collaboration with key stakeholders (including designers and campaign managers), optimise the website layouts, navigation, content, and calls-to-action to improve player engagement, drive conversions and enhance the overall player experience.
  • Performance Tracking and Reporting:
    • Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) specific to the online casino industry, such as player acquisition, player retention, lifetime value, conversion rates, and average revenue per user.
    • Utilize web analytics tools and other relevant software to measure and track the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and conversion optimization efforts
  • Promotional Campaign Optimization:
    • Collaborate with the marketing team to optimize promotional campaigns, including welcome bonuses, free spins, loyalty programs, and other player acquisition and retention initiatives
    • Analyze campaign performance data to identify opportunities for improvement and develop strategies to maximize conversions and revenue
  • Industry Research and Best Practices:
    • Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in online casino conversion optimization
    • Conduct research and competitive analysis to identify new opportunities and areas for improvement to maintain a competitive edge in the online gambling market

display_title: Integrated Digital Paid Media Specialist: Online Betting & Gaming
job_description:
Previously disadvantaged candidates will be given preference.

We have an absolutely terrific in-house opportunity for a Mid-weight Integrated Digital Paid Media Specialist at one of South Africa’s most renowned online betting and gaming platforms based in Cape Town.

The Integrated Digital Paid Media Specialist will be responsible for the delivery of the integrated Digital Paid Media plan (including Paid Search, GDN, Paid Social Media, Native and programmatic platforms) for the brand, with the aim of driving business acquisition into new and existing markets. These plans will include the alignment of Digital strategies, (such as SEO, Content and overall Digital Paid Media integration) with the main Digital Strategy.

The successful candidate will also be responsible for using insights and customer intelligence to deliver end-to-end (plan, test, execute, measure, and refine) programmes and results, and manage tactical campaign deliverables. The role reports in to the CMO and works closely with the Marketing and Creative teams. Externally you will manage Paid partners (e.g., Google, Facebook, Sports Radar etc.), agencies and freelancers for production.

This is such an exciting opportunity, don’t miss it!

Responsibilities

General

  • Be a subject matter expert on Digital Paid Media platforms (including Paid Search, GDN, Paid Social Media, Native and potentially programmatic platforms) and how these can be used to leverage growth in online reputation and business growth
  • Understand the integrated Digital strategy and individual digital plans (SEO, Content, etc.) and devise an integrated implementation plan for digital paid media across digital assets and platforms
  • Understand and interpret the results of Social Reporting, Google Reporting and Revenue Reporting, in order to draw meaningful conclusions from data reports and translate them into a recommendation for future campaigns
  • Identify target audiences and analyse their characteristics, behaviour and media habits
  • Develops paid multi-channel initiatives and builds upon current client strategies within the digital arena to meet/exceed objectives
  • Make recommendations to various stakeholders of new initiatives and opportunities
  • Communicate and raise awareness with relevant stakeholders with regards the Digital Paid Media framework and how it can be utilised
  • Builds strong, trusting relationships with clients and agency partners, and collaborate on conceptualisation, planning and implementation for paid campaigns
  • Monitors paid media channels to ensure that the delivery and objectives are rolled out as per plan
  • Track and quality assure proofs on paid media interactions, creative products, and delivery to ensure cost effective and impactful solutions
  • Monitor consistent and accurate messaging across channels
  • Analyse and report on the effectiveness of paid media campaigns, facilitating any amendments where required
  • Write communications briefs, ensuring that creative and media are effectively integrated
  • Facilitate project meetings for the implementation and delivery of campaign and / or event plans through specific initiatives to meet the objectives of the events and / or campaigns.
  • Manage key stake-holder expectations, escalating risks before they become problems
  • Report on completed projects, costings, and progress against deadlines
  • Perform data analysis of paid activity on a monthly basis
  • Regular reviews of performance within Google analytics
  • Monitor and evaluate campaign performance in order to optimise future campaigns
  • Work with marketing teams to drive content creation for paid media channels.

Know How

  • Knowledge and expertise in Paid Media Digital Marketing practices and technology concepts and principles
  • Short term planning (within 12 months) involves conducting the planning of activities to meet and optimise new business targets and growth
  • Organise, plan, and prioritise tasks for self to ensure that work gets done profitably and efficiently
  • Represent the company/brand to internal and external stakeholders, interacting with stakeholders – influencing, motivating and encouraging specific behaviour.

Problem Solving

  • Apply business acumen and sound common sense to the management of paid media marketing within regulated standards
  • Applies judgement and adapts solutions through analytical, interpretative, evaluative, and innovative thinking
  • Monitor changes in the digital environment and is quick to act upon potential opportunities, risks, and challenges
  • Consider all the facts, options, and possible objectives prior to making decisions
  • Analyse and diagnose channel performance issues in order to maximise or leverage the strengths of the team in a competitive environment
  • Deal with diverse problems in your own area, using judgment and discretion to resolve them.

Accountability

  • Provide information and make recommendations regarding products, channels and services that will meet operational requirements
  • Solve a wide range of queries dealing with these sensitively and within operational/procedural limitations
  • Solutions should be profitable and effective in delivery business results
  • There are guidelines/ policies and procedures in place to be followed, but the incumbent needs to constantly consider ways of improving productivity and profitability.

Requirements

The successful candidate must have/be:

  • 3 Year Bachelor’s Degree / NQF Level 7 in Marketing, Communication, or Journalism
  • GAIQ certification (Google Analytics Certification) – is an advantage
  • 5 years successful experience in Paid Digital Media planning and campaign management
  • Experience demonstrating creativity from an ‘ideas’ perspective, an eye for design and an understanding of the power of storytelling to better understand, engage with and motivate consumers
  • Knowledge of the company’s products and the sports betting context (advantageous)
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficiency in the use of Google Analytics and Google AdWords and Facebook
  • Experience with other paid platforms e.g., Programmatic, Native and other paid social e.g., Twitter, Reddit, TikTok etc (advantageous)
  • Digital Marketing skills and experience
  • Project management skills and experience
  • Media planning & buying (advantageous)
  • Experience with all Social Media platforms (including how to use these to effectively support paid media)
  • Copywriting and editing abilities
  • Social, Google & Revenue Reporting skills
  • Business & financial acumen
  • Knowledge of GTM (Google Tag Manager), pixel set ups etc (advantageous)
  • Analysing skills
  • Able to create and improve
  • Sources information
  • Applies expertise and technology
  • Takes ownership
  • Responds with urgency
  • Collaborative
  • Able to travel to all units required on a regular basis
  • May be required to work outside of normal working hours, in line with operational requirements (including weekends, public holidays).

IT System Administrator (Linux)

IT – Support
Cape Town – Western Cape

ENVIRONMENT:
A fast-paced IT Solutions Provider seeks a highly skilled IT System Administrator to work in conjunction with the IT Manager to identify, plan and execute projects involving the server and networking infrastructure in the business. You will also participate in the configuration, training and management of the Zoho suite of business applications (CRM, HelpDesk, Reporting Analytics, etc.). The ideal candidate must have a proven 3–5 years of experience as a in a similar role with a strong background in Linux/UNIX Administration, AWS, RADIUS AAA, Windows Administration including Domain Administration, Networks (LAN, WAN, NAT, VLANS, Tunnels), working knowledge of administrating of Type 1 Hypervisors and related virtualization & a complete understanding of SMTP and email best practices.
DUTIES:
General Objectives for position –
  • Install new or rebuild existing servers and configure hardware, peripherals, services, settings, directories, storage, etc. in accordance with standards and project/operational requirements.
  • Develop and maintain installation and configuration procedures.
  • Contribute to and maintain system standards.
  • Research, recommend and develop innovative, automated approaches for system administration tasks.
  • Research and recommend best practices to mitigate all technical risk areas to the business (including but not limited to appropriate DR and BC plans, systems and procedures).
  • Always ensure practical but highest levels of technical security for the group.
  • Actively identify approaches that leverage our resources and provide economies of scale.
  • Actively look for more cost-effective tech options that do not compromise on quality or security.
Operations and Support –
  • Maintain shared physical Group facilities: Network, and when necessary, Meeting Rooms and Power-distribution.
  • Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs.
  • Perform regular backup operations and implement appropriate processes for data protection, disaster recovery, and failover procedures.
  • Perform regular security monitoring to identify any possible intrusions.
  • Perform regular file archival and purge as necessary.
  • Assist, when necessary, with creating, changing, and deleting user accounts per operational requirements.
  • Assist, when necessary, with administering third-party cloud services, maintaining user access and permissions.
  • Provide Tier III (OR VIP) support per request from various constituencies. Investigate and troubleshoot issues.
  • Troubleshoot hardware and software errors by running diagnostics, documenting problems and resolutions, prioritizing problems, and assessing impact of issues.
  • Configure outbound and inbound firewall rules.
  • Configure switches, APs, and VLANs for internal and external routing.
  • Develop expertise to train colleagues on new technologies.
  • Create and/or maintain technical documentation, manuals and IT policies.
  • Assist, when necessary, Internal IT with training and knowledge sharing, as well as making sure all desktop applications, workstations, and related equipment problems are resolved in a timely manner with limited disruptions.
  • Develop and integrate automation processes.
Maintenance –
  • Apply OS patches and upgrades on a regular basis and upgrade administrative tools and utilities.

Job Purpose

To provide specialist Human Resources support to stakeholders by facilitating and integrating alignment to Company Human Resources processes and practices across the Human Resources value chain to optimist Human Capital.

Job Responsibilities

  • Address business needs regarding Human Resources (HR) policies, normal and annual processes and procedures.
  • Deliver on agreed targets, due dates and within Service level agreements, by engaging stakeholders and giving them regular feedback.
  • Comply with standards by ensuring personal adherence to all relevant policies and procedures.
  • Monitor stakeholder compliance to HR policies and compliance..
  • Co-ordinate and deliver processes across the HR value chain within Service Level Agreement (SLA) by applying effective use of resources and adhering to policy and processes.
  • Deliver agreed business results by using resources effectively.
  • Meet technical, company and practical standards by adhering to internal processes, policies and procedures.
  • Implement changes and seek opportunities to improve HR Business processes across the HR value chain
  • Support business efforts in achieving transformation goals by ensuring that own and stakeholders HR business processes are adhered too.
  • Establish a culture conducive to diversity by participating in transformation surveys and processes.
  • Add value to the Company by implementing innovative HR ideas & solutions.
  • Meet and understand stakeholders needs regarding staffing solutions by communicating and conducting analysis.
  • Create synergy and ensure business needs are met by building and maintaining relationships with stakeholders.
  • Build and maintain internal & external vendor & supplier relationships through engagement.
  • Understand and support the Companies values in all business processes.
  • Improve personal capability & professional growth by keeping abreast of legislative and other industry changes.
  • Achieve team goals and success through own contribution and participation.
  • Ensure that the right HR information is provided to stakeholders in the right way and at the right time through stakeholder engagement, meetings and feedback sessions.

Who we are:
Mama Money is a growth stage fintech startup working to help migrant workers in South Africa send money home. Since 2015 we have been providing reliable remittances, at a socially fair price, to those that need it most.

Mama HQ is in beautiful Cape Town, South Africa. We are 122 people strong (and counting) from 19 countries across Africa, Asia, the UK, and Europe. Our culture is built around the well-being of our team members and making a difference in our communities. “Just be lekker!” personifies our approach to work: we trust the wisdom of our talented and diverse team to do what is best for our customers and get the job done responsibly, without pedantic policies.

We’ve been around since 2015 and have earned a few accolades along the way, made some new friends, and expanded our reach. We've had some great times and some tough times, but we continue to focus on helping people rather than maximizing profit.

In this role, the PPC specialist will play a key role in driving Mama Money's digital marketing efforts and growth.

As our Senior PPC Specialist, you will:

    • Develop and implement comprehensive paid search strategies to support our growth goals, focused on maximizing ROI.
    • Manage and optimize PPC campaigns across multiple search engines, including Google Ads, Meta Ads, Twitter Ads, Apple Search Ads, and others.
    • Conduct keyword research, ad copywriting, and campaign structuring to improve campaign performance.
    • Monitor and analyze campaign performance using data analytics tools, providing insights and recommendations for ongoing improvements.
    • Stay up to date with the latest PPC trends, tools, technologies, and best practices to ensure our campaigns are ahead of the curve.
    • Implement, monitor and optimise all digital paid media campaigns
    • Support with lead management deriving from paid digital campaigns.

In your first 90 days at Mama Money, you will:

    • Conduct a thorough audit of our existing PPC campaigns, identifying areas for improvement and implementing changes to optimize performance.
    • Getting to know the product, customer UX and pain points.
    • Develop a new PPC campaign structure and strategy to support our growth goals, focused on driving new user acquisition and increasing conversion rates.
    • Collaborate closely with an external agency to understand the campaign strategy and structure.

About you:

    • 5+ years of experience managing paid search campaigns, with a proven track record of driving performance and ROI.
    • Expertise in managing campaigns across Google Ads, Meta Ads, Apple Search Ads, and other platforms.
    • Strong analytical skills, with experience using data to inform campaign decisions and measure success.
    • Experience using the Google suite of digital marketing services such as Tag Manager, Google Analytics, and Google Search Console.
    • Understanding of how to implement Facebook Pixel
    • Experience using tools such as SEMRush or SimilarWeb for competitor analysis, keyword research, traffic analysis, and backlink strategy to inform overall digital marketing tactics.
    • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
    • You have experience using MMP tools such as Adjust.
    • You have experience using BI tools such as Tableau.
    • You are very hands-on and implementation orientated with an organised and structured approach to the execution of campaigns.

It would be a bonus if:

    • You have worked in a similar type of company or industry (B2C), such as a fintech, FMCG or retail, telecommunications, or financial services.
    • You have basic SQL knowledge and have the ability to extract and query databases in order to build audiences for precise targeting.
    • Strong content writing skills and understanding of localising content for a diverse customer base with multiple nationalities. Assistance will be provided from the broader who have a deep understanding of our different customer segments from a cultural perspective.

Some of the people you’ll work closely with are:

    • Marketing Manager (direct report)
    • Head of Growth
    • Marketing Operations Manager
    • Sales team and regional managers.
    • Internal and external designers to create compelling content for paid media and PPC ads
Why Mama:
At Mama Money, the customers & communities we serve are at the heart of all that we do.

We bring our authentic selves to work where we are free to express our diverse identities while staying true to what we believe in and how we feel. Part of that means being able to have difficult conversations when necessary but always remembering to do so with trust, respect, and a positive mindset. Being open to receiving feedback and understanding how this helps us evolve and grow is essential to succeeding in our environment.

We are responsible for ourselves, our behaviour, our delivery, and our output. Although we always aim to move things forward and get $hit done, we start small - taking it step by step and always looking for ways in which we can improve. We know from experience that when we work together towards a common goal, we can achieve anything.

Mama Money is a special place because we care. We care about our customers, we care about the people who work for us and we care about the impact our work has on the world. There are things that we don’t care about too. Things like bureaucracy, discrimination, ego, titles, and silos. We’re a friendly bunch who don’t take ourselves too seriously but we do take our work, and our customers’ hard-earned money, very seriously.

Mama’s values:
1. Customer & Community
2. Authentic
3. Positive Mindset
4. Responsible
5. Togetherness

  • Full proficiency in Microsoft products (Office 365)
  • Knowledge of Business Intelligence visualisation practices.
  • Experience in creating visualisations in Power BI.

Skills required:

  • Managing multiple tasks/projects
  • Managing external parties and stakeholders
  • Time management skills
  • Problem solving
  • Analytical skills
  • Detail orientated
  • Work independently and in a team environment
  • Interpretation of business analytical needs into specification documents
  • Ability to interpret business data and propose actions.
  • To be able to identify trends in data
  • To be able to compile visualizations and reports that can reflect relevant business KPI’s.
  • To be able to incorporate external data/events with internal data to arrive at conclusions
  • To be able to communicate across all functional areas and hierarchical layers.
  • Customer and service orientation.

Role Purpose:

As a Business Analyst, you will be working with the Head of Finance to support day-to-day business operations. You’ll be responsible for providing analysis and reporting services in order to make informed decisions on matters such as pricing and inventory management. You will provide detailed reports, graphs and data visualizations which can help inform the strategic direction of our business. Your work may include performing research into new products or markets; analyzing financial transactions including sales forecasting; developing models that simulate potential future scenarios; writing policies and procedures related to these processes within an IT environment.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related field required.
  • 5 years of experience in the stock/inventory control department
  • 5 years’ experience as a BA
  • Experience with warehouse and distribution centers preferred.
  • Stock price and technical analysis concepts, such as trending, momentum, and volume might be addition.
  • Experience in an information technology field, such as database administration and/or software engineering
  • Ability to use Excel for data entry/analysis.
  • Stock / Inventory experience
  • Preferably a Senior BA, but a high-end Intermediate might work.
  • Preferably to have D365 experience but not essential
  • Good Test Analyst with Stock / Inventory experience could also fit this role.

Requirements

  • Responsible for applying a set of tasks and techniques used to work as a liaison amongst stakeholders to understand the problems; opportunities; needs; structure; policies and operations of the organisation on medium to large projects / medium risk.
  • Recommend solutions that enable the organisation to achieve its goals and to elicit and analyses the actual needs of the stakeholders; facilitate communication between organizational units and play a central role in aligning the needs of business units with the capabilities delivered by information technology and may serve as a translator between these groups.
  • Develops complex solutions by combining organizational solutions with computer science, data management, and business process principles.
  • Supports analysis, planning and execution of IT projects with budget and schedule requirements.
  • Documents business processes, operational standards, and technical solutions with proper documentation
  • Utilizes expertise in a variety of analytic skills (queries, sets, aggregations, statistical techniques, and visualization) to develop custom solutions.
  • Business Analyst
  • Works with teams to create documentation to support and improve technology.
  • Performs financial analysis activities to improve operations/IT efficiency.
  • Develops documentation on customer and company stock information systems design specifications.

We are a growing team of passionate data and analytics professionals working at DVT in Pretoria, Johannesburg, Cape Town and Durban, focussed on building business value for our customers. Our consulting and project engagements, both locally and internationally, range across a wide variety of sectors including manufacturing, retail, marketing and financial services, providing challenging diversity of experience to our consultants.


Our team includes junior, intermediate and senior consultants and developers as well as some of the best analytics strategists. If you are passionate about the power of data and analytics, Big Data, machine learning or data science we’re looking for you! Apply now.


We offer the opportunity for you to work in Agile teams on high-profile customer engagements where information is used to craft digital business. Work on solutions to take our enterprise customers on an analytics maturity journey, ranging from formulating foundational data capability, information connectivity to leveraging high order analytics in a dynamic fashion.


The skills we are seeking from applicants and developing in our team members include:


  • Microsoft SSIS, SSAS (Multidimensional and Tabular), SSRS
  • Microsoft PowerBI
  • Powershell
  • Azure SQL DB, Azure Datawarehouse, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, Revolution R, HD Insights, Polybase
  • Apache projects including SQOOP, HADOOP, HIVE, MAHOUT, SPARK
  • Google Data Studio, Big Query
  • Business consulting leveraging analytics



Your skills will deepen as you work on our high-profile engagements enabling Digital Business. DVT Data and Analytics is where you can grow your career in data science - as you grow in seniority, become a Senior Data and Analytics Consultant or Analytics Solutions Specialist.


Work with customers to enable solutions that transform business.


If you “get” the power of data and analytics in modern business and want to be one of our guru’s helping customers realize true digital capability, we want to talk to you about joining our team.



Starting out as custom business software developers in Cape Town in 1999, we’ve grown to become a international software development company that assists clients with digital transformation across many industries. We have offices in South Africa, the UK and the Netherlands and clients globally.


DVT’s aim is to be the favourite custom software solutions and services company. The favourite amongst our clients and the favourite amongst our staff – past, present and future.


Our services include custom software development for mobile, Web and traditional platforms, UX/UI design, cloud application services, BI and data analytics solutions, robotic process automation (RPA), project management, business analysis, DevOps and Agile consulting.


The DVT Academy, the company’s training division, provides agile related training courses, international agile certifications, a UX fundamentals course and soft-skills workshops and coaching.


DVT has grown to over 600 staff and is a company within the software and technology group Dynamic Technologies where skills development and training form an integral part of the group.



We are known for our people centric approach, unwavering business integrity and working in an Agile approach with high quality always top of mind.


At DVT we live by a set of values. Our values say who we are. They guide us in making a positive impact with our clients, business partners, the communities we operate in and amongst ourselves.

About Us

TMF Group is a leading provider of critical administrative services, helping clients invest and operate safely around the world. Our 10,00 experts and 120 offices in 85 jurisdictions worldwide serve corporates, financial institutions, asset managers, private clients, and family offices, providing the combination of accounting, tax, payroll, fund administration, compliance, and entity management services essential to global business success.


Key Responsibilities

  • Deliver written content and manage projects while juggling multiple tasks.
  • Research, create and own key campaign pieces that delivers across multiple channels, in line with marketing and communication strategies.
  • Strong interviewing skills to capture insight from subject matter experts globally and turn them into engaging pieces of marketing content
  • Write copy for multiple content types, adhering to TMF Group house style.

  • Help create a dynamic data-driven content schedule that supports marketing and communications across multiple levels.

What is in it for you?

Job Overview

Information Management Specialist (Financial Services)


This position is limited to BBBEE candidates, due to BEE requirements.


Location: Hybrid / Pretoria, Gauteng


Position Overview:

A leading top tier financial services group has an exciting new opportunity available for an experienced Information Management Specialist.


The main purpose of this position is to manage information management capabilities in order to provide an integrated view of the information management landscape. One will be tasked to improve the information management maturity levels within the firm (i.e., the firm and its subsidiaries), and to support reliable and effective decision-making.


Key responsibilities include:

  • Support the business in the implementation of the various data management disciplines.
  • Provide a consolidated and integrated view of the information landscape.
  • Provide input into how data is stored, maintained, and used in the database management implementation process.
  • Provide periodic reports, including technical reports, as well as information management reports.
  • Develop and manage stakeholder relations

To be considered for this position, one must have:

  • A completed Bachelor’s degree (NQF 7) in Informatics, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or an equivalent qualification.
  • A minimum of 5 to 8 years’ experience in the field of Data Management.
  • An Honour’s or Master’s degree in Economics, Finance an equivalent combination of education and job-related experience will be preferred.
  • Extensive knowledge of best practices/methodologies in Data Warehousing and Multi-Dimensional Data Analytics (e.g., OLAP, such as ESSBASE or Microsoft analysis services), Systems Design and Management.
  • Extensive knowledge and skill of the most common RDBMS technologies – Oracle, IBM, SQL Server, and MySQL.
  • Experience and skill in deploying and managing Big Data Environments – Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL.
  • Knowledge of Database Querying Languages (e.g., SQL) and skill / Programming Languages (R and Python)
  • Experience and skill with development using a broad variety of Integration Techniques, patterns, tools, and methodologies / Data Management Disciplines.

If you meet all the requirements specified above, and interested to further the process, kindly send your detailed CV to Patricia Jacobs at patricia@prosourcing.co.za.
