display_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Data Science (MSc) Wits VIDA
job_description:
Main purpose of the job:

  • An urban Health and Demographic Surveillance System (HDSS) site was established in 2017 in Soweto, led by Wits VIDA Research Unit as part of the Child Health and Mortality Prevention Surveillance (CHAMPS) project
  • The incumbent will provide support to the HDSS program for VIDA, review and refine data collection tools, design, develop and maintain databases, perform logic-based data validation rules for quality assurance on data, timely reporting, and documentation

Location:

  • VIDA – Chris Hani Baragwanath Academic Hospital, Soweto, Johannesburg, Gauteng

Key performance areas:

Technical Data Management and Analytics

  • Contribute to refining, structuring, and development of HDSS data collection forms
  • Draw up the specifications for harmonized data sets to send out as requests to PO and participating HDSS sites
  • Automate repetitive manual processes through scripting and design models for data cleaning, validation, and reporting
  • Address complex data queries as soon as they are identified from the field
  • Facilitate access to routinely collected data as required by the organization
  • Document and ensure that the harmonized data and transformation procedures used to make the analytical data sets can be understood and used by the demographer and HDSS leadership
  • Create standardized datasets reports (views) ready for use in comparative round data analysis and provide routine and ad hoc HDSS data reports

Staff Management and Capacity Development

  • Contribute towards the development of team/company knowledge
  • Foster an environment that promotes talent recognition, development as well as agency and individual leadership; promote harmony, teamwork, and sharing of information
  • Mentor, coach and facilitate personal and professional staff development wherever possible
  • Manage staff effectively including performance, conduct, efficient working, processes, and corrective action as required

Customer Service

  • Communicate with donor representatives around compliance issues as and when required
  • Ensure all customer interaction (Both internal and external customers) is of the highest professional level, e.g., respond to emails/queries within two days
  • Build and maintain authentic relationships with all stakeholders ensuring that all interactions are professional
  • Effectively manage work processes to maintain high levels of productivity

Effective Self-Management and performance ownership

  • Take ownership and accountability for responsibility areas, demonstrate effective self-management, and demonstrate team and individual leadership and collaboration to support everyone’s combined and individual objectives
  • Follow through to ensure that quality and productivity standards of own work are consistently and accurately maintained
  • Take ownership of driving own career development by participating in ongoing training and development activities such as forums, conferences, policy setting, and workshops
  • Manage internal and external stakeholder expectations and communicate appropriately with initiatives and solutions
  • Support and drive the business's core values, maintain a positive attitude, and respond openly to feedback

Required minimum education and training:

  • At least a Master’s level qualification in Data Science / Statistics / Biostatistics / Epidemiology and/or any Data Analytics

Required minimum work experience:

  • 2 Years’ experience in data management and analysis working in a research environment

Desirable additional education, work experience, and personal abilities:

  • Experience in computer programming languages
  • Willing to learn in-house database platforms such as SQL, ODK, and REDcap
  • Experience developing databases and data curation
  • Proficiency in using a statistical software package such as STATA or R for the import, export, manipulation, and analysis of large datasets
  • Team player able to work in a high-performing collaborative environment, and support scientific investigations across disciplines
  • Ability to set priorities and work under pressure on a variety of tasks concurrently

TO APPLY:

  • Only if you do meet the minimum job requirements and experience as mentioned above, you may submit a detailed updated CV.
  • Please Apply Online.
  • Please take note that the applicants who do not adhere to the above criteria will not be considered for the respective position.
  • The closing date for all applications: 14 July 2023.
  • Note AJ Personnel is fully POPI compliant.
  • Note WHC, in accordance with their Employment Equity goals and plan, will give preference to suitable applicants from designated groups as defined in the Employment Equity Act 55 of 1998 and subsequent amendments thereto.

Please note:

  • AJ PERSONNEL is only responsible for the advertising of the advertisement on behalf of their client Wits Health Consortium.
  • Wits Health Consortium will only respond to shortlisted candidates.
  • Candidates who have not been contacted within two weeks of the closing date can consider their applications to be unsuccessful.

  • Networking

The main purpose of this position is to manage information management capabilities in order to provide an integrated view of the information management landscape, to improve the information management maturity levels within the Group, and to support reliable and effective decision-making.


Detailed description

  • Support the business in the implementation of the various data management disciplines (i.e. Reference
    and Master Data Management, Data Quality Management, Metadata Management, Data Modelling as
    well as Design and Data Security).
  • Provide a consolidated and integrated view of the information landscape within the Group to
    support different use cases.
  • Rationalize the information landscape within the Group for the purpose of continuous improvement
    and effectiveness.
  • Oversee and manage the information lifecycle and related interdisciplinary activities, from data
    acquisition, retention, archival and deletion.
  • Facilitate changes related to data and information, analyze the impact thereof, and coordinate the
    implementation of information management activities based on the changes.
  • Ensure alignment between the various data management disciplines in order to promote cross-functional
    cohesion in providing business value.
  • Lead and participate in engagements with stakeholders within the Group and external parties, to
    ensure service delivery.
  • Provide input into how data is stored, maintained and used in the database management implementation
    process.
  • Provide periodic reports, including technical reports, as well as information management reports for
    decision-making purposes.
  • Develop and manage stakeholder relations effectively to promote data management across the
    organization and to support reliable decision-making and appropriate data usage.
  • Participate and provide technical support in cross-organization activities relating to any of the
    abovementioned data management activities.

Job requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree (NQF 7) in Informatics, Management Information Systems, Computer Science,
    Computer Engineering or an equivalent qualification
  • Five to eight years’ experience in the field of data management.

Additional requirements include:

  • Honours or Master’s degree in Economics, Finance or related field or an equivalent combination of
    education and job-related experience
  • Extensive knowledge of best practices/methodologies in data warehousing and multi-dimensional data
    analytics (e.g. OLAP, such as ESSBASE or Microsoft analysis services), systems design and
    management and skill
  • Extensive knowledge of the most common RDBMS technologies (e.g. Oracle, IBM, SQL Server and
    MySQL) and skill
  • Experience in deploying and managing big data environments (e.g. Hadoop, Spark and NoSQL) and
    skill
  • Knowledge of database querying languages (e.g. SQL) and skill
  • Experience with a variety of programming languages, including but not limited to R and Python and skill
  • Experience with development using a broad variety of integration techniques, patterns, tools and
    methodologies and skill
  • Experience in all the data management disciplines and skill.

The purpose of this role is to assist the Head of Risk in developing and maintaining an effective risk management framework for the group that includes Enterprise Risk Management, Model development and validations, and investment portfolio risk assessment and reporting, coordinate the ORSA process and reporting process.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES, MEASURES & INTERFACES

Enterprise Risk Management

  • Responsible for data collection for ERM purposes
  • Responsible for identification, development and maintenance of key risk indicators
  • Responsible for development of risk appetite for key risk indicators
  • Responsible for reporting and monitoring of key risk indicators
  • Responsible for risk aggregation within the group
  • Contribute to the implementation of an appropriate suite of key risk indicators suitable for Underwriting portfolio activities for continuous monitoring and reporting to Executive Management and the Board
  • Responsible for monitoring and reporting of Risk Assessment for outsourced functions
  • Conduct Risk and Control Self-assessment

Investment Portfolio Activities (Market, Credit. Operational and Liquidity Risk)

  • Contribute to the development of an appropriate risk monitoring program for the investment portfolio activities.
  • Responsible for executing the risk monitoring program for the investment portfolio activities.
  • Contribute to the development of an appropriate suite of key risk indicators suitable for Investment portfolio activities for
    continuous monitoring and reporting to Executive Management and the Board.
  • Contribute to the development of an effective methodology for ensuring that risks (in connection with Investment portfolio activities) are identified, recorded and appropriately escalated, with all required mitigating actions subsequently completed.
  • Responsible for monitoring compliance with risk policies and procedures as well ensuring that risk exposures are appropriately
    identified, reported and controlled
  • Responsible for monitoring that all the required risk policies, procedures and operating activities are fit for purpose.
  • Responsible for contributing material content to related presentation materials on risks associated with Investment portfolio activities for Asset Managers, Investment Consultant, Executive Management and the Board.
  • Contribute to the development and review of the ALM and Capital Management policies
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of the Contingency Funding Plan

ORSA Process (forecasting, stress and scenario testing, capital adequacy analysis)

  • Responsible for coordinating, running and participating in wide forecasting, stress testing, and capital adequacy analysis to support the development of the risk appetite as well as performing and incorporating capital related analytics and requirements for the ORSA report
  • Contribute towards the analysis of stress test results and formulation of recommendations to Executive Management and the Board on risk appetite, capital optimization strategies and operating and contingent capital plans
  • Contribute to the production and maintenance of the ORSA annual report, quarterly reporting, and ad hoc reporting needs
  • Responsible for ongoing monitoring, review, assessment and escalation of regulatory changes that may affect the ORSA policy, processes and procedure
  • Establish a forward-looking assessment of the risk profile and financial position of the Corporation, including the conducting of regular stress testing and scenario analyses as defined in GOI 3.1 (Own Risk and Solvency Assessment (ORSA) for Insurers), against the risk appetite and risk limits of the Corporation

Model Validation & Modelling

  • Responsible for the design and maintenance of effective processes and procedures for the validation of the ALM, Premium Pricing, Reserving Model and Economic Capital model
  • Responsible for the development and improvement of the model validation policy in consultation with the Actuary
  • Responsible for the development of a stress test governance framework including enhancing model risk management processes in consultation with the Actuarial unit
  • Develop a model to independently establish a forward-looking assessment of the risk profile and financial position of the Corporation, including the conducting of regular stress testing and scenario analyses as defined in GOI 3.1 (Own Risk and Solvency Assessment (ORSA) for Insurers), against the risk appetite and risk limits of the Corporation.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

  • Honours degree in Economics, Actuarial Science, Statistics, Finance, Engineering or Mathematics is a requirement.
  • At least 5 years' experience in market risk, stress testing, PD and LGD credit models, loss forecasting and economic capital.
  • Experience in regulatory capital, economic capital and capital adequacy assessment.
  • Familiarity with ORSA and/or ICAAP
  • Relevant independent research project or thesis is beneficial
  • Completion of or progression in FRM, CFA or Actuary is beneficial

display_title: Head of Strategic Brand and Client Marketing
job_description:
Company Description


Who is HelloKindred?

HelloKindred are specialists in staffing marketing, creative and technology roles, offering a range of talent solutions that can be delivered on-site, remotely or hybrid.

Our vision is to make work accessible and people’s lives better. We do this by disrupting traditional employment barriers – connecting ambitious talent to flexible opportunities with trusted brands.


Job Description


Employment type: Contract (with a potential to convert to perm)
Estimated start date: ASAP

Our client who believes in transforming companies, communities and youth lives by connecting youth to economic opportunities is seeking a skilled Head of Brand and Client Marketing to join their team. Under the direction of the Chief Operating Officer, the successful candidate will be responsible for understanding the mindsets and capturing the imaginations of clients, stakeholders, youth, business leaders and key influencers in the market. They will lead and drive the brand marketing, while building strong relationships across the business as well as externally with clients, aggregators and various stakeholders. The Head of Strategic Brand and Client Marketing will put together an exceptional brand marketing multi-channel strategy and lead its development, driving new ideas and crucial day-to-day brand marketing operations with the support of the Marketing team.

General

  • Creation, maintenance and identification of brand vision (in partnership with the greater Marketing team).
  • Conceptualising, executing and measuring of successful brand campaigns.
  • Brand value proposition creation, support and execution.
  • Creation and execution of an advertising and execution strategy.
  • Design and co-ordinate media campaigns and negotiate with media agencies/media owners.
  • Internal and external design and collateral input.
  • Events and activations management and execution.
  • Provisioning of marketing support to teams.
  • Brand leadership through partnership with content strategy team.
  • Digital marketing management and execution.
  • Create and assist in implementing a streamlined marketing process.
  • Ensure marketing budget is maintained and governance and processes followed.
  • Manage and work with individual teams and ensure consistency and appropriateness of the brand’s messages in the market.
  • Ensure that all branding programs are aligned with the overall business objectives and that they are optimised and relevant to multiple audiences.
  • Keep abreast of cutting-edge trends in marketing and competitor marketing activities.
  • Participate in the planning of external and internal events, conferences and fairs and coordinate as directed by partners. In particular, work with BD to identify key sector events and plan strategies and plans around these.
  • Proactively working with key clients to identify business case studies and youth stories and collaboratively leverage marketing synergies.
  • With support of agency, identify new opportunities, channels and strategies to grow demand.

Team and partnership management and collaboration

  • Managing direct reports and liaising with team members to ensure all projects are on brand, budget and to deadline.
  • Bringing on board new collaborators.
  • Partnering with creative teams on unique, innovative and re-branding projects.
  • Working with creative teams to plan campaigns around launches and key dates in the year.
  • Managing agencies and agency outputs.
  • Social media - supporting social media team in providing content from clients and partners and overall brand messaging.
  • The role is expected to be highly collaborative, working closely with BD and other parts of the business, in formulation and delivery of both the offline and online brand marketing elements/strategies. These elements are inclusive but not limited to brand design, partnership marketing, pitches and advertising.
  • Working closely with the BD and Client Engagements teams to proactively align strategies and activities.

Client and stakeholder relationships

  • Developing and implementing client marketing strategy and collaborative activities – specifically a key account management marketing strategy and plan.
  • Expanding collaborations (internal and external).
  • Managing and overseeing client communications.
  • Creating unique offerings for key clients.
  • Providing the BD team with the requisite support.
  • Managing client events and additional activities.
  • Build viable and value-enhancing aggregator (B-BBEE agencies and industry bodies) strategy, offerings and support.
  • Embark on special client and sector project collaborations.
  • Produce quality reporting.

Research, analysis and reporting

  • The incumbent plays a crucial analytical role in establishing metrics for the purpose of measuring campaign effectiveness against KPIs, including for benchmarking the brand’s performance in order to ensure that campaigns are relevant and competitive.
  • With COO and agencies, set up tracking systems for marketing campaigns and online activities, to report to broader business on marketing and brand ROI.
  • Provide thought leadership around the Marketing Data and Analytics topics by analysing the industry trends and landscape, with input from content and research team.
  • Monitor metrics with agencies and tools to accurately measure key performance metrics such as CPL, CPV and CPA.
  • Day to day management of media channel accounts to drive online leads in specific business sectors and maximise CPL, CPA and CLV.
  • Be an expert in media platforms and analytics tools.
  • With support of agency, optimise account performance through campaign development, SEO management and keyword management.
  • Actively manage and report on campaign performance and quality of lead generation, working closely with BD teams to verify results.
  • Regularly monitor and assess key measurable statistics and data, so that marketing plans and initiatives can be adapted to drive ROI (this may include segmentation data, market research analysis and/or Google analytics for example).
  • Provide recommendations on channel strategy to optimise performance and keep abreast of best marketing practice.
  • Source and analyse customer research, current market conditions and competitor information as appropriate.
  • Proactively create strategies and activities to improve the web presence, web tracking and increase usage of the website.
  • Optimise Martech across the business to track and measure insights-driven marketing activities.

Qualifications
  • Relevant Marketing degree.
  • Strong ability to communicate with senior stakeholders.
  • Proven track record and deep understanding of digital marketing concepts.
  • Experience in Digital Marketing.
  • Team management.

Additional Information


Please note that only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Candidates must be legally authorized to live and work in the country the position is based in, without requiring sponsorship.

We appreciate your interest in this opportunity. Please note only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

HelloKindred is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, committed to creating a diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

MAIN PURPOSE OF THE JOB

The role of the Corporate Actuarial Analyst is to support the Head: Actuarial Short Term & Life with cleaning, consolidating, validating and analyzing data including analysis of policy movements, data reconciliations and preparation of actuarial investigations in order to come up with actuarial assumptions and models for purposes of technical valuations (internal management accounts, IFRS17 and SAM), forecasting, capital modeling and risk analytics. From time to time, this role will also be involved in product and pricing-related matters including reinsurance as-and-when required. Part of the function is to implement actuarial models to produce required actuarial calculations and providing inputs for regulatory reports (quantitative regulatory templates and qualitative reporting templates). This position will work hand-in-hand with the Senior Actuarial Analyst, reporting directly to the Head: Actuarial - Short Term & Life.


Key Performance Areas

  • Corporate Actuarial (IFRS17, SAM, ORSA)
  • Develop and implement valuations (IFRS17 and SAM), cash flow and capital models (economic capital and/or regulatory capital).
  • Data extracts to feed into IFRS17 actuarial calculations and associated methodologies and documentation in line with relevant legislation.
  • Monitoring reserve development experience and calculation of actual experience compared against valuation assumptions and propose adjustments as-and-when required.
  • Perform SAM quarterly and annual valuations as per Prudential Standards.
  • Perform the calculations of the Liquidity Shortfall Indicator as per the regulatory requirements to the Prudential Authority.
  • Perform the scenario and stress tests calculations in the periodic Own Risk and Solvency Assessment (“ORSA”) process.
  • Establish a forward-looking assessment of the risk profile and financial position of LBI, compared against the risk appetite and risk limits of LBI; including providing an input in the actuarial-related components of the ORSA report.
  • Operating the SAM regulatory capital model and continuously improving and automating various models.
  • Perform calculations of Embedded Value, Value of New Business and Analysis of Surplus periodically.

  • Product Development and Pricing
  • Support the technical pricing on new and renewal business.
  • Assist in the assessment of the impact of new rating factors for the purposes of technical pricing.
  • Assistance in the review and enhance existing products.
  • Assistance in researching and developing new and innovative products.
  • Provide an input in product management, ensuring all product and pricing related documents for the product are reviewed and maintained appropriately.
  • Assist in developing and implementing new rating and pricing models for existing and new products.
  • Perform mix of business, claims, expense, new business, lapse and loss ratio analysis.

  • Data Collection and Analysis
  • Analyze policy movements.
  • Integrate data from other sources to inform the models.
  • Input data to pricing, reserving and capital models accurately.
  • Compare actual experience against expected experience, produce Ave and advise on appropriate actions to be taken.
  • Data analysis to support various areas of LBI (reinsurance, underwriting, risk management, sales and management) which includes predictive analytics and artificial intelligence.
  • Conduct Research using primary data sources and select information needed for the analysis of key themes and trends.
  • Ensure the definitions and assumptions are aligned to the problem statement.

  • Reinsurance Analysis and Risk Metrics
  • Collate data from the reinsurers/reinsurance broker and operations department and conduct the necessary reinsurance analytics prior to reinsurance renewals.
  • Run models for assessing the impact of reinsurance and other risk transfer mechanisms.
  • Evaluation of reinsurance structures and other forms of risk transfer arrangements including determining optimal reinsurance or risk transfer structure.
  • Reinsurance Analytics/Reporting in collaboration with the Operations department.
  • Risk Analytics in collaboration with the Risk department.

  • Actuarial Investigations And Profitability Analysis
  • Cross functional collaboration, providing input and guidance on product related elements across the value chain.
  • Provide input in product performance monitoring and compare pricing metrics against targets for monthly and quarterly reporting of risks on the risk register.
  • Effectively identify problem areas and report to the Head: Actuarial - Short Term & Life.
  • Ensure timely submission of various periodical reports to the Head: Actuarial Short Term & Life or Senior Management.
  • Embedded Value calculations and preparation of value of inforce and value of new business metrics.
  • Ensure that all policies and procedures are adhered to.
  • Provide input for the periodic reports to the Product Development Committee on Product specific issues.
  • Prepare all actuarial SAM reporting including providing an input into the documentation of the projected solvency position results.

Preferred Minimum Education and Experience

  • 1-3 years Actuarial Experience in Life and/or Short-term Insurance Industries in corporate actuarial work (IFRS, SAM, and/or ORSA). Agricultural specific insurance will be advantageous but not essential.
  • Relevant 3-year qualification in Actuarial Science or Mathematical Statistics and a student member of the Actuarial Society of South Africa (“ASSA”).
  • At least 3 actuarial exemptions from ASSA or equivalent recognized professional actuarial body (e.g. Institute and Faculty of Actuaries).

Critical Competencies

  • Knowledge of Actuarial Software or Programming/Database Language (VBA, SQL, PowerBI, R, Python, Basys, Moses, Prophet, or similar)
  • Advanced Microsoft Office
  • Relevant legislation applicable to insurance companies such as the Insurance Act of 2017 and associated Prudential Standards Financial Soundness for Insurers as well as International Financial Reporting Standards (“IFR17”)
  • Actuarial Methodologies - Knowledge and understanding of the principles, regulations and legislation pertaining to acceptable actuarial policies
  • Ability to understand Financial Statements, Accounting Ratios and Risk Metrics
  • Short term and/or Life Insurance Corporate Actuarial (SAM, ORSA)
  • Short term and/or Life Insurance Product Development & Pricing
  • Reinsurance (short term and/or life insurance)
  • Statistical/Actuarial Models and Analytical Methods
  • Additional Requirements
  • Travel as and when required
  • Extended hours as and when required

Transforming the Future with the Convergence of Simulation and Data

Global Sales Enablement Specialist – Electronics

Global Role (flexible location; USA, EMEA, APAC)

Do you like helping people understand the benefits that technology can provide them? Do you enjoy being a corporate story-teller? If so, then you might be the new Altairian we are searching for. At Altair, we pride ourselves on a business culture that enables open, creative thinking and we deeply value our employees and their contributions towards our clients' success, as well as our own.

Job Summary:

Enable our Sales T eams to develop and win more business faster for the portion of Altair’s technology portfolio related to electromagnetic and electronic solutions for wireless connectivity and PCB development ( https://www.altair.com/electronic-system-design ).

What You Will Do:

Enable our Salespeople to sell our Electromagnetic and Electronic S olutions (75%)

For your assigned sales campaigns (which will change periodically), help our Sales Account Managers (AMs) win business efficiently by doing the following:

  • Develop, deliver and support a successful sales enablement strategy for consistent execution in your assigned region. Propose appropriate success metrics, then achieve them.
  • Lead the creation of the required selling materials as “Sales Enablement Kits” (including battlecards, call & email scripts, sales presentations, sales wins and customer success stories, and possibly more) to provide guidance to our s alespeople internally and to enable them to re-use externally when selling. Monitor usage and increase over time.
  • Help produce enough qualified leads for our AMs by enabling our Business Development Representatives (BDRs), Inside Sales Reps (ISRs) and Regional Marketing teams to properly target, pursue, and achieve traction with prospective customers.
  • Monitor and assess campaign results, processes, & lessons learned – to continually improve.
  • Conduct sales training and continually coach Account Managers & Channel Partners . C oordinate our AMs’ storytelling with our AEs’ ability to deliver effective demos.
  • Support expansion at key accounts, building and leveraging a local community of advocates.
  • Make key customer & prospect visits. Propose/support relevant events to develop business.
  • Represent the voice of customers & Altair Sales to our Marketing & Development T eams.
  • Know the major industrial/market trends and challenges which provide real and significant business opportunities to Altair. Understand the competitive landscape.

Collaborate with our Corporate Marketing team (15%)

  • Work with our Corporate Marketing team (especially Solutions Marketing & IMC) to support our company’s selling efforts – by effectively raising awareness and delivering evidence for our Electromagnetic and Electronic S olutions (e.g., for use on our website, in marketing videos, social media posts, etc) .
  • Give advice, collaborate with, and support the Corporate and Regional Marketing Teams to plan and execute effective marketing and sales campaigns.

Collaborate with our Product Development and Altair Partner Alliance teams (10%)

  • Provide business focus and scalable use cases to Development so their technology roadmap helps Altair maximize growth by being well aligned with perceived market opportunities.
  • Coordinate activity of technical resources to conduct benchmarks, proof-of-concept work, and product demos for our unique selling points (USPs).
  • Cultivate and help sell solutions developed through strategic technology partnerships.

What You Will Need:

Basics:

  • BS or MS in Electrical Engineering, Physics or a related field.
  • Familiarity with the electronics CAE software space .
  • Effective communicator; enjoys helping others learn .
  • Takes initiative and work independently .
  • Ability to travel up to 30 % of time.

Preferred:

  • Experience in a customer-facing role in electronics simulation software sales or technical support . A solid understanding of the importance of selling technical solutions involving software and/or services .
  • 5-1 0 years of experience with one or more of the following:
  • Electromagnetic / electronic simulation for solutions covering from board through sub-system to system levels (Altair Feko and/or ANSYS HFSS – Electronics Desktop, and/or Dassault CST Studio Suite).
  • MS , MBA or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Physics or a related field.

How You Will Be Successful:

  • Envision the Future
  • Communicate Honestly and Broadly
  • Seek Technology and Business “Firsts”
  • Embrace Diversity and Take Risks

Why Work with Us:

Altair is a global technology company providing software and cloud solutions in the areas of product development, high-performance computing (HPC) and artificial intelligence (AI). Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world, while creating a more sustainable future. With more than 3,000 engineers, scientists, and creative thinkers in 25 countries, we help solve our customer’s toughest challenges and deliver unparalleled service, helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities.

Our vision is to transform customer decision making with data analytics, simulation, and high-performance computing and artificial intelligence (AI).

For more than 30 years, we have been helping our customers integrate electronics and controls with mechanical design to expand product value, develop AI, simulation, and data-driven digital twins to drive better decisions, and deliver advanced HPC and cloud solutions to support unlimited idea exploration. To learn more, please visit altair.com.

Ready to go? #ONLYFORWARD

At our core we are explorers; adventurers; pioneers. We are the brains behind some of the world’s most revolutionary innovations and are not only comfortable in new and uncharted waters, we dive in headfirst. We are the original trailblazers that make the impossible possible, discovering new solutions to our customer’s toughest challenges.

Altair is an equal opportunity employer. Our backgrounds are diverse, and every member of our global team is critical to our success. Altair's history demonstrates a belief that empowering each individual authentic voice reinforces a culture that thrives because of the uniqueness among our team.

Overview

display_title: Head of Strategy: National Integrated Communications Agency
job_description:
Previously disadvantaged candidates will be given preference.

We have an incredible opportunity for an experienced Head of Strategy at a dynamic and fast paced, high performing, integrated strategic Communications agency, part of a national agency Group, in Johannesburg. Truly integrated, this Communications consultancy works across the PR, Digital & Content Marketing fields.

The Head of Strategy is a key member of the agency’s leadership team and is very much the leader of thinking that champions the quality of their strategic delivery. This role calls for an exceptional people manager; you will manage a team of 5 and be a key enabler of excellence and measurable impact across and in and across the agency’s teams, and with their clients. The role reports to the Partner & Managing Director and is part of the EXCO.

Although you will be a Head of Department, this is a very hands-on role in a very fast-paced, exciting environment working across a variety of clients from financial to e-commerce to health, etc. in a mix of corporate and consumer portfolios.

The Head of Strategy owns and leads the charge on thinking, insight, planning, data & analytics and measurement. This person demonstrates both personal and team leadership, being equally comfortable guiding boards, leaders in the C-suite and the most junior staff to high quality actions because of their strategic counsel. We’re also looking for someone who has experience working with a creative team.

While you will be working in the PR//Content Marketing and Digital Communications space, you can be a Strategist with a Traditional or Digital agency background. The agency will consider experienced Strategists who don’t possess PR experience as long as you are interested in the Communications sector.

Don’t miss this terrific opportunity – apply today!

Note: We are ideally looking for a Johannesburg based candidate, but the agency may consider someone in Cape Town.

Responsibilities

Include but are not limited to:

Managing & Leading the Strategic Charge

  • (Working with Client Leads) to support and deliver quality strategic thinking in all client delivery
  • Clearly understands briefs and strategic asks and how this delivers deep thinking and quality
  • Works with and across teams to train and grow the depth of strategic thinking across the business
  • On time delivery of work that cuts through clutter and is measurable
  • Owns measurement and effectives, builds and crafts frameworks and models that allow the agency to own this.

Managing Growth

  • Works with the Partner & Managing Director as well as executive team to support current and future growth strategies
  • Is accountable for the new business activities as an agency, and actively leads and champions pitches.

Managing People & Capacity for Self and Teams

  • Manages workflow for the broader strategy team in conjunction with the Head of Operations
  • Looks around corners and anticipates problems, solving them before they become problems
  • Champions quality of thinking for the strategy team and the creative/client facing teams – driving broad based ownership of smarts as an agency
  • Works with creative team and ECD to translate insight into creative cut through work
  • Works with client teams and CSD to ensure teams are busy delivering on strategy and not just busy being busy
  • Manages team performance and commitment to delivering on the agency’s quality standards. Builds and delivers growth plans for key high performing talent.

Managing & Leading the Data & Analytics Hub

  • Managing and growing talent, skill, and capacity in this team
  • Managing a depth of partners and providers that allow the agency to connect the dots. Knows the tools and what they do and why they are needed
  • Managing strategy team workflows
  • Manages clear KPIs across all clients. Do we have them, are we measuring the right things – can we claim to be truly effective?
  • Manages client scope (and out of scope) opportunities from a strategy, reporting and tools point of view
  • Manages the agency’s tools
  • Ensures training on tools and that the tools are being actively used in the agency’s work for clients.

Building & Crafting the Strategic Proposition

  • Thinks deeply about the future of the agency’s work
  • Creates and crafts strategic models and intellectual property / tools that set the agency apart and brings their strategic value proposition (Powerful Conversations) to life
  • Drives intellectual property and develops and takes these tools to market in an effective way
  • Owns the thought leadership agenda and how PR agencies champion real business thinking and impact.

Managing Partnership & Integration with Group Strategy Teams

  • Collaboration and partnership with group production teams across Johannesburg and Cape Town
  • Teamwork and assistance on projects as required as a proactive positive representative of the agency in the Group
  • Ensuring understanding, implementation and work using the group’s strategy tools and processes (embeds themselves in Brutal Simplicity of Thought).

Finance, Billing, & Administration

  • Managing OOS strategy fees and opportunities
  • Time reporting.

Requirements

The successful candidate must have/be:

  • Relevant tertiary qualification
  • At least 10 years relevant agency experience
  • A great people manager
  • Experience working with a creative team
  • Can-do attitude
  • Solutions driven with a good understanding of various industries, and how they connect
  • Aware
  • Able to comfortably multi-task and delegate/coach in achieving the desired outcomes. The person people seek out of an opinion, and the person they want to work with
  • Recognised as a dot connector. The leader that can interpret news and culturally relevant events, and then transform these into work that delivers a powerful conversation for all our clients in collaboration with
  • Able to own, implement, and improve processes that drives strategic thinking, insights and data impact in our work
  • Guides teams to think beyond the brief and mentors/steers a strategic orientation at all levels and roles
  • Lives to deliver a culture of strategic, not just delivery of a strategy
  • Leads and grows teams in our Data & Analytics Hub. Owns analytics and the tools that drive this. Uses these tools as significant inputs to great outcomes for our clients. Works with teams to understand these capabilities and what they mean for clients and work
  • Must understand clients, their industries, and their opportunities to support proactive and effective work
  • Able to champion effectiveness and measurable work
  • Someone who continually define ways to increase client satisfaction and deepen client relationships
  • Able to foster teamwork and a good organisational climate
  • Able to motivate and create a warm environment for people to do great work optimally
  • Deeply curious
  • Obsessed with culture, trends and how the interconnect
  • A simplifier
  • Understands what turns the consumers and stakeholders on (and indeed … off)
  • A natural ability to find lateral solutions to problems and does so collaboratively and without seeking personal glory
  • Flexible and can easily adapt
  • Loves to roll-up your sleeves and dig into a challenge, not ever happy until the insight is clear and the solve is being turned into work
  • Love digital and want to own a thought leadership role in how it creates a future powerful conversation
  • A knack for storytelling and narratives
  • Brave: Bold ideas (but always considered)
  • Confident counsellor, they push the boundary in their work and inspire their teams to be more and want more
  • Kind and nice to work with. Thinks about people when making decisions.
  • Integrity and is respectful
  • Accountable
  • Open and clear communicator
  • Excellent in your craft
  • Doesn’t compromise on the quality of the work and output
  • Collaborative.

City: Johannesburg
Country: South Africa
Level of Expertise: Senior
Remuneration: Negotiable
Reference Number: #Tam722

Tamara Wolpert

GM & Consultant
tamara@vgp.co.za

Main Purpose of Job

A leading health-care business is looking for a Content Manager who will be responsible for building a brand identity and online presence through the creation and dissemination of multimedia content online. This involves developing content strategies, managing a content team, growing an online community and tracking that community's growth, among other duties.

Key Performance Areas (Core, essential responsibilities –outputs of the position)

  • You will be responsible for creating, improving and maintaining content to achieve our B2C business goals. Your duties will also include sharing content to raise brand awareness and monitoring web traffic and metrics to identify best practices.
  • Experienced professional with demonstrable creative writing skills and multimedia content development.
  • As a Content manager, you should perform well under deadline pressure and be detail-oriented.
  • Oversee all marketing content initiatives to ensure customer engagement, brand consistency and a positive customer experience.
  • Possess the ability to think both creatively and analytically.
  • Content Manager duties include producing and publishing multimedia content, writing, editing and proofreading, formulating content strategies and managing a content team, among other tasks.

job_description:

Our client a major South African Financial institution is looking for a Solutions Architect to work in an exciting fast-paced environment. The Solutions Architect will be required to design technology solutions for the organisation by defining integrated solution architectures that are aligned with IT strategies and architectures to meet and support the organisation’s goals.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Solution Architecture: Define and design architecture solutions that encompass all architecture domains outlining solutions in line with business requirements, enterprise architecture principles, and ICT standards to ensure standardisation and risk management. Review and ensure solution architecture designs provide seamless integration, scalability, and security in accordance with the prescribed enterprise architecture. Update and maintain the architecture repository with all architecture artefacts as part of architecture implementation governance.
  • Project planning and implementation: Contribute to the development and/or evaluation of Terms of Reference documents to assist business and ICT teams during the RFI and RFP process. Take accountability for the end-to-end delivery of solutions/applications/systems and ensure alignment with the approved architecture.
  • Stakeholder Management: Work closely with ICT and business stakeholders to understand their needs and ensure the solution meets the agreed-upon requirements.
  • Budget and Resource Management: Work within budget constraints and manage resources efficiently.
  • Communication and Collaboration: Have good communication and collaboration skills to effectively work with the various teams and stakeholders.
  • Innovation: Keep up to date with the latest technology trends and bring innovative ideas on how the best solutions can be brought into the organisation.
  • Business Alignment: Align the designed solution with the overall business strategy and ensure it delivers business value.
Essential Competencies
  • IT architecture, infrastructure and cloud development.
  • Engineering and software architecture design.
  • DevOps practices.
  • Network administration.
  • System and data security.
  • Business analysis techniques and processes.
  • Various operating systems.
  • Database management.
Location

This is a Hybrid position and will is based in Centurion.

Technical Non-Negotiables
  • Minimum ten (10) years of experience working in developing and integrating large-scale solutions involving multiple technologies, functions, and interfaces across in-house and vendor-supplied systems.
  • In-depth understanding of multiple technology domains and expertise in at least one, including experience with software development, databases, networks, and infrastructure.
  • Expert understanding of cloud architectures and components with a focus on Azure. This should include general knowledge and experience in cloud infrastructure, scalability, monitoring and security applicable to solution architecture designs.
  • Minimum ten (10) years of experience with best practices and design patterns when designing distributed systems, systems integrations and microservices.
  • Minimum three (3) years experience in Enterprise Architecture tools like Case wise, Visio, and Sparx Enterprise Architect.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, ability to work with cross-functional teams
  • Minimum ten (10) years experience in designing solutions for (more than one architecture domain in a single project) large projects.
  • Ability to guide project teams and ensure solutions are developed and deployed in accordance with approved solution architecture.
  • Solid knowledge in creating architecture for all domains in one or more of the following areas: Database architecture, Big Data, Machine Learning, Business Intelligence, Data Governance, No-SQL databases, Advanced Analytics, AI, Data Mining, ETL for cloud and/or on-premises environments.
  • Solid knowledge of system requirements and system architecture to meet business needs, including server infrastructure, capacity planning, storage requirements, virtualisation and networking protocols for cloud and on-premises environments.
  • Ability to recognise functional interdependencies, assimilate and correlate disconnected procedures and processes, and articulate their collective relevance to the organisation.
Minimum requirements
  • Relevant postgraduate degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  • TOGAF Certification is a requirement. Knowledge of other frameworks (e.g., Zachman) would be an advantage.

We are searching for a Finance General Ledger(FI GL) candidate with the below mentioned skillsets:

The candidate will be responsible for managing and optimizing the General Ledger processes within the SAP Financial Accounting (FI) module. Your role will involve implementing, configuring, and maintaining the SAP FI GL functionality to ensure accurate and efficient financial reporting, charted accounting compliance, and smooth closing and approval processes.


Responsibilities:

  • SAP FI General Ledger Implementation: Lead the implementation and configuration of the SAP FI General Ledger functionality, ensuring alignment with the organization's accounting principles and financial reporting requirements.
  • System Configuration and Customization: Configure and customize the SAP FI module to support General Ledger operations, including chart of accounts setup, posting rules, document splitting, and profit centre accounting, inter-company reconciliation, GR-IR matching & reconciliation, Tax procedures set-up, integration with MM/SD, financial statement version configuration.
  • Writing Functional Specification and supporting developer: Should be able to write functional specification for any custom development and help developer in testing.
  • Accounting Standards Compliance: Ensure compliance with applicable accounting standards and regulations, such as GAAP or IFRS. Stay up to date with changes in accounting standards and assess their impact on the General Ledger processes. Implement necessary controls and processes to meet these requirements.
  • Closing and Reporting: Oversee the month-end, quarter-end, and year-end closing processes within the SAP FI GL module. Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure timely and accurate financial reporting. Generate financial statements, reports, and analytics to provide insights into the organization's financial performance. Having Fiori experience would be an advantage.
  • Approval Workflows: Design and implement approval workflows for financial transactions and postings, ensuring compliance with internal controls and segregation of duties. Streamline approval processes, leveraging SAP functionality, and automation tools to enhance efficiency and reduce manual interventions.
  • Data Management, Integrity & Migration: Oversee the collection, validation, and analysis of financial data within the SAP FI module. Develop and maintain data quality standards and ensure accuracy and integrity of GL-related data.Assist data migration team in resolving technical issues and support them with right approach.
  • Training and User Support: Conduct training sessions and provide ongoing support to end users on the effective and efficient use of the SAP FI GL functionality. Address user queries, troubleshoot issues, and provide guidance to ensure smooth system operation.
  • Testing and Defect Resolution:Ensure timely testing of SAP FI GL processes and enhancements according to project timelines. Resolve defects and troubleshoot issues. Create of new test scripts where required.
  • Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Finance, Controlling, and IT, to align General Ledger initiatives with overall business goals. Act as a subject matter expert on SAP FI GL and engage with stakeholders to understand their requirements and provide appropriate solutions.

Key purpose:

﻿﻿Our company seeks Business Intelligence Manager who will be responsible for executing the strategic direction during the development, deployment, maintenance and monitoring of Business Information; technologies, processes, policies and program enhancements in accordance with best practice, national legislation and international standards. The BI manager will also work closely with business executives and stakeholders in other departments to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support analytics solutions to deliver essential information to allow for better management decisions.

﻿Duties and responsibilities:

  • Partner with stakeholders to define business and systems requirements for new information technologies, with focus in the areas of BI, analytics, and data warehousing.
  • Influence design of the Data Strategy through business and industry insights, research as well as global best practices
  • Drive the efficient utilization of data resources across different business units and global locations (if applicable).
  • Develop and implement business intelligence competency center (BICC), that includes annual reviews.
  • Facilitate system feasibility studies, proof of concepts, pilot project, and testing on a continuous basis to improve services.
  • Develop, implement, and maintain all key BI and data management policies and procedures, inclusive of BI/EDW architecture, data centers, standards, purchasing, monitoring, and service provision.
  • Develop, plan and implement Business Intelligence (BI) framework, Data Extraction, Data Staging, Data Transformations, Analytical Processing (OLAP), and Data Mining
  • Define the short- and long-term plan for the corporate BI/analytics program to ensure effective delivery of information that meets current and future requirements.
  • Strategic thinking and the ability to develop and execute plans based on priorities for the business
  • Analyze existing operations and make recommendations for the improvement and growth of the BI/EDW architecture to system owners.
  • Conduct research and remain current with the latest data technologies and solutions in support of future data management procurement efforts.
  • Implement best practices are for effective problem resolution for a high availability, 24/7, global environment.
  • Influence design of reporting and analysis through industry best practices and ensuring alignment to the Technology and business strategy.
  • Develop global maintenance schedules for BI and data warehousing systems (daily, weekly, monthly, annually).
  • Examine, refine, and develop BI metrics.
  • Facilitate and participate in Design Forums ensuring representation of BI, Technology and other stakeholder requirements.
  • Business and design decisions are driven by optimised robust customer and operational performance data
  • Oversee the design, development and deployment of all reports, dashboards, and information artifacts relating to Business Intelligence across the organisation.
  • Manage the deployment, monitoring, maintenance, development, upgrade, and support of BI/EDW systems, including data architecture, data integration, high availability, security, and data privacy.
  • Establish and maintain regular written and in-person communications with the organisations executives, department heads, and end users regarding information-based decision making.
  • Implement actionable intelligence to operational and technology stakeholders to improve customer and colleague experiences, reduce demand and costs.
  • Assist in the provisioning of end-user services, including user hotline and technical support services.
  • Practice asset management for hardware, software, and equipment.
  • Enforce compliance with change management practices conform to organisation-wide standards.
  • Strive for quality development coding with zero defects
  • Ensure data integrity is preserved through data accuracy, consistency, completeness and timeliness.
  • Monitor and maintain compliance with audit requirements
  • Maintain documentation and auditing of models, projects, and processes
  • Adhere to legislative requirements and Group policies and procedures
  • Preside over disciplinary hearings on behalf of the company in alignment with statutory requirements and the policies & procedures of company
  • Effectively communicate and embed new processes and procedures as they occur addressing or escalating matters / concerns to the SMEs (subject matter experts) when required

﻿Qualifications and experience:

  • 5 years of product or technology experience (advantageous)
  • 4 years experience with design and implementation of product roadmaps
  • 3 years cloud technology big data, etc
  • Experience in a fast-paced environment with competing demand, multiple partners, networked teams, and evolving needs.
  • Degree in Information Technology Management, Computer Science, Business Administration, Commerce or similar
  • Latest ITIL and/or COBIT certification (advantageous)

Working closely with peers and senior leaders you'll be ensuring the successful completion and delivery of software. Additional responsibilities may include budgeting, identifying and supporting talent, and defining resource requirements and allocations.
Responsibilities
  • Partnering with and leading large offshore resources to solving complex business needs, serving as the technical contact
  • Managing your team, including interviewing, hiring, planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; and giving appropriate feedback
  • Mentoring your team, ensuring that they are knowledgeable in critical aspects of their roles, providing clear feedback
  • Writing advanced complex code for computer systems, as senior source of expertise, performing reviews and leading development
  • Acting as an acknowledged “go to” person on coding and technical issues
  • Recommending technical strategy and direction across functional area, participating in the the development and evolution of architecture
  • Working directly with customers and end-users, and providing design input across a product
  • Interfacing with other personnel or team members to finalize requirements
  • Completing complex bug fixes, and resolving technical issues
  • Encouraging new ideas from staff to foster improvements through innovations, and empowering them to be accountable
Requirements
  • Have substantial Software Engineering experience, including some management experience
  • Have a BS degree in Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • Have experience in staff resourcing and management, including partnering and offshoring resourcing models
  • Be able to demonstrate excellent organisational skills when dealing with multiple priorities, able to think analytically
  • Be expert in development languages, including JAVA/J2EE, JavaScript, JSP, C/C++, HTML, XML, SQL, Windows, UNIX and .Net
  • Be a natural problem solver, able to take a lead in collaborating to resolve issues
  • Have excellent communication skills and the ability to convey information clearly to a wide audience
  • Have great experience in code reviews and development approaches
  • Be very proficient in database technology, design and manipulation, optimization, and best practice
  • Have an excellent understanding of data modelling principles, data manipulation languages and storage systems
  • Have excellent knowledge and experience in project planning and management tools
Work in a way that works for you
We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organization, with various flexible and remote working options available to employees

Purpose:


Develop and execute the marketing activities across the different commercial products in both B2C and B2B markets. Responsible for crafting the message and position of the business insurance products to drive demand in the respective target markets.


Responsibilities:


  • Marketing - Oversee a particular product or service within the larger marketing strategy. Work with marketing, communications, operations and sales to ensure that the products are correctly communicated to the market.
  • Brand Strategy and Effectiveness - Assist in establishing and implementing adequate marketing strategies for the VAPS products, across brands. Defining the measures used to determine brand effectiveness and using the results to inform future activities.
  • Stakeholder Engagement - Develop stakeholder engagement through identifying stakeholders, finding out their needs/issues/concerns. Liaising with all business areas and identifying opportunities for growth in these areas and coordinating with interdepartmental teams to execute marketing and operational plans.
  • Brand Positioning - Assist in achieving brand positioning and lead on contributing ideas to brand plans. Develop objectives and strategies for campaign implementation.
  • Insights and Reporting - Responsible for analysing campaign outcomes and providing accurate and timeous analysis, reporting and insights to relevant stakeholders.
  • Product Management - Monitor all aspects of a product life cycle, including long- and short-term development and marketing. Responsible for continuously assessing competitive products in the marketplace and offering suggestions on product enhancements to ensure that products compete successfully in the marketplace
  • Continuous Improvement - Review existing operations in their own area of work and implement innovation processes. Ensure up to date knowledge of relevant products, systems and procedures.
  • Leadership and Direction - Explain the local action plan to support team members in their understanding of what needs to be done and how this relates to the broader business plan and the organisation's strategy, mission and vision; motivate people to achieve local business goals.
  • Budgeting & Costing - Manage and track budgets and report on performance to more senior colleagues.
  • Research - Carry out a range of research activities. Responsible for assisting with research projects related to target markets.


Behavioral Competencies


  • Business Insight - Applies knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization's goals. For example, leverages insights to shape and drive critical initiatives. Shares industry developments with the team; helps them grasp business and industry fundamentals and understand how they contribute.
  • Manages Complexity - Makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems. For example, consistently looks at complex issues from many angles; obtains a rich and deep understanding; swiftly cuts to the core issue; skillfully separates root causes from symptoms.
  • Cultivates Innovation - Creates new and better ways for the organization to be successful. For example, offers creative ideas, finds unique connections between previously unrelated elements. Actively encourages and supports others' creativity; builds upon and strengthens new solutions in a positive and collaborative manner.
  • Drives Results - Consistently achieves results, even under tough circumstances. For example, emphasizes the importance of results; encourages a sense of urgency in others; challenges poor outcomes or unproductive behaviors. Provides assistance or encouragement to help others over obstacles.
  • Directs Work - Provides direction, delegating, and removing obstacles to get work done. For example, confirms mutual agreement on accountabilities, fostering strong coordination and minimizing duplicated efforts. Communicates delays or problems early so others can manage their own work schedules effectively.
  • Ensures Accountability - Holds self and others accountable to meet commitments. For example, tracks performance and strives to remain effective, learning from both successes and failures. Readily takes on challenges or difficult tasks and has a reputation for delivering on commitments.
  • Communicates Effectively - Develops and delivers multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences. For example, disseminates knowledge, insights, and updates in a polished, precise, and compelling manner. Demonstrates a deep interest in others' comments. Creates rich documents and reports.
  • Balances Stakeholders - Anticipates and balances the needs of multiple stakeholders. For example, it shows a strong commitment to identifying all relevant issues and making decisions that maximize outcomes for all key stakeholders. Engages effectively with multiple stakeholders and responds with well-balanced, win-win solutions.
  • Interpersonal Savvy - Relates openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people. For example, it recognizes even subtle social cues and nimbly responds to others' needs and preferences. Helps to defuse difficult interpersonal situations by showing high levels of tact, sensitivity, and consideration. Builds rapport with ease.
  • Being Resilient - Rebounds from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations. For example, has excellent composure and professionalism, even in very difficult situations; acts as a steadying force or role model for others. Skillfully overcomes obstacles, learns from failures, and uses these lessons to improve subsequent efforts.
  • Situational Adaptability - Adapts approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations. For example, takes steps to adapt to changing needs, conditions, priorities, or opportunities. Understands the cues that suggest a change in approach is needed; adopts new behaviors accordingly.


Skills


  • Commercial Acumen - Apply understanding of the business environment and objectives to develop solutions, while also providing technical assistance when necessary.
  • Brand Management and Development - Provide technical guidance when required on maximising a brand's impact and market value and manage and develop all aspects of the brand.
  • Customer and Market Analysis - Conduct research and analyse data while providing technical guidance as needed in order to develop a comprehensive understanding of customer and market conditions that enables maximum return on investments.
  • Planning and Organising - Provide technical guidance when required to plan, organise, prioritise and oversee activities to efficiently meet business objectives.
  • Verbal Communication - Use clear and effective verbal communication skills and provide technical guidance when required to express ideas, request actions and formulate plans or policies.
  • Analysis and Reporting - Provide technical guidance when required to analyse data trends for use in reports to help guide decision making.
  • Policy and procedures - Provide technical guidance when required to develop, monitor, interpret and understand policies and procedures, while making sure they match organisational strategies and objectives.
  • Computer skills - Support business processes by understanding and effectively using standard office equipment and standard software packages, while providing technical guidance as needed.
  • Proficient in Ms Office
  • Presentation creation - Apply concepts of knowledge / skill and also be able to provide technical guidance when required.
  • Presentation skills - Communicate with other people and provide technical guidance when required to speak in a clear, concise and compelling manner.


Education


General Education:


  • Relevant Marketing degree (Essential)
  • Honours/post-graduate qualification (Advantageous)


Experience


General Experience:


  • 3 or more years' Digital campaign set up and management such as: Paid search campaigns, social media campaigns, display campaigns, experience in a marketing environment (Essential)
  • Marketing experience across different product verticals and/or brands (Essential); 1 or more years’ experience in insurance/ financial services (Essential)
  • Experience in setting up, monitoring and analysing digital campaigns across platforms (Essential); Google Analytics understanding and experience (Advantageous)


Managerial Experience:


  • 1 or more years' experience in supervising and directing people and other resources to achieve specific end results within limited timeframes (Advantageous)

﻿﻿The role of the Investigations Manager is to provide management support to the Ethics and Compliance function in the investigation of reported non-compliances (including any unethical or illegal conduct) reported to our company via the Ethics Line or through any other source.

Key purpose:

As a Business Analyst, you will be working with the Head of Finance to support day-to-day business operations. You'll be responsible for providing analysis and reporting services in order to make informed decisions on matters such as pricing and inventory management. You will provide detailed reports, graphs and data visualisations which can help inform the strategic direction of our business. Your work may include performing research into new products or markets; analysing financial transactions including sales forecasting; developing models that simulate potential future scenarios; writing policies and procedures related to these processes within an IT environment.

display_title: Fixed Income Software Engineer (C#, Java OR Python)
job_description:
Fixed Income Software Engineer (C#, Java OR Python)

IT – Software Development
Cape Town – Western Cape

ENVIRONMENT:
If you are passionate about driving innovation and software development standards, then a dynamic financial group wants you as their next Fixed Income Software Engineer. Joining the Investment team, you will apply data and statistical models to help develop scalable and robust investment analytics and portfolio metrics that assist with the active investment management process. In this global role, you will regularly engage directly with portfolio decision-makers and use your software dev skills to make product enhancements which will have a significant impact on the investment decisions made by the team. You need to be language agnostic and open to moving into and learning new technologies.
DUTIES:
Analytics platform enhancements –
  • Play an active role in the development and enhancement of the analytics platform used in the investment research and portfolio construction process. Enhancements will include the implementation of tooling and services to increase end-user’s productivity to research machine learning models and create web-based decision support tools.
  • This work will encompass all aspects of the stack from data persistence to front-end web development, using an array of technologies (MongoDB, Redis, Apache Spark, Apache Airflow, Jenkins, Python, R and React.js).
Software product development –
  • Engage with stakeholders to understand their needs and communicate how technology could be used to address them.
  • Work with team to formulate user stories and steps for each development sprint.
  • Work in a proof-of-concept style to engage stakeholders and adopt a fail-fast approach to enable higher quality deliverables.

REQUIREMENTS:
Qualifications –
  • A BSc. Honours Degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Engineering or similar is essential.
Experience/Skills –
  • A minimum of 5 years working as a Software Developer in a professional capacity including experience with:
    • Service based architectures
    • Different backend architectures
    • Different programming paradigms
  • Preference will be given to candidates that have a broad range of skills using open source technologies such as any of the following .Net Core, JVM family of languages, Python, Java, React.js, Linux, Docker, Apache Spark, Apache Airflow, R (The candidate’s skillset should reflect a subset of these, with an emphasis on the ability to learn and desire to continuously improve such skills not only within the work environment).
Nice to haves –
  • Knowledge of the Asset Management investment processes is nice to have including:
    • Portfolio Construction and Management
    • Risk and Performance
    • Portfolio Back Testing and Signal Extraction Techniques
ATTRIBUTES:
  • Thoughtful, dynamic, technologist who loves developing tools and infrastructure that helps others do their jobs more effectively and efficiently.
  • Passionate about correctness, stability, and writing the next thing, so you aren’t spending time maintaining older projects.
  • Comfortable working on a variety of systems and programming languages and acquiring new skills as technology evolves.
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills – both written and verbal.
  • Strong collaborative work ethic, with ability to work in teams from cross-functional disciplines.
  • Proactive and able to perform independently on your own initiative with a high degree of responsibility.
  • Attention to detail and high level of accuracy, while having an appreciation for the 80:20 rule of getting things done.

overview

An international Data Analytics company based in South Africa is looking for Software Project Manager (Specialist) to join their team.Our client is looking for a Senior Data Scientist who will collaborate across the various teams in the
solution designing in credit and non-credit industries, as well as development and deployment of solutions.

description

  • The Senior Agile Project Manager will be responsible for leading cross-functional teams in delivering
    high-quality software products and data solutions using agile methodologies. The ideal candidate will
    have a deep understanding of agile principles and practices, as well as a proven track record of
    managing complex projects with multiple stakeholders
  • The Project Manager is responsible for ensuring that projects are planned, required resources are
    allocated, project delivery risks are identified & mitigated (covered), and the assigned projects are
    delivered within budget, according to client expectations, and within the set time frames. The Project
    Manager ensures that communication on project progress between project participants are consistent
    and appropriate. Must also have a good understanding of the Agile Methodology

experience, qualifications and skills

  • Facilitate the agile process, including daily stand-ups, sprint planning, sprint reviews, and
    retrospectives
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, data scientists, designers, and
  • stakeholders, to identify and prioritize project requirements and deliverables
  • Evaluate available resources against required resources
  • Manage project budgets and timelines, ensuring that resources are allocated effectively to meet
    project requirements
  • Attend and participate in client start up meetings
  • Schedule regular update session with project participants to obtain feedback on project progress
    (actual versus agreed timelines and milestones)
  • identify and manage project risks and issues, proactively identifying solutions to ensure that project
  • delivery is not impacted.Apply planning skills to populate backlogs with relevant work items that speaks to prioritised features
    and functions, and work with Product Owners to manage product backlogs and new requests
  • Drive adherence basic principles of solid SDLC with specific focus on ensuring quality of deliverables
  • Apply your knowledge and experience in identifying, discussion and applying process enhancements
    and changes to optimise productivity or delivery management
  • Communicate project status, risks, and issues to stakeholders at all levels, providing regular updates
    and ensuring that expectations are managed effectively
    Check project progress between milestones with project participants
    Arrange the internal delivery meeting to prepare team for the client delivery meeting
    Assist employees in managing their project time and ensure the optimal scheduling or employee time

Experience & requirements

  • Experience in Scrum master role beneficial
  • Minimum 5 years project management experience
  • Project management specific certification
  • Strong (Advanced) Ms – Excel
  • Intermediate Ms – Word Skills, PowerPoint and Outlook
  • Credit Risk Industry / Financial services / Software Services Knowledge
  • Proven track record of mitigating risks within SDLC and dealing with impediments.
  • Project Management Life Cycle
  • Proven track record of using Microsoft Project
  • Experience within Product Life Cycle and Product Development Cycle would be advantageous
  • Practical software development experience would be considered hugely advantageous
    Desired Soft skills
  • Excellent communication (verbal and written) and servant leadership skills
  • Be innovative and creative in providing alternative solutions or ideas
  • Proven record of problem-solving abilities and conflict facilitation
  • Very good organisational skills

Behavioural Competencies

  • Proactive
  • Dynamic and energetic
  • Ability to take initiative
  • High attention to detail (accuracy imperative)
  • Strong sense of accountability
  • Flexibility and ability to work overtime when required
  • Team player but must be able to self-manage
  • Planning and organising
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Software Project Manager (Specialist)
  • Project Management
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Analysis and Problem solving
  • Arithmetic
  • Writing skills
  • Communication skills (verbal and written)

  • BWonHANA
  • BW4/HANA
  • HANA

  • Raise and lead PM (Problem Management) tickets as identified for BW Platform as per defined SLAs

Our Client?

What will you do?

The successful candidate will join the organisation in the role of Infrastructure Operations Manager in the Company Group Technology Business Intelligence (BI) Data Platform team, responsible for management of technical services, initiatives and business as usual operations for the BI & Analytics team. He/she will be part of a highly dynamic team working in an agile, process driven environment.

  • Disaster recovery preparation and coordination for the Data Platform, including reporting and remediation of any findings.
  • Business Continuity Management for the Data Platform consumers.
  • Create a road-map and secure funding for technical services initiatives for the following year and provide input into the annual budget creation for technical services.
  • Assist with budget management by timorously updating the BI time-sheet template for all technical resources.
  • Ensure the infrastructure documentation and processes are up to date.
