As a member of the Company management team you will participate in business-wide decision-making, strategy formulation and delivery leadership while serving as an important interface between various technical, data and business stakeholder groups.

As the BI Technical Delivery Lead you will be responsible for the definition and execution of the BI platform wide portfolio of transformation, ennoblement and/or foundation initiatives, prioritizing the flow of value to various business areas whilst balancing the technical and architectural transformation demands as well as the technical change and maintenance portfolio.

You will be responsible for planning, leading, organizing, and motivating cross functional agile project teams, supported by a Scrum Master that will be responsible to manage the initiative specific delivery, in partnership with the Company BI Principal Architect who is responsible for the evolving BI architecture. Your objectives are to achieve a high level of performance and quality and to deliver agile projects that provide exceptional business value to users.

You will also be responsible for the continuous improvement of the team engagement model and delivery method. You will be accountable and responsible for the identifying, developing and implementing techniques to improve and optimist engagement, productivity, efficiency, risk mitigation, issue resolution and service delivery.

You will need to establish and maintain effective relationships with a variety of business, technical and governance stakeholders while leading the team to effectively deliver the services you are responsible for.

Delivery method and governance model

About Mobiquity

Founded in 2011, Mobiquity provides end-to-end omnichannel digital consulting services to leading trusted B2B and B2C brands (HealthCare, Banking, IoT, Big Data, and cutting-edge Web & Mobile Applications). With over 900 employees spread across the Americas, EMEA, APAC, and India, and 40 different nationalities combined; we create compelling digital experiences to help our clients create the best human-centric products. Our key competencies include expertise includes Strategy, Design, Product Engineering, Analytics, and Cloud Services. Each day, 50 million users interact with our solutions.

Our teams are inspired by technology but it doesn’t rule them. We love to learn, we are curious by nature, and driven and committed to making an impact. Working at Mobiquity means that sometimes you’ll be working outside your comfort zone, and you’ll work with smart people, possibly some that are even smarter than you. We value people that judge their success by the success of the team and the happiness of customers.

We’re also proud to be an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Premier Consulting Partner.

What will you be doing?

Your role is to be truly at the heart of software development and you'll be focusing on:

  • Work closely together with development teams to implement and automate systems and architectures.
  • Driving automation within an organization utilizing Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
  • Develop and maintain scalable architecture solutions using Cloud Providers (Azure)
  • Coaching your peers and supporting them to grow with your knowledge of Cloud, Datacenter Technologies, Automation, Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), IaC, SysOps, and DevOps.

What does it take to excel in this role?

  • Good understanding of Security and Security practices
  • Experience with Configuration Management technologies preferably Ansible
  • Experience with monitoring solutions like AppDynamics, CloudWatch, Azure Monitor, Prometheus, Nagios, or the ELK stack.

Our main working language is English, so a good command of the English language is required. We are looking for proactive people, “People who can teach us what to do, instead of us having to teach you what to do” and you should have a good dose of humor.

What will be a bonus:

  • Experience with Software Security and Network Security implementations and best practices

Job description

Senior BI Analyst

6789345211_1684338910

Job Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Location: South Africa (Johannesburg or Cape Town)

Are you a seasoned Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with a passion for leveraging data to drive strategic decisions? Do you thrive in a fast-paced Fintech environment where innovation and data-driven insights are at the heart of the business? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

About

We're working with a leading Fintech company revolutionizing the financial industry in South Africa. Their cutting-edge technology and forward-thinking approach, is reshaping how people engage with financial services. They believe that data is at the core of every successful business decision, and the BI team plays a crucial role in driving future growth and success.

Responsibilities

As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible for:

  • Developing and implementing BI strategies, roadmaps, and frameworks to support business objectives.
  • Gathering and analyzing large volumes of data from various sources to identify patterns, trends, and insights.
  • Creating insightful reports, dashboards, and visualizations that effectively communicate complex data analysis to stakeholders.
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define business requirements and translate them into technical specifications for BI solutions.
  • Conducting in-depth data analysis to uncover opportunities for process optimization, revenue growth, and cost reduction.
  • Identifying key performance indicators (KPIs) and developing measurement frameworks to track and monitor business performance.
  • Providing strategic guidance and actionable recommendations based on data-driven insights.
  • Mentoring and providing guidance to junior members of the BI team.

Requirements

To excel in this role, you should have the following qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus.
  • Proven experience (5+ years) working as a BI Analyst, preferably in the Fintech industry.
  • Expert knowledge of BI tools and technologies, such as SQL, Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to derive meaningful insights from complex datasets.
  • Experience in data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
  • Proficiency in programming languages (Python, R) for data manipulation and analysis.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively present complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong project management skills and the ability to handle multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.
  • A self-starter mindset with the ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team.

Benefits

We offer a competitive salary package and comprehensive benefits, including:

  • Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative Fintech company at the forefront of industry advancements.
  • Professional growth and development through training and mentoring programs.
  • Collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity and encourages new ideas.
  • Flexible work hours and the option for remote work.
  • Employee wellness programs.

Next steps

Send over your updated CV to s.maritz@nigelfrank.com to be considered for this exciting role. Applications are being accepted until May 25th.

Best of luck with your application.

Enterprise Architect IT - Infrastructure
Cape Town - Western Cape
ENVIRONMENT:
YOUR ability to apply multiple solutions effectively & successfully to business problems as an Enterprise Architect is sought by a service provider of Quality Certification and Cold Chain Management. Your core role will be to proactively and holistically lead enterprise responses to disruptive forces by identifying and analysing the execution of change toward the desired business vision and targeted outcomes. You will also conduct enterprise analysis and design on how information, business and technology solutions should work together to successfully execute the business objectives with integration of new technologies to support digital transformation. The ideal candidate requires Grade 12/Matric, BSc/Degree in IT/IS/Comp Sci or similar, ITIL and/or COBIT Certification, Architecture Framework Certified (TOGAF, etc.) with 7 or more years relevant work experience with at least 5 years or more deploying and using Enterprise Architecture methods and tools.
DUTIES:
  • Guide and advise stakeholders about disruptive technologies and trends.
  • Work with business peers to develop and present business capability models and roadmaps to facilitate discussion and decision making with stakeholders across the enterprise.
  • Develop diagnostic and actionable deliverables that help business guide investment decisions in support of executing business strategy.
  • Present a gap analysis and/or IT investment roadmap that reflects the status of the existing IT estate, namely, its ability to contribute to future-state business capabilities around ecosystems and digital platforms.
  • Develop and execute an implementation plan for Enterprise Architecture based on business requirements and IT strategies.
  • Construct technology-enabled operating models and provide viable options and visibility into execution issues.
  • Scan the world for major disruptive technology and nontechnology trends (trendspotting) that affect business.
  • Provide practical advice and best practices to overcome these challenges and successfully deliver the expected business outcomes without compromising on security.
  • Develop, maintain, Implement and govern the enterprise architecture across the organisation with responsibility for defining the EA.
  • Seek opportunities to highlight how digital business initiatives will potentially impact business and IT architecture and metrics.
  • Formulate, translate, advocate, support and execute business strategy to achieve the organisation's targeted business outcomes.
  • Lead the analysis of business and operating models, market trends and the technology industry to determine their potential impact on the enterprise's business strategy, direction and architecture.
  • Oversee and guide the Integration of the Architecture Domains
    • Ensure that the architecture of the enterprise is optimised.
    • That all Architecture Domains (Business Architecture, Data Architecture, Application Architecture, Technology Architecture) integrate (and inter-operate) in a cost-effective manner, with minimum effort and maximum benefit to the organisation.
  • Provide leadership with business cases to enable solution investment decisions that balance and prioritise current operational demands, disruptions, and opportunities with business strategy.
  • Guide the technology, design patterns, design constructs and the (re-usable) solution building blocks that make up a Solution Architecture, defining a Conceptual Solution Architecture.
  • Identify and analyse the organisation's business drivers and business development strategies (so as to derive useful business context.
  • Analyse of the current IT ecosystem to detect critical deficiencies and Pain Points.
  • Recommend solutions for overall Business and Technology innovation and optimisation / improvement that will increase sustainability.
  • Deliver Innovation to enable the digital transformation objectives.
  • Responsible for the Business Analysis Functional team within the ICT division.
  • Deliver models (blueprints) that describe the current and future state of the enterprise.
  • Develop road maps, principles, standards and best practices.
  • Proactively assist in defining the direction for projects.
  • Constantly integrate beneficial emerging technologies.
  • Provide factual content to the feasibility studies that are needed for standard development projects and enhancements.
  • Align with the organisation's technology and governance strategies, policies and standards - or direct necessary changes to these.
REQUIREMENTS:
Qualifications
  • Grade 12 with a Degree in Information Systems; BSc Comp Sci, Information Technology or a similar.
  • ITIL and/or COBIT Certification.
  • Architecture Framework Certified (TOGAF, etc.).
Experience/Skills
  • 7 or more years of experience in at least three disciplines, such as Business, Information, Solution or Technical Architecture, Application Development, Middleware, Information Analysis, Database Management or Operations in a multitier environment minimum of 2 years in Business Process Design.
  • 5 Years or more experience in deploying and using Enterprise Architecture methods and tools.
  • 5 Years or more business experience in Strategic, Business and IT Planning and/or Business Analysis.
  • Strong knowledge of main Architecture Frameworks.
  • Strong working knowledge of Architecture domains.
  • Up-to-date understanding of latest technology and trends, e.g., Cloud technology; IOT; Data, Security, etc.
  • Legislative Frameworks.
  • Knowledge of business models, operating models, financial models, cost-benefit analysis, budgeting and risk management.
  • Familiarity with Information Management practices, System Development Life Cycle Management, IT Services Management, Infrastructure and Operations, EA, COBIT and ITIL frameworks, Security, Data Management.
  • Knowledge of business ecosystems, SaaS, Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), SOA, APIs, Open Data, Microservices, Event-driven IT, Cloud (and Multicloud), Containers and Predictive Analytics.
  • Exposure and understanding of existing, new and emerging technologies, and processing environments.
  • Knowledge of all components of holistic Enterprise Architecture.
  • Knowledge of Business Engineering principles and processes.
  • Familiarity with basic graphical modeling approaches, tools and model repositories.
  • Ability to translate business needs into EA requirements and technology solutions.
  • Ability to estimate the financial impact of EA alternatives.
  • Ability to rapidly comprehend the functions and capabilities of new technologies.
  • Capable and comfortable with balancing time between foundational EA (Mode 1: ensures efficiency and predictability) and vanguard EA efforts (Mode 2: concerned with speed, agility and flexibility to achieve a unified and flexible EA that meets business needs).
  • Ready to think, behave and act in an innovative consulting manner to drive the organisation's digital business strategies.
ATTRIBUTES:
  • Ability to gain trust and respect as a Thought Leader who can influence and persuade business and IT leaders.
  • Comfortable, experienced and accomplished at working with business executives, and able to push back in a professional and diplomatic way.
  • Highly collaborative with business and offers support and guidance to its ideals and strategies.
  • Vendor- and technology-neutral more interested in business outcomes than in personal. Does not support those business and IT leaders with vested personal preferences.
  • Unflappable in the face of opposition to architectural ideals.
  • Practical in approach to decision making and problem solving.
  • Organizationally savvy and understanding of the political climate of the enterprise and how to navigate obstacles and politics.
  • Ability to balance the long-term ("big picture") and short-term implications of individual decisions.

Job purpose:

As a Level 2 Engineer you'll be responsible for the analysis of data and information within the company. You will work closely with other teams to gather, cleanse and make sense of raw data so that it can be used by other departments or in further analysis. You will also help ensure that systems are configured correctly and securely, as well as ensure compliance with all relevant regulations. In this role, you may liaise with architects on matters such as building plans or design changes within a set timeframe. You should have previous experience in one or more analytics related roles (such as analyst).

With over 900 employees spread across the USA, EMEA & APAC, and India, 40 different nationalities combined; we create compelling digital experiences to help our clients create the best human-centric products. Our expertise includes Strategy, Design, Product Engineering, Analytics, and Cloud Services. Each day, 50 million users interact with our solutions.

Our teams are inspired by technology but it doesn’t rule them. We love to learn, we are curious by nature and driven to make a mark. Job Purpose
The Credit Risk Manager is responsible for the management of Credit Risk across the lifecycle of the unsecured loans portfolio. This not only includes being able to provide the strategic direction for the portfolio but also being able to undertake in-depth analysis of the portfolio.

This position involves utilising insights gained from analytics to inform decision-making related to credit strategy and to determine the effectiveness of previous strategies implemented.

Being responsible for Credit Risk across the lifecycle is a fantastic opportunity to broaden your skills set and be an end-to-end portfolio owner. This is a hands-on role so be prepared to roll up your sleeves and get into the detail.

Core skills and knowledge
Key Responsibilities
  • Develop, implement and monitor credit strategies across the credit lifecycle for unsecured loans
  • (small value, short term loans). These will include but are not limited to cut-off strategies, riskbased pricing and limit allocation strategies and collections strategies.
  • Undertake in-depth credit risk analysis across the lifecycle and produce insights and value adding monitoring on a monthly and ad hoc basis
  • Monitor and evaluate credit risk strategies implemented to ensure that they are within risk
  • appetite
  • Devise and set-up champion challenger strategies and monitor the effectiveness thereof
  • Run the monthly impairment model and produce the related provisioning paper for discussion
  • and sign-off by the key stakeholders
  • Enhance the existing monthly and ad hoc reporting to identify trends, improve insights into the
  • portfolio and drive Credit strategy as a result
  • Provide direction and guidance to cross-functional teams to ensure that credit strategies and
  • models are implemented as expected and obtain the desired outcome.
Qualification and Experience:
  • BCom Honours in Economics, Finance, or related disciplines or alternatively a BSC Degree in
  • Statistics or Mathematics (Quantitative degree) or equivalent.
  • Analytical skills (ability to extract and analyse large volumes of data), coding skills (SQL, SAS,
  • Python or related skills), model building skills (provision and scoring models would be
  • advantageous), credit strategy development skills, presentation development (PowerPoint) &
  • presentation skills, the ability to solve potentially complex problems and communicate the
  • problem and outcome in a simplified manner, detail orientation and excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • 5 Years + working in a Credit Risk environment preferably in an acquisitions role and preferably already at management level (note that management experience can be less than 5 years).
  • Experience and exposure across the other parts of the Credit Risk lifecycle (Existing Customer Management, Collections Strategy and Provisions) would be advantageous. Any experience in
  • Fraud or Compliance analytics would also be advantageous.
Successful Candidate Should have:
  • The ability to operate both at a strategic and operational level
  • Be a proactive individual who is a self-starter and gets things done
  • The ability to work well with people and collaborate to develop practical and simple solutions to
  • potentially complex credit related problems
  • Good stakeholder management ability and the ability to develop relationships across senior and
  • junior levels
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • An innate drive to succeed and a passion for credit as a tool to improve the lives of the poor
  • Commercial savviness and the ability to balance the risk/reward equation

display_title: Post-Graduate Research Fellow (1 Year Fixed Term Contract) Wits AGINCOURT
job_description:
Main purpose of the job:

  • Assess, interpret, and evaluate outcomes of research and processes to ensure that the outputs are delivered on time with the desired outcomes

Location:

  • Wits/MRC Rural Public Health and Health Transitions Research Unit of the School of Public Health, University of the Witwatersrand, Johannesburg

The MRC/Wits Rural Public Health and Health Transitions Research Unit (Agincourt) is an exceptional health and population research center in the Wits School of Public Health. The Unit supports a major research infrastructure underpinned by a health and socio-demographic surveillance system (HDSS), a form of longitudinal population registration, covering the Agincourt sub-district of rural Mpumalanga Province adjacent to Mozambique that has been in operation since 1992 coupled with observational and intervention studies along the life course. The Unit seeks to appoint a highly qualified individual to support mental and neurological health and well-being research currently underway in the Unit. The role of this individual involves engaging with senior Unit scientists to actively develop and lead data analysis and production of scientific outputs, including scientific manuscripts and written and oral presentations and reports. The ideal candidate will have documented training and experience in data management and analysis as well as experience working in health-related research setting with evidence of scientific output. We offer an intellectually rich working environment with excellent opportunities for professional growth. This is an in-person position - we offer a conducive and flexible working environment. This position is based in Johannesburg, but there will be some requirements for travel to the rural field site.

Key performance areas:

Data & Analysis

  • Lead in the generation and curation of tailor-made datasets to support the ongoing efforts of senior Unit scientists
  • Support the generation of scientific questions and lead in the analysis to address these questions

Scientific Output

  • Lead the production of manuscripts emanating from the analysis conducted
  • Present findings locally, regionally, and internationally at relevant venues, including conferences, ad hoc meetings, and symposia

Mentorship & Support

  • Support the development of junior colleagues by providing technical and scientific input, mentorship, and guidance

Required minimum education and training:

  • A Masters level qualification in Statistics/Biostatistics/Epidemiology/Demography/Data Analytics/Bioinformatics/Data Science/Computer Science or other highly quantitative and computational field
  • A doctoral qualification will be highly advantageous

Desirable additional education, work experience, and personal abilities:

  • At least 2 years of working with a research organization in a documented position requiring data management and analysis
  • Experience working with a scientific/research team
  • At least one peer-reviewed, published scientific manuscript in an accredited journal (with evidence of lead authorship)
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail
  • Management of large, complex datasets
  • Proficiency with a commonly recognized statistical package (eg. Stata, R, SPSS, or SAS)
  • Team player able to work in a high-performing collaborative environment, and support scientific investigations across disciplines
  • Exceptional interpersonal and leadership skills
  • Excellent report-writing skills
  • Effective time management skills and ability to work independently and under pressure

TO APPLY:

  • Only if you do meet the minimum job requirements and experience as mentioned above, you may submit a detailed updated CV.
  • Please Apply Online.
  • Please take note that the applicants who do not adhere to the above criteria will not be considered for the respective position.
  • The closing date for all applications: 19 July 2023.
  • Note AJ Personnel is fully POPI compliant.
  • Note WHC, in accordance with their Employment Equity goals and plan, will give preference to suitable applicants from designated groups as defined in the Employment Equity Act 55 of 1998 and subsequent amendments thereto.

Please note:

  • AJ PERSONNEL is only responsible for the advertising of the advertisement on behalf of their client Wits Health Consortium.
  • Wits Health Consortium will only respond to shortlisted candidates.
  • Candidates who have not been contacted within two weeks of the closing date can consider their applications to be unsuccessful.
  • AJ Personnel does not have any salary or other information regarding the position.

Revenue Manager (Gauteng, Centurion)

ANEW Hotels & Resorts are seeking a Revenue Manager, to join our winning team. The Revenue Manager will assist in the delivery of hotel revenue and profit growth by maximising revenue for rooms. This will be done through effective pricing strategies, implementation of achievable revenue plans and production of historical data.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Assist Marketing and General Managers in creating promotional campaigns which drive RevPAR growth.
  • Create and develop pricing strategies, including building rates for rooms and packages, and determining discounts and specialty rates, in conjunction with the individuality of each hotel.
  • Provide monthly dynamic forecast of expected results, variances, and budget comparisons.
  • Responsible for assessing, analyzing, and pricing group business strategies.
  • Evaluate the prices of our competition, as well as analyze economic trends to determine the demand for hotel reservations based on leisure and business travel.
  • Yearly Rate Builder completion in conjunction with General Managers as per set guidelines.

Minimum Requirements

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in a Revenue Management position
  • Tertiary Qualification
  • Experience in Rate Strategy Development
  • Advanced knowledge of the procurement process and of Government, Corporate and Leisure Travellers
  • Advanced Data Analytics Skills
  • A proven track record increasing hotel revenues

Should you believe you have all the required qualifications and skills to fulfil this role, and add value to ANEW Hotels & Resorts, please send your CV to apply with the title REVENUE MANAGER by no later than the 17th of July 2023.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contracted. If you have not received a response in 14 days, please consider your application as having been unsucessful.

display_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Data Science (PhD) Wits VIDA
job_description:
Main purpose of the job:

  • The incumbent will provide data support to all VIDA studies, review and refine data collection tools, design, develop and maintain databases, perform logic-based data validation rules for quality assurance on data, timely reporting, and documentation

Location:

  • VIDA – Chris Hani Baragwanath Academic Hospital, Soweto, Johannesburg, Gauteng

Key performance areas:

Technical Data Management and Analytics

  • Contribute to refining, structuring, and development of CRFs for various studies
  • Unveil the insights of all in-house databases, providing advice to study leads and senior scientists on potential research topics to be explored
  • Draw up the specifications for harmonized data sets and share them with external stakeholders
  • Automate repetitive manual processes through scripting and design models for data cleaning, validation, and reporting
  • Address complex data queries as soon as they are identified from the field
  • will create a linkage between HDSS, Pregnancy surveillance, PNS Study, and other studies and employ explorative measures to merge these databases and their different objectives
  • Document and ensure that the harmonized data and transformation procedures used to make the analytical data sets can be understood and used by leadership
  • Ensure that data backup procedures are solid and regular to prevent any potential data loss
  • Develop a strong version control system to keep track of current and historic data to facilitate analysis and publications
  • Contribute to the development of VIDA data strategic plans and direction
  • Provide input into the development of SOPs and policies relating to studies in accordance with ethical and GCP requirement

Staff Management and Capacity Development

  • Contribute towards the development of team/company knowledge
  • Foster an environment that promotes talent recognition, development as well as agency and individual leadership; promote harmony, teamwork, and sharing of information
  • Mentor, coach and facilitate personal and professional staff development wherever possible
  • Manage staff effectively including performance, conduct, efficient working, processes, and corrective action as required

Customer Service

  • Communicate with donor representatives around compliance issues as and when required
  • Ensure all customer interaction (Both internal and external customers) is of the highest professional level, E.g. Respond to emails/queries within two days
  • Build and maintain authentic relationships with all stakeholders ensuring that all interactions are professional
  • Effectively manage work processes in order to maintain high levels of productivity

Effective Self-Management and performance ownership

  • Take ownership and accountability for responsibility areas, demonstrate effective self-management, and demonstrate team and individual leadership and collaboration to support everyone’s combined and individual objectives
  • Follow through to ensure that quality and productivity standards of own work are consistently and accurately maintained
  • Take ownership of driving your own career development by participating in ongoing training and development activities such as forums, conferences, policy-setting workshops, etc.
  • Manage internal and external stakeholder expectations and communicate appropriately with initiative and solutions
  • Support and drive the business’ core values; maintain a positive attitude and respond openly to feedback

Required minimum education and training:

  • A PhD in Data Science qualification or equivalent
  • A postdoctoral qualification will be advantageous

Required minimum work experience:

  • 2 Years’ experience in data management and analysis working in a research environment

Desirable additional education, work experience, and personal abilities:

  • Experience in processing large complex longitudinal datasets and experience in relational database management
  • Knowledge of Relational Database management systems
  • Demonstrated knowledge of statistics, and proficiency using a statistical software package such as STATA or R for import, export, manipulation, and analysis of large datasets
  • Team player able to work in a high-performing collaborative environment, and support scientific investigations across disciplines
  • Ability to set priorities and work under pressure on a variety of tasks concurrently

Duties and ResponsibIlities

  • Attend Branch stock-takes (at branch site and off-site warehouses from start to finish. (Approximately 8 stock-takes every week over an 8-week period, every quarter). Stock-takes generally held on a Thursday (afternoon/evening), Friday (may extend into the evening), sometimes on a Saturday.
  • Independently verify that accounting records accurately represent the physical stock on the floor. Assess quality and condition of stock for impairment.
  • Perform planning and analytical procedures prior to the count to identify areas of risk and potential stock write-offs. Perform analysis and comparisons from previous stock-takes, taking into account stock losses from cycle counts and stock-adjustments.
  • Ensuring that stock valuation is accurate.
  • Perform testing at the stock-take ensuring the stock-take procedures are followed by the Branch.
  • Walk-through of the warehouse to identify stock to be counted / stock to be excluded from the count, stock adjustments and physical stock agree (stock to be dumped or returned to suppliers), risk of theft during the count is reduced (blind-spots).
  • Ensure prior and after the stock-take that the necessary ERP/BI reports are run and agree to the Branch reports.
  • Perform and document sample counts and ensure that it agrees to branch counts and captured quantities.
  • Ensure that proper cut-off is done by the Branch, by re-performing cut-off testing.
  • Identifying slow or obsolete stock that should be written-off / segregated form the count.
  • Identifying expired stock to be written off.
  • Review manual stationery relating to stock and re-perform procedures to ensure that necessary documents have been processed.
  • Ensuring count team controls are adhered to. Shadow teams during the count.
  • Ensuring that manual count sheet administration and controls are adhered to.
  • Ensuring scan enabled warehouses – necessary count procedures are followed.
  • Run variance reports and agree this to the Branch reports and to the ERP system.
  • Perform own sample variance counts and ensure that final variance values are accurate.
  • Review that OHS and Food Safety standards are followed at stock-take.
  • Review property inspections whilst at the stock-take.
  • Ensure that gains and losses are approved prior to posting of stock entries.
  • Liaison with branch management and person responsible for the stock-take.
  • Documenting work done on working papers to be presented for review to the Audit Manager/Audit Executive.
  • Drafting of audit findings noting areas of weakness/deficiency with stock-take and operational control breakdowns, draft recommendation to improve controls and procedures. Draft audit report for management comment after the stock-take.
  • In periods between stock-takes – assist audit team with projects, data analytic testing and control self-assessments.
  • Perform ad-hoc tasks assigned by management.

Qualifications, Experience and Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in business/ internal audit/finance or related field a plus
  • Minimum Three (3) years' experience as an inventory auditor or stock controller, warehouse operational background (FMCG)\
  • Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, and Excel), ERP and BI systems
  • Mandatory: Being able to work at heights (medically fit and certified to work at heights training to be done by the company)
  • Able to work in a freezer/chiller environment
  • Physically able to stand and walk for extended periods.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Able to work night, weekends, extended hours, and potentially holidays
  • Vehicle and valid drivers licence. Will be required to drive to nearby cities from Johannesburg.
  • Up to date Passport
  • Availability to travel extensively and reside away from home at least 3 to 4 nights weekly in an 8-week period, every quarter. (both locally in South Africa and in neighbouring countries)
  • Goal-oriented, organized team player
  • Accurate and precise attention to detail
  • Deadline driven
  • Ability to apply common sense to all tasks.
  • Able to analyse problems and strategize for better solutions
  • Good interpersonal skills to work with management and staff at all levels
  • Able to pass drug test/background check

Job Summary
Responsible for the overall email, campaign creation and execution in our marketing automation platform (Eloqua). The successful candidate for this role will work closely with onshore Campaign Managers and Content Executives to drive efficient and accurate campaign execution. Deep understanding of email campaign best practices is necessary. The Campaign Associate will partner with the marketing team to monitor email timing, metrics and continuously provide recommendations to drive highly targeted emails to the appropriate audiences.

  • Data and Analytics Management: Ability to understand, analyze, gather and organize data in an account management tool or database and marries the results gathered and tasks accomplished with industry specific trends and demographics
  • Campaign Management: Ability to conceptualize, create and execute an effective campaign journey across a variety of platforms
  • Web Development and Optimization: Ability to manage, implement, execute optimized content and web framework and analyze digital performance

Hard/Technical, Soft Skills and Complimentary Skills
  • Experience with campaign setup, email creation and deployment, HTML editing, delivery monitoring and reporting

  • Knowledge of landing page and email marketing best practices is required
  • Strong problem solving and issue-resolution skills
  • Can handle multiple tasks at a time and has the ability to manage their time efficiently
Other Qualifications/Requirements:
  • Must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree, any field
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in a similar role

Our client, a leader in the rail and mining solutions industry, has an exciting opportunity for a Remote Monitoring Engineer to join their dynamic team. This permanent position is well suited to an individual that is looking to advance their career in a thriving and supportive workplace.


Role Summary / Purpose:

The Monitoring Engineer will use cutting edge predictive analytics software and tools to analyze the health and performance of mining processes located around the world using remote monitoring technology. In this position, the Monitoring Engineer will establish a trusted advisor relationship with external customers. You will collaborate with internal product and engineering teams in the Digital Mine business to help improve our product and service offerings to the mining industry.


Essential Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for process monitoring with support from a subject matter expert in the Performance Optimization Center.
  • The Remote Monitoring Engineer must leverage industry experience, knowledge, software know-how, and customer satisfaction skills to deliver world class process monitoring to assigned customer accounts.
  • Establish a deep understanding of our customers business and technical needs. Help identify opportunities, problems, and solutions across the Mining flow sheet.
  • Quickly learn and understand engineering processes related to mining industries, leveraging the experience of the greater team where necessary.
  • Quickly master cutting edge predictive analytics software and tools.
  • Be familiar with Process Control, Process Optimization, Asset Performance Management and Safety Concepts.
  • Support and maintain solutions at customers, remotely
  • Deftly manage customer expectations and satisfaction for assigned customer accounts.
  • Create a “trusted technical advisor” relationship with our customer's technologists and internal technical teammates.

Qualifications / Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college in Chemical, Metallurgical or Process Engineering, post-graduate qualification will be beneficial
  • Minimum 3+ years’ experience in mining processing operations
  • Practical Mining Processing industry knowledge
  • Production process problem solving capability, with preference of applying Advanced Analytics
  • Software and/or optimization background, including analytics background and practical experience in one or more of the following: process monitoring and automation, PID control loop performance monitoring and tuning, Process Optimization, Advanced Process Control, Model Predictive Control, process modeling, data mining, industrial instrumentation, will be beneficial
  • Strong written and verbal skills, at engineering and staff levels
  • Fluent written and verbal communication in English
  • Technical leadership potential, with excellent client facing and presentation skills
  • Office / monitoring center-based job, but with ability and willingness to travel as and when required

Job Description

About our client:

Our purpose is making life better. We are a global healthcare provider delivering measurable clinical quality through a diversified offering and a people-centered approach.

Role

Business Reporting Management, reporting to the Head: Analytics.

The successful candidate will be responsible for executing and delivering the company’s reporting and visualization strategy and requirements, providing guidance and expertise across various business functions by transforming data and providing valuable, actionable insights. The role will entail leading a team of data analysts, visualization and reporting specialists and BI solutions architects, ensuring timeous and high impact delivery.

Key Responsibilities

  • Responsible for coordinating business reporting tasks for the organization, including creating effective strategies to analyze information, conduct research, and implement reporting solutions for products and services.
  • Work with the Head: Analytics to understand key business questions and develop reporting approaches to inform solutions.
  • Work with the Data Development Manager to identify data transformations and pipelines to optimize the delivery of reporting insights.
  • Implement tools and strategies to translate raw data into valuable business insights.
  • Supervise efficient delivery of all Data Analytics and Business Reporting projects, based on solid requirements analysis, to ensure consistent project realization of objectives.
  • Supervise and ensure efficient performance of employees in the function.
  • Assess all reporting requirements and develop a long-term strategy for various reporting solutions.
  • Coordinate with the data team and ensure compliance with all enterprise data governance standards.
  • Monitor the work of the Business Reporting team and ensure effective implementation of all projects to achieve all client objectives.
  • Develop a BI service culture that builds rewarding relationships, proposes innovations and allows others to provide exceptional client service.
  • Ensure that the BI Toolset is aligned with the data and analytics strategy

Required Experience/Qualifications

  • Minimum Bachelors degree in statistics, actuarial science, mathematics, computer science or engineering.
  • 5+ years experience in a similar role, with a track record of delivering data-driven reports to businesses and understanding business needs from this reporting role.
  • 1+ years of management experience
  • Healthcare experience will be an advantage, especially in a hospital environment.

Salary

R72000.00

The company has mandated that all employees be COVID-19 vaccinated.

Description: A new and exciting opportunity has arisen in Europe’s leading independent provider of IT infrastructure services. We are looking for a Problem Manager within the newly formed Proactive Insights Team within the BP&O Optimisation Department.


The Proactive Insights Team main objective is to issue prevention, automation or to reduce effort for Computacenter and our customers. This is achieved by using ITIL proactive problem methodology, enhanced tooling, and robust processes.


Requirements:

As a Proactive Problem Manager, you are required to:

  • Be enthusiastic and drive a proactive, pre-emptive and automation culture, focused on reducing reported Incident volumes as well as system events and improved user experience.
  • Have a good understanding and experience of using ITSM tools to facilitate Problem Management.
  • Be responsible for managing and prioritising your own workload and identifying successful proactive Problem opportunities.
  • Drive root cause analysis for the Problems opportunities identified towards issue removal, automation, and effort reduction, in line with the defined Computacenter Problem Management process using ITIL framework.
  • Produce high level reporting and business updates to both Computacenter and our customers, which Cleary define the value added from the service.
  • Maintain a proactive Problem tracker and ensure all Problem opportunities are documented in the ITSM toolset
  • Build and maintain relationships with key operational teams such as, Reactive Problem management, Delivery Leadership, Service Desk, Remote Desktop Services, Technical teams, Automation team and all functions within Optimisation.

Qualifications/Experience/Sills:

  • Experience of ITIL framework, preferably with prior exposure to Problem Management and Incident Management roles
  • Intermediate skills using Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook with previous exposure to Teams and SharePoint desirable
  • Working knowledge of Service Now and BMC Remedy ITSM tools
  • Exposure or knowledge of data analytic tools such as Power BI and Nexthink
  • Desire to expand abilities in data analysis and proactive problem solving.
  • Ability to deliver successfully within predefined timescales.
  • A self-starter, who can take the imitative but also able to collaborate within a team.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication ENGLISH & GERMAN with the ability to pitch communications (verbally and written) for different audiences.
  • Effective time management, organisational and workload management skills to ensure delivering work is not effected by the volume of work or conflicting priorities.
  • Ability to present in a professional and business-like manner to internal and external customers
  • Ability to manage confidential information with tact and sensitivity
  • ITIL v3 or V4 Foundation Level is preferable

Location: Cape Town

Remuneration: Market Related

Overview: Based at our Head Office in Cape Town, this position requires that you to find innovative ways to leverage the vast amount of data and information at your disposal to create customer strategies that drive up profit within constraints. Work within the Risk and Analytics department to enhance the company’s performance by providing information, analyses, reports and technical support for the development and implementation of strategic solutions.


Key responsibilities:

  • Assist team to achieve a balanced credit portfolio by accurately forecasting expected results
  • Develop and implement champion/challenger customer strategies that deliver performance in line with Board expectations
  • Monitor portfolio performance and ensure book performance meet pre-defined KPI’s by pro-actively proposing changes
  • Investigating data integrity issues, testing assumptions and validating analytical results, ensuring accuracy of findings
  • Create new account management strategies to optimise the business objectives within specific constraints
  • Undertaking analysis to determine the impact of strategy changes to areas of application and account management strategies
  • Presenting ideas via reports and presentations, outlining findings and making recommendations for improvements to senior stakeholders
  • Forecasting and monitoring implemented strategies using statistical techniques
  • Project manage the implementation of strategy changes into live systems

Key requirements:

  • Relevant post-graduate degree with mathematical or statistical oriented subjects
  • 2 or more years’ experience in consumer credit (within a Credit Risk analytics environment) with demonstrated ability to implement solutions based on findings from analytical projects
  • Understanding of the credit life cycle
  • Revolving store card or credit card experience advantageous
  • Ability to work efficiently under pressure and within structured and unstructured parameters
  • High attention to detail driving a need for 100% accuracy
  • High level of integrity and confidentiality
  • Experienced user of Microsoft Office suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
  • Experience in SAS (base and/or Enterprise Guide and/or SAS Viya) advantageous

Job Description

Reference Number: SF42

Job Description:

An exciting new B2B Marketplace and e-procurement start-up is seeking a Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to join them to drive the building, rollout, and growth of an Enterprise B2B Marketplace & E-Procurement solution.

The organization is seeking a hands-on, driven, and innovative product oriented Chief Technology Officer to guide and implement the company’s Engineering, Technology, and Product execution.

Responsibilities:

The CTO will be a member of the Management Team reporting to the Chief Executive Officer. Responsibilities will cover:

Strategy

  • Develop the overall technical strategy for the organisation.
  • Design the best strategy for the organisation's ability to scale, in a very exciting market space which has been further supported by the current climate and the shift to online shopping in the B2B space.
  • Maximise the returns and benefits of investments in technology and tools.
  • Communicate the company’s technology strategy to management, investors, staff, partners, customers, and stakeholders.
  • Identify market obstacles and technical hurdles and manage risks appropriately.
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of technology standards, industry trends, emerging technologies & innovations and software development best practice and apply as appropriate.
  • Own the development of the technology budget and ensure that projects are on time and within scope.
  • Set definitions of standards, policies, procedures, and metrics.

Team

  • Provide technical thought leadership and insight that inspires and motivates the team.
  • Hiring, retaining, growing, and motivating excellent teams, building a culture of learning, knowledge sharing and technical excellence, with a strong focus on inclusivity and diversity.
  • Train, mentor, and coach the development team (hire as needed).
  • Foster a collaborative, positive and “can do” culture within the technical team.
  • Leverage data analytics to measure engineering and product team progress against goals.
  • Work closely with the product team to ensure technology roadmap is closely aligned to and supports customer needs and long-term product roadmap.
  • Creating and championing a culture of cutting-edge product delivery techniques that will motivate, develop, and grow the team to continually innovate and become a market leader in the industry.

Architecture

  • Lead decisions on application architecture and infrastructure design that is realistic, affordable, achievable, and able to support scalability, robustness, and successful “bullet-proof” product delivery.
  • Oversees the whole technological framework of the organization.
  • Make decisions on technology selection including whether to “buy or build” as appropriate.
  • Establish the technology architecture requirements to support the growing and changing needs of the business.
  • Develop solutions able to be rolled out in rapid phases, where each phase builds on the success of the previous phase in an adaptable and logical manner, focussed on driving revenues, profits and growth.
  • Create and manage documentation of system's design, features, and functions.

Responsibilities will also include:

  • Oversee all technical elements including pre-sales, implementation, and delivery of projects.
  • The CTO will spend time strategizing, planning projects, budgeting, and managing their execution in conjunction with the team and external partners. Executing the most effective technical roadmap and future proofing.
  • Work directly with the executive leadership team to define linkages between strategic objectives, process improvements, and project execution out of the engineering and product organizations.
  • Develop and facilitate workshop, client and conference presentations and demos showcasing the organisation’s technology.
  • Lead the development of the engineering and product teams and take responsibility for their growth and execution of Company objectives.
  • Manage all technology functions of the organisation’s- hardware, software, and related resources.
  • Supervise web application and software development quality assurance.
  • Build / recruit, manage and grow the engineering and technical team to align with the overall corporate culture and strategy.
  • Communicate technology strategy and functionality to investors, clients, partners, and prospective clients.
  • Develop the group’s IT vision & strategy.
  • Leading teams through the software product development, sales, and deployment processes.
  • Developing goals and strategies for IT and Ops.
  • Manage the technology infrastructure of our B2B Trade ecosystem, including deployment, integration, systems management, and the development of technical operations personnel.
  • Manage vendor relations to ensure that service expectations are delivered.
  • Ensure that technical resources are available to meet the company's short and long-term needs.
  • Analyse and improve upon technology standards across the organisation.
  • Define, architect, and carry out the organizational and infrastructure plan required to carry out the company's business and technology strategies.
  • Creating an enticing technology strategy and vision.
  • Define, architect, and carry out the organizational and infrastructure plan required to carry out the company’s business and technology strategies.
  • Ensure that technical resources are available to meet the company’s short and long-term needs.
  • Monitor the management of all hardware, software, databases, and licences, as well as maintenance and future needs projections.
  • Recruit, train, manage and scale a talented technology team dedicated to developing innovative solutions that are in line with the company’s business model, values, and vision.
  • Managing technology budgets and time frames.
  • Understanding market dynamics and converting them into innovation roadmaps.
  • Supervise all technology-related functions, such as software design and development, enterprise architecture, quality assurance, production operations and technical support.
  • Oversee the information security, disaster recovery, and business continuity operations of the organization.
  • Collaborate with internal functional teams to advance business capabilities.
  • Conduct technical evaluations of products or solutions to compare and assess their applicability.
  • Managing and building teams of developers & solution architects.

Requirements:

  • Optimally you have a Bachelor or Master's Degree in Business, Software Engineering & Application Development or Computer Science.
  • 10+ years' experience in Information Technology leadership, preferably including experience in payments / transaction processing within a B2B enterprise software, an ERP or AP2P company, or a bank / credit card processing environment.
  • Experience building and delivering B2B enterprise grade software applications.
  • The ideal candidate should have similar experience in the Retail / e-Commerce / Marketplace domain and be extremely passionate about driving technology and pushing the boundaries, whilst implementing solutions that are able to be implemented in a realistic, affordable, and timely manner.
  • Core knowledge of information system vulnerabilities and risk management is essential.
  • Have successfully lead enterprise technology organization or held senior position that included product development / management team etc.
  • Business development skills.
  • Financial knowledge, to budget for their organization’s technological needs.
  • Customer-focused – you are adept at running concurrent experiments and analyzing customer behavior / feedback in order to focus on the right developments.
  • Leadership – you excel at building and overseeing teams of developers. Embedding an efficient product development methodology.
  • Solution oriented – you are constantly searching for practical solutions. And are able to balance curiosity and drive to innovate with the requirement to get things done.
  • Communicator – you are able to work alongside the founders/stakeholders and communicate technical challenges and objectives easily and freely.
  • Communication skills, to help less technical people understand tech's role in achieving business goals.
  • Strategic – you provide strategic recommendations unprompted, rather than following a path already set.
  • Ability to design a product roadmap for the coming years. This includes the development strategy.
  • Be able to make technological choices (development technology, Data, hosting, machine learning).
  • Experience managing or building a marketplace & B2B products a huge plus.
  • Experience with C#, Python, Node JS, Angular JS, MySQL a huge plus.
  • Demonstrated leadership and success in complex, secure, high-volume, and highly available processing environments.
  • Experience in strategic planning with a proven ability to develop and execute a vision for the company's technical direction.
  • Strong understanding of high-performance cloud systems (AWS), big data and machine learning etc
  • Startup experience a huge plus.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills with an ability to interact with both junior and senior management and clients.

If you wish to apply for the position, please send your CV to Scott Fraser at sfraser@caglobalint.com

Please visit www.caglobalint.com for more exciting opportunities.

Scott Fraser

Manager | Managing Consultant

CA Finance
